loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel D. is from the village of Lumbo, Valencia City. She is 28 years old, married, and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Hazel owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling products such as hot dogs and dressed chickens in the local community. Hazel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Hazel joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Messan Sefako

texts.en: Messan Sefako K. is 31 years old, married, and has one child. He sells used clothing in the Hédzranawoé market in Lomé, Togo. Mr. K. began this business in 2000 and is now requesting his second loan from Kiva partner, WAGES. He will use his loan to restock his inventory of used clothing and keep up with the high demand in this busy location.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing for resale

loans.name: Bb. Girl Arlyn

texts.en:
Bb. Girl Arlyn B. is from the town of Poblacion, Valencia City. She is 25 years old, married, and has one infant-aged children. To make a living, Bb. Girl Arlyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Bb. Girl Arlyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Bb. Girl Arlyn joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Bb. Girl Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Awa

texts.en:
Awa D. is a 45-year-old married woman who is the mother of eight children. She runs a small grocery store where she sells mainly oil, rice and sugar.

Awa has been a member of the Banc Villageois Thiéckéne for three years and has always paid back her loans on time. She wants to use this loan in equal parts to buy oil, rice and sugar in order to stock up.

loans.use: To buy oil, rice and sugar for her shop.

loans.name: Mirna Apariza

texts.es: Mirna Apariza tiene 59 años, su negocio que es la compra y venta de ropa Inició su negocio hace mas de 4 años, pues siempre le ha gustado salir adelante, los créditos en la Fundación le han ayudado a cambiar su vida porque con ellos ha logrado incrementar las ventas. Ella quiere seguir ampliándolo, sueña con tener un local propio por lo que así sus clientes la visitarían y tendría nuevas posibilidades. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de trajes, camisetas, ropa interior y pantalones.
texts.en:
Mirna Apariza, age 59, has a business buying and selling clothing. She began this business more than 4 years ago because she has always liked getting ahead. Loans with the Foundation have helped change her life because they have succeeded in allowing her to increase sales. She wants to continue growing. She dreams of having her own shop for her customers to visit and in order to have new possibilities for her business. The loan she is applying for is for working capital so that she can purchase suits, T-shirts, underwear and trousers.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon E. is from the town of Poblacion, Valencia City. She is 48 years old, married, and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Corazon owns and operates a business venture in the food sector butchering and selling meat in the market. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from butchering and selling pork in the market. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Corazon joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Liah

texts.en:
Liah B. is from the village of Lantay, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Liah owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Liah has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Liah joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Liah is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Bayardo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Bayardo tiene 41 años, por lo que anteriormente ya había solicitado un financiamiento pues fue de gran ayuda. Posee un una pequeña industria de bolis que son refrescos en bolsa, los cuales luego sale a distribuir en una camioneta que posee. Algo que alega tener problemas actualmente es el alza del combustible, pero siempre está buscando la forma de salir adelante. Por lo que l crédito que solicita es para la compra de materia prima que necesita para su negocio. Su sueño consiste en realizar la compra de otro medio de transporte que le permita ampliar más la distribución de su negocio y poder brindar más estabilidad económica a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señor Bayardo, age 41, previously applied for a loan which was of great assistance. He has a small factory producing bolis, a soft drink sold in plastic bags. He then distributes this from his pickup truck.

He tells us that sometimes he has problems, currently with the rise in the price of fuel, but he is always looking for ways to progress. The loan he is applying for is for the purchase of raw materials that he needs for his business. His dream is to purchase another means of transport that will permit him to increase his business’ sales and offer more stable earnings for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha B. is from the village of Lantay, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 47 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Editha has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Editha joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Editha is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jessica Paola

texts.es:
Jessica S. es otra socia activa hace dos años del Banco Comunal  San Pablo   ubicado a unos 10 minutos a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca en la comunidad Rumiloma,  su gente se dedica principalmente a la  agricultura y ganadería mientras que los jóvenes migran a otras ciudades dentro y fuera del país en busca de  mejores oportunidades.

Jessica tiene 23 años de edad es casada y en su vida conyugal ha concebido  una hija que se encuentra de 4 años, su esposo es sastre de  profesión, aún no tienen casa propia al momento  viven  en casa de su suegra pero de manera independiente.


Nuestra socia se dedica a la cría de pollos los que luego vende en la Feria Libre o entrega a sus clientes en su comunidad,  realiza esta actividad hace dos años y es un apoyo para salir adelante con su familia también cría chanchos y tiene una vaca. Con el nuevo crédito que realiza va adquirir pollos y chanchos, alimento  para seguir con su negocio, su meta es de llegar a construir su casa y ampliar su negocio para así llegar a tener una mejor solvencia económica.
texts.en:
Jessica S. has been an active member of the San Pablo Communal Bank for two years. The bank is located on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. It is ten minutes away in the Rumiloma community. The people generally work in farming and livestock. The young people migrate to other cities within and outside of the country. They are looking for better opportunities. Jessica is 23 and married. They have a four year old daughter. Her husband is a tailor by profession. They do not have their own house, and for the moment they live in her mother-in-law’s house. But, they live in an independent way. She raises chickens, and then she sells them in the Feria Libre or she delivers them to her customers in her community. She has been doing this for two years. It helps her family get ahead. She also raises pigs, and she has a cow. With the new loan she will get chickens, pigs, and food to continue her business. Her goal is to build her house and to expand her business. That way she will come to have greater economic solvency.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens, pigs, and food for them in order to raise them and sell them

loans.name: Julia Xiomara

texts.es: Julia Xiomara es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora de 31 años de edad. Trabaja de una manera independiente pues su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, inició su negocio por esfuerzos propios con la venta de ropa más tarde es que decide recurrir a las casa comerciales para la venta de cosméticos,  al ver que tenia ciertos clientes decide mantener este negocio, ya que tiene la obligación de mantener a sus 2 hijos. Es por eso que realiza este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Por lo que sueña con mejorar seguirle brindando a su familia el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Julia Xiomara is an enterprising and hard-working 31 year old woman. She works in an independent way. She sells general merchandise. She started her business through her own efforts. She started selling clothes, and she later decided to turn to the commercial houses to sell cosmetics. Upon seeing that she had regular customers, she decided to maintain this business. She did this because she has an obligation to support her two children. That is why she is asking for this loan to buy raw material. She dreams of improving and continuing to provide her family with their daily bread.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ngara

texts.en:
Ngara D. is 52 years old, is married, and is the mother of four children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" Thieckene for nine years and was always able to pay back her loans on time.

Ngara D.’s main activity consists of selling dried fish but in addition to this she also sells cloth. She plans to buy more fish and fabrics with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and fabrics to sell

loans.name: Ledy Del Socorro

texts.es: Ledy Del Socorro es una trabajadora mujer de 40 años, desde hace 23 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, todo lo novedoso que pueda encontrar, ella tiene que buscar las diferentes fragancias que sus clientes le solicitan, esto le proporciona una gran credibilidad a sus clientes. Es así que se abastece de lo más variado y de buena calidad que pueda encontrar y posteriormente lo ofrece a sus diferentes clientes. Su facilidad de palabra y su gran poder de convencimiento han hecho de ella una gran vendedora. En un futuro, espera tener una tienda en el mercado donde pueda exhibir mejor sus artículos. Por lo que el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Ledy Del Socorro is a hard-working 40 year old woman. She has been selling cosmetics for 23 years. She sells all of the new products that she can find. She needs to look for the different fragrances that her customers request. This gives her great credibility with her customers. That is why she stocks herself with the most varied items and the best quality that she can find. She later offers these items to her different customers. Her ability with words and her great powers of persuasion have made her a great salesperson. In the future she hopes to have a store in the market where she can better display her items. The loan is for working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Crisaldo

texts.en:
Crisaldo M. is from the village of Lunao, Gingoog City. He is 38 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Crisaldo owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Crisaldo has been engaged in his business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Crisaldo joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crisaldo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Crisaldo is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his third from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his children's education.

About HSPFI

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophie Diamé is 40 years old. She is married and is the mother of four children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" Thieckene for six years and has always paid back her loans on time.

Sophie Diamé runs a shop in which she sells cosmetics. She will use the full amount of this loan to buy more cosmetics which she can then sell in her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es: Maria Soledad tiene 41 años. Por lo que no es la primera experiencia que ha tenido con los financiamientos. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa usada y ademas venta de refrescos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella desde muy joven ha trabajado, ya que además acude en una empresa a ofrecer la variedad de productos y así provecha a distribuir una gran variedad. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisetas, pantalones, faldas y ropa interior. Su deseo es que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios para que sean personas de bien y con un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Maria Soledad is 41 years old. This is not her first experience working with loans. She sells used clothing and also soft drinks. Maria has more than six years of experience in this business and has been working since she was a very young woman. Her business offers a variety of products, so she hopes to use this to her advantage.

The loan she is requesting will used as operating capital to buy shirts, pants, skirts, and undergarments. She wants her children to finish their studies so that they can become outstanding people and have a good future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy shirts, pants, skirts, and undergarments

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie P. is from the village of Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Elsie owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Elsie joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI

loans.name: Cosme

To make a living, Cosme owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruits like coconut and bananas. Cosme has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP per month from these activities.

He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield. Cosme is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will also be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be his second from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

loans.name: Maria Efigenia

texts.es: María Efigenia tiene mucha experiencia de financiamientos.  Es una mujer casada, tiene a su cargo 2 hijos. La actividad económica de ella es mercadería general, hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella inicia este negocio con la necesidad de obtener una fuente de ingresos para su familia. Este financiamiento que necesita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, cosméticos, bolsos y calzados. Los sueños de María son de establecer un negocio en la casa de habitación y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
María Efigenia has plenty of experience working with loans. She is a married woman with two dependent children. María sells general merchandise and has more than ten years of experience in this business. She started working because she needed to obtain a source of income for her family.

This loan is needed as operating capital for purchasing clothing, cosmetics, handbags, and footwear. María dreams of establishing a business in her home and improving her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy clothing, cosmetics, handbags, and footwear

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa S. is from the village of Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old. Elsa is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa is starting a business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling of coconuts, fruits & vegetables. Elsa is just starting this business.

In 2010, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as her working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Elsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “CORAZON D. JESUS”

“CORAZON D. JESUS” es una alcancía comunal integrada por 11 mujeres que a través D. sus esfuerzos han podido sacar adelante a sus familias D. la mejor manera que han podido.

María es parte D. esta alcancía comunal, a sus 48 años D. edad es madre soltera D. 3 hijos.  Años atrás María decidió dedicarse a la venta D. productos nutricionales, negocio que la ayudó mucho para cubrir los gastos D. su hogar, e incluso logró comprarse una computadora como herramienta para la educación D. sus hijos, pasaron unos años y su la mayor D. sus hijas empezó a darle una utilidad adicional a su computadora, entonces empezó a usarla para el servicio D. tipeo e impresiones.
María también se dedica a dar servicios D. buffet, al ofrecer sus productos naturales a diferentes zonas en la que vive, ha conocido a muchas personas las cuales en ocasiones tienen eventos como, bodas, bautizos, cumpleaños, etc. y ella vio en ello la oportunidad D. ofrecerles el servicio D. buffet al preparar el almuerzo o cena a los invitados D. dichos eventos.

María sueña con ver terminar a todos sus hijos la carrera que han elegido, también con tener una gran librería en la que se dedicaría todo el tiempo.
texts.en:
"Corazon D. Jesus" (Heart of Jesus) is a community bank formed by 11 women who through their efforts have been able to advance their families in the best way that they have been able.

Maria is part of this community bank. At 48, she is the single mother of three children. Years ago, Maria decided to sell nutritional products, a business that helped her very much in covering her household expenses, and she even succeeded in buying a computer as a tool for the education of her children. Some years passed, and her oldest daughter began to give the computer an additional use -- she began to use it for a typing and printing service.

Maria also provides buffet services. She offers her natural products in the different areas near where she lives. She has known many people who occasionally have events such as weddings, baptisms, birthdays, etc., and she saw in this the opportunity to offer buffet services, preparing the lunch or dinner for the guests at these events.

Maria dreams of having all her children complete their studies for the careers that they have chosen; she also dreams of having a big bookstore in which she would work full time.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Everlinda

texts.en:
Everlinda S. is from the village of Tambagan, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Everlinda is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Everlinda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Everlinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Everlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Everlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Everlinda is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Everlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: A. Cécile est née en 1970 à Zoungbomè, dans le département de l'Ouémé. Cécile vit depuis 20 ans à Missérété et est mariée à ODOU Moïse, un cultivateur. Le couple a trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et qui vivent ensemble avec leurs parents à Missérété. Cécile assure avec son mari les différentes charges de la famille. Cécile  n'a jamais été à l'école. Il y a près de cinq ans que Cécile produit de l'huile de palme, qu'elle vend au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Cécile se ravitaille en noix de palme au marché de Ouando. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits auprès de l'institution, crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Cécile sollicite un quatrième prêt, en vue de renforcer son activité et d'augmenter sa production, pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Cécile A. was born in Zoungbomè, in the Ouémé region. She has lived in Missérété for twenty years, and is married to Moïse Odou, a farmer. The couple has three school-aged children who live with them in Missérété,and Cécile and her husband look after their family's needs. Cécile never attended school. For the past five years she has processed palm oil which she sells at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Cécile also stocks up on palm kernels at Ouando. She is an existing client of ALIDé and has already benefited from three loans from the organisation, all of which have been successfully repaid. She is seeking a fourth loan in order to strengthen her business and increase her production to better meet her customers' needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing palm kernels for the production of palm oil

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia Z. is from the village of Damayuhan, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old. Cresencia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Cresencia owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling gasoline and used oil in the local community. Cresencia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Cresencia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cresencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Cresencia is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 15th loan taken out by Cresencia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Miguel está compuesto or cuatro socios, Rosemary (venta D. artóculos D. consumo diario, bananos y platanos), Walter (venta D. artículos D. consumo diario), Edgar (vetna D. artículos D. consumo diario), e Izabel (Venta D. fruta y comida). La mayoría D. los socios venden artículos D. consumo diario y todos viven en Bárcenas, Villa Nueva.

Rosemary tiene 15 años trabajando en su tienda D. consumo diario también tiene una venta D. plátanos y bananos el cual le genera ingresos para sostener a su familia, las otras socias también tienen su propio negocio D. consumo diario.

El sueño D. doña Rosemary y D. los demás socios es poder crecer como empresarios y poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos para que ellos puedan ser personas D. bien, también esperan tener más clientes.
texts.en:
The San Miguel Group consists of four members: Rosemary (who sells daily consumer products, bananas, and plantains), Walter (who sells daily consumer products), Edgar (who sells daily consumer products), and Izabel (who sells fruit and food). The members all live in Bárcenas, Villa Nueva.

Rosemary has been working 15 years in her store where she sells daily consumer products. She also sells bananas and plantains to generate income to support her family. The other members also have their own businesses.

Doña Rosemary and the other members dream of growing as entrepreneurs. This will allow them to proviD. a better future for their children so that they can develop into good people. They also hope to have more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more inventory

loans.name: Nueva Imagen Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal NUEVA IMAGEN, en su Secuencia 5, está formado por 8 clientes, todas  mujeres, la mayoría de las socias pertenecen a la Zona de Villa Copacabana, que están ubicados por la avenida principal y algunas socias viven por la zona de Valle Hermoso las socias se dedican a la venta de diversos productos como ser, ropa interior, cosméticos, venta en tienda de abarrotes. En la secuencia anterior todas cancelaron a excepción de dos socias que tuvieron problemas y pagaron con sus ahorros las cuales fueron retiradas del banco.
 
La Sra. Maria Es la representante, actualmente toma el cargo de la presidenta del banco se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa, cuenta con esta actividad hace 6  años, el préstamo será destinado a la compra de mercaderia al por mayor. Casada con el señor Juan, que trabaja como contador en una empresa de construcción, tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen de la socia, vive en la casa de sus papás.
En su banco comunal se ha destacado como una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos, por su trabajo la nombraron la líder del banco.

La Sra. Alejandra Socia que asume el cargo de tesorera del banco, se dedica a la venta de ropa interior (Lencería fina) en diferentes lugares ya sea en instituciones o  eventos especiales se dedica a esta actividad hace1 año, el préstamo esta destinado a ala inversión de capital. La socia es soltera sin hijos, asume el cargo por su  responsabilidad que ha demostrado dentro del banco como garante y como compañera de grupo. 

La Sra. Cecilia, activa y dinámica para la redacción es elegida como secretaria, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. El préstamo esta destinado para compra de cosmeticos que se encuentran en promocion y despues venderlos al precio original. Es separada y vive en la casa de sus familiares en la zona de Villa Copacabana.

Esta muy agradecida con Emprender y KIva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The NUEVA IMAGEN ("New Image") communal bank, currently in its fifth loan cycle, has 8 members, all of them women. Most of the members are located in the Villa Copacabana zone, along the main avenue, while other members live in the Valle Hermoso area. The members work selling diverse products, such as underwear, cosmetics, or groceries. In the previous loan cycle, all of the members made their payments except for two, who had problems and paid with their savings; they were removed from the communal bank. Maria is the group representative. She currently holds the position of president of the bank. Her work is selling cosmetics and clothing. She has pursued this activity for 6 years. The loan will be used to buy wholesale merchandise. She is married, and her husband Juan works as an accountant in a construction company. She has 2 children who are dependent on her, and she lives in her parents' home. Within her communal bank, Maria has distinguished herself as a responsable person who is punctual in her payments. Thanks to her hard work, she was named leader of the bank. Alejandra is a member who carries out the function of treasurer for the bank. Her work is selling undergarments (fine lingerie) in various places, including institutions, and at special events. She has worked in this field for 1 year. She will use the loan for capital investment. Alejandra is single with no children. She has taken on the position [of treasurer] thanks to the responsibility she has demonstrated within the bank as a guarantor and fellow group member. Cecilia, an active and dynamic person and a good writer, was chosen as secretary. Her work is selling cosmetics. She will use the loan to buy cosmetics which are currently on sale, in order to sell them later at their original price. She is separated and lives with family members in the Villa Copacabana zone. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for their confidence in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva S. is from the village of  Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Oliva is married and has 7 children. To make a living, Oliva owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Oliva is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Oliva from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Bolivia Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal BOLIVIA, en su Secuencia 8, está formado por 9 clientes, 7 mujeres y 2 varones, la mayoría D. las socias pertenecen a la Zona D. Pampahasi, que están ubicados por los alrededores D. la oficina D. Emprender las socias se dedican a la venta D. diversos productos como ser, D. ropa, carteras, cosméticos, venta D. comida. En la secuencia anterior todas cancelaron a excepción D. dos socias que pagaron con sus ahorros debido que uno D. sus familiares falleció, las cuales fueron retiradas del banco. 

La Sra. Maria Es la representante, actualmente toma el cargo D. la presidenta del banco se dedica a la confección D. polleras en su mismo domicilio, cuenta con esta actividad hace 4 años, el préstamo será destinado a la compra D. telas y otros artículos para la confección D. polleras.  Vive con sus  hijos mayores y nietos, se desconoce su estado civil D. la socia, aunque en su hoja D. datos indica que es soltera.  
En su banco comunal se ha destacado como una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos.

La Sra. Yolanda Socia que asume el cargo D. tesorera del banco, se dedica a la venta D. pescado en la misma zona  cuenta esta actividad hace 10 años, el préstamo esta destinado a incrementar su capital. Casada con el señor Néstor tiene tres hijos. Asimismo, la socia Yolanda nos cuenta que, cuando ingreso a Emprender el muro D. su casa se estaba por caer, y con los créditos D. emprender realizo el arreglo D. su vivienda el cual ella esta agradecida. Es una D. las representantes en su banco comunal, que ha sido elegida para el cargo por su  responsabilidad que ha demostrado dentro del banco como garante y como compañera D. grupo. 

La Sra. Erika, es elegida como secretaria , se dedica a la confección y venta D. ropa. El préstamo esta destinado para compra D. tela y asi incrementar su capital. Soltera tiene un hijo, vive con sus familiares en la zona D. Pampahasi. Su meta es tener su propia microempresa y realizar sus ventas al por mayor.

Todas las socias estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Bolivia," in its 8th loan cycle, has 9 members: 7 women and 2 men. The majority of the members are from the Pampahasi zone, which is located in the vicinity of the EMPRENDER office. The members sell a variety of products such as clothing, wallets, cosmetics and food. In the previous loan cycle all of the members paid off their debt with the exception of 2 members who paid with their savings, due to the fact that one of their relatives died. These members left the bank. Maria is the representative, and she currently holds the title of bank president. She makes polleras (traditional Bolivian skirts) in her home. She has been carrying out this activity for 4 years. She will use the loan to buy fabric and other items needed to make the polleras. She lives with her oldest children and grandchildren. Her marital status is unknown, although the data sheet indicates that she is single. In her communal bank she has stood out as a responsible person who is punctual with her payments. Erika, elected as secretary, makes and sells clothing. She will use the loan to buy fabric and increase her capital. She is single and has one son, and she lives with relatives in the Pampahasi zone. Her goal is to have her own small business and to sell at wholesale. Yolanda, the member who is acting as the bank's treasurer, has been selling fish in the same area for 10 years. This loan will be used to increase her capital. She is married to Nestor and has 3 children. In addition, Yolanda tells us that when she came to EMPRENDER the wall of her house was about to fall, and with the loans she was able to fix her home, for which she is very grateful. She is one of the representatives of the communal bank, and she was elected to this post because she had demonstrated responsibility as a guarantor and fellow group member. All of the members are very grateful to EMPRENDER and Kiva for the trust provided in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise: fabric and other products

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife T. is from the village of Punong, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old. Marife is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Marife owns & operates a buying & selling business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fish and dried fish in the local community. Marife has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marife joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marife has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products and as working capital. Marife is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional dried fish to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marife from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: La Sra. Anita esta casada y tiene su tienda D. barrio ubicada en la zona D. Chuquiaguillo, donD. venD. diversidad D. productos, lleva tres años con esta actividad, y le va muy bien ya que conoce muy bien acerca D. este rubro. Tiene un hijito pequeño en edad escolar, y solo ella se dedica a su manutención. Anteriormente tenía su tienda en la zona D. Pampahasi, pero como estaba en alquiler, tuvo que desocupar y buscando otro lugar, encontró una tienda en esa zona, donD. le esta yendo bien ya que es una zona muy comercial. El crédito será invertido en la compra D. abarrotes y  bedidas para aumentar productos a la tienda, es una persona responsable y trabajadora nunca tubo problemas en el pago D. sus cuotas, esta muuy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Senora Anita is married and has her neighborhood shop in the Chuquiaguillo zone, where she sells a variety of products. She has been doing this for 3 years, and it is going very well for her since she is well-known in this area. She has a young son at school, and she alone provides for his maintenance. She previously had her shop in the Pampahasi zone, but since it was in a rented space, she had to move; while searching for another location, she found a shop in this zone, where it is going well for her because it is in a very commercial location. This loan will be invested in the purchase of groceries and beverages in order to enlarge the offerings at her shop. She is a responsible and hard-working person who never had any problems making her regular payments. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for having the trust to extend this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of retail stock

loans.name: Mirna Lorena

texts.es: Mirna Lorena tiene 51 años, pues es el único medio de ingreso que tiene para mejorar su condición de vida. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de transporte, consiste en llevar a los niños a sus diferentes escuelas, este negocio nace por su esposo e hijo, que compraron un carrito para realizar este tipo de trabajo, pues su esposo es quien se hace cargo de manejar y ella de administrar el negocio, ella está muy feliz de tener este ingreso. Pero solicita este financiamiento para la compra de llantas, forros para los asientos, repuestos del automóvil entre otras cosas. Ella sueña con tener otro automóvil para brindar el servicio de taxi.
texts.en:
Mirna Lorena is 51, and the income from her business is her only means of improving her standard of living. She provides transportation services, taking children to their various schools. This business was started by her husband and son, who bought a small car to carry out this type of work. Her husband is the one who is responsible for the driving, and she administers the business. She is very happy to have this income. She requests a loan to purchase tires, seat liners, spare parts for the vehicle, and other items. She dreams of having another automobile to provide taxi service.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy auto parts

loans.name: Marcela Alexander

texts.es: Marcela Alexander tiene 22 años, ella es una mujer ejemplar y muy negociante, por lo que su actividad es una pulpería. Ella desde hace mas de 4 años es conocida por la Fundación como una excelente cliente, por lo que está muy contenta de tener un medio que le genere ingresos y ha demostrado que puede salir adelante ella siempre busca la forma de cómo atraer a sus clientes para que siempre su negocio este activo. Una de sus metas es que su negocio sea más grande. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos naturales, detergentes y pan.
texts.en:
Marcela Alexander is 22 years old. She is an exemplary woman who is very businesslike, and her activity is a general store. For more than 4 years she has been known by the Fundación as an excellent client, because she is very pleased to have a way to generate income and she has demonstrated that she can succeed. She is always on the lookout for ways to attract new customers, and for this reason her business is always busy. One of her goals is to make her business grow larger. The loan that she requests will be used to buy sweets, natural drinks (juices), detergents and bread.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to stock her general store with sweets, drinks, bread, etc.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou A. is from the village of Marilucao, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old and married with two small children. To make a living, she runs a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Marilou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Rene Hilario

texts.es: René Hilario tiene  50 años, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, por lo que tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación. Su actividad económica es el servicio de taxi, Don René inicio este negocio como chofer de un camión de transporte y lo que le pagaban lo conservaba ya que sus intenciones eran las de comprar un carro y lo ocuparía para dar los servicios de taxi ya que este sería el medio de trabajo que utilizaría para mantener a su familia. Es así que lo logra, actualmente solicita un financiamiento para capital de trabajo es para mejorar su carro y ofrecer un mejor servicio. El sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
René Hilario is 50 years old, and has a child in his care. He has been working with the Fundación for quite some time. He has a business providing taxi services. René started this business by working as a truck driver, and he saved from his earnings. He wanted to buy a car to use to provide taxi services, as this line of work would allow him to support his family. In this way he achieved his business. He currently requests a loan for working capital to improve his car and provide better service. His dream is to improve his house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital for auto maintenance

loans.name: Eddy Pantaleon

texts.es: Eddy tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de Fundación, por lo que se encuentra muy contento de tener un medio de ingreso. Su actividad económica es el destace de cerdos. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que se siente muy contento, la mayoría de sus vecinos saben muy bien que el ofrece un excelente producto por lo que todos lo conocen, además el carisma que ofrece a sus clientes es el mejor. El solicita un financiamiento para la compra de cerdos ya que son necesarios para su negocio. sueña con proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Eddy has been a client of the Foundation for a long time and is very happy to have a means of generating income. For more than ten years, he has been in the business of raising pigs and is very happy with his work. Most of his neighbors are well aware that he offers an excellent product to everyone who knows him. Likewise, his charisma allows him to offer his customers the best service.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy pigs that are needed for his business. He dreams of making improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy more pigs

loans.name: Berta Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Berta Esperanza, es una mujer muy dedicada al trabajo por lo que ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que sus inicio se dan desde hace 8 años, por lo que no tenía un trabajo estable y fue por interés propio que ella decide iniciar con este negocio, a pesar que no tenía mucho capital de trabajo por lo que su gran ayuda fue los financiamientos que le brindaron lo necesario para salir adelante. Ella solicita este financiamiento porque se acerca la temporada de verano y quiere comprar nuevos productos. Su deseo es mantener activo este negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Berta Esperanza is woman who is very dedicated to her work. She sells general merchandise. Berta started her business eight years ago out of self-interest because she did not have a stable job. Despite not having much operating capital, the help she received from the loans has given her everything necessary to move forward.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy new products for the upcoming summer season. Her wish is to keep this business active.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy new products

The main source of income for the business is selling food and daily use products in the local community. She is able to earn approximately 4000 PHP a month with this business.

In 2010, Estrella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Sokhna

texts.fr: Sokhna S. est une femme de 34 ans, elle est mariée et mère neuf (9) enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 8ans et a eu 16 bonnes expériences avec le crédit. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et ovine, elle achète les bêtes sur pied, les engraisse pour les revendre au bout de 4 à 5 mois. En sus, elle s'active au tour d'un petit commerce de balais. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Sokhna S. is a 34-year-old lady who is married and mother to nine children. She has been a member of the Village Bank for 8 years and has had 16 successful loans. She fattens up cows and sheep, she buys the live animals and then fattens them up for 4 to 5 months for resale. In addition to this, she runs a small broom business. She plays her part in improving her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business of fattening animals for sale

The business's main source of income is selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community, which helps Norma earn approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Norma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI, which she used to to purchase additional products to sell. Norma is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be Norma's 3rd loan from HSPFI. loans.name: Ndella

texts.fr: Ndelle T. est âgée de 31ans, elle est mariée et mère de huit (8) enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 8ans et a une bonne expérience avec le crédit pour en avoir bénéficié 16 fois de suite et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Ses activités sont multiples: elle fait un commerce de bétail (bœuf), de mil et fait un élevage de poulets. Les bénéfices générés à partir de son activité lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:

She has been a member of the Village Bank for 8 years and has enjoyed 16 consecutive loans that she has never had a problem repaying. She does many things: she sells beef cattle, millet and chickens. The money she earns through her work allows her to contribute to improving her family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

He has worked at peddling and selling fish in the local community for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month doing so.

In 2010, Remedios joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services that help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This loan will be the first loan Remedios takes out from HSPFI. Remedios is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase more fish to sell. loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es: El Señor Félix Pedro tiene 45 años de edad.  Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. El se dedica a brindar el servicio de mecánico automotriz. Desde hace 26 años, pues su papa fue quien le enseño este trabajo, el es un buen hombre y ha logrado salir adelante con mucho empeño. Félix necesita este préstamo para invertir en su capital de trabajo y poder comprar equipos automotrices como taladros, herramientas y otros utensilios necesarios. Su deseo es tener un taller más grande y acondicionado con equipos modernos y de alta tecnología.
texts.en:
Sr. Félix Pedro is 45 years old and has two dependent children. He offers his services as an auto mechanic. When he was 26 years old, his father taught him how to perform this type of work. Félix is a good man who has been able to get ahead with great determination.

He needs this loan to use as operating capital to purchase automotive equipment such as drills, tools, and other necessary utensils. Félix hopes to have a larger repair shop that contains modern equipment of the latest technology.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase automotive equipment

loans.name: Boudy

texts.fr: Boudy D. est âgée de 40ans, elle est mariée et mère de neuf (9) enfants, elle a également la charge de 5 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 7ans et demi. Elle fait de l'élevage de moutons, bœuf, et de chèvres, une activité pour laquelle elle a une bonne expérience pour l'avoir menée depuis plusieurs années. Ses bénéfices lui servent à contribuer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Boudy D. is 40 years old, married and mother to nine children. She also cares for 5 other children who have been entrusted to her. She has been a member of the Village Bank for 7 and a half years. She has several years' experience of successfully rearing sheep, cows and goats. The money she earns allows her to contribute to household expenses.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To support her animal rearing business

loans.name: Las Barbys Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. emprendimiento LAS BARBYS, son un grupo D. señoras y un varón, que trabajan en otras entidades financieras, son un grupo con experiencia en crédito grupal D. buenas referencias, en su mayoría promotora D. cosméticos, comerciantes y el varón es guardia D. seguridad. 

La Sra. Margarita es la Presidenta del grupo se dedica a la venta y promoción D. cosméticos para varones como para damas, es madre soltera con 3 hijos 2 D. ellos en edad escolar, recibe la ayuda D. su madre en el cuidado D. sus hijos mientras ella trabaja, vive en su casa propia con una modesta construcción,  la ayuda que brinda a sus hijos esta respaldada por el padre D. ellos ya que entre ambos empujaran hasta verlos profesionales, una persona muy seria con el trabajo y en la conducción del grupo, con el dinero del credito comprara cosmeticos por promocion.

La Sra. Candelaria es la Secretaria del B.E. ella es una persona mayor con un carisma y buen sentido D. humor, ella trabaja como promotora D. cosméticos, tiene su casa donD. vive con sus hijos que tienen sus familias propias y con el ultimo hijo que depenD. D. ella desea sacarlo profesional ya que los otros 2 hijos le fallaron y se casaron muy jóvenes dejando sus estudios, con el dinero del credito comprara cosmeticos que se encuentran en promocion y despues venderlos al precio original.

La Sra. Faustina es la Tesorera del grupo, madre soltera tiene 3 hijos en edad escolar, vive en una casa alquilada su actividad principal es la promoción D. cosméticos, producto D. su trabajo esta próxima a comprarse su lote D. terreno y empezar a construir su propio domicilio a cobijara a sus hijos como a ella misma, con el dinero del credito comprara cosmeticos que se encuentran en promocion y despues venderlos al precio original y tener muy buenas ganancias.

Todas las socias estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The community bank, Las Barbys, are a group of women and one man. They have worked with other financial associations, and they are a group with experience in group credit with good references. The majority sell cosmetics or are merchants, and the man is a security guard.

Sra. Margarita is the president of the group. She sells and markets cosmetics for men as well as for women. She is a single mother with 3 children, 2 of them of school age. She receives help from her mother in caring for her children while she works. She lives in her own house of modest construction. The help that she offers her children is seconded by their father, since between them, they encourage them become professionals. A person very serious in her work and in her leadership of the group, Margarita will use the loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

Sra. Candelaria is the secretary of the community bank. She is an older person with charisma and a good sense of humor. She markets cosmetics. She has her house where she lives with her children, who have their own families. She wants to see her last son, who depends on her, become a professional, since the other two children did not achieve this and left school to marry very young. With the money from the loan she will buy cosmetics that are on sale and then sell them at the original price.

Sra. Faustina is the treasurer of the group. A single mother with 3 children of school age, she lives in a rented house. Her main activity is marketing cosmetics. As a result of her work, she is close to buying a plot of land and beginning construction of her own house to shelter her children and herself. With the money from the loan she will buy cosmetics that are on sale and then sell them at the original price and have very good earnings.

All the bank members are very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence offered in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Cora

texts.en:
Cora T. is from the village of Claveria, Misamis Oriental and is 41 years old. She is separated from her spouse and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Cora owns and operates a business, which is making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Cora has been working on her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Cora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cora is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This loan will be the first loan Cora has borrowed from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue it generates to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la mercadería en general es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta luchar y además tener su propia independencia,  siempre le ha gustado mostrar todos sus productos, por lo que sale todos los días a vender de forma ambulante. Actualmente está solicitando un financiamiento para pinturas de uñas, talcos, cremas, sabanas y calzado. Su deseo es seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
María Delfina is 46 years old. This is not the first time she has taken out a loan. Her experiences have taught her very well. María Delfina sells general merchandise. She is a hardworking woman who likes to fight to have her own independence.

María Delfina has always enjoyed demonstrating her merchandise, so she sells all of her products as a traveling merchant. Today she is requesting a loan to buy nail polishes, talcum powders, crèmes, bed sheets, and footwear. Her wish is to continue forward with her business.

El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que consiste en la compra de oro, plata, soldaduras entre ciertas herramientas pendientes, por lo que él ha demostrado que todos los días ha salido adelante. el sueña en seguir adelante y que a sus hijos nos les falte nada.
texts.en:

His business is located in a sales stand in the central market. He began this business with his own money with the necessity to earn income. The loan is for working capital that consists of the purchase of gold, silver, and the welding between certain earring tools. He has demonstrated that he can get ahead every day. His dream is to continue moving forward and that his children don't miss anything.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina es una madre de familia de 66 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el centro poblado menor Lives del distrito de Unión Agua Blanca, un distrito ubicado en la serranía de la provincia de San Miguel, en la región Cajamarca, ubicada a cuatro horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Como la mayoría de habitantes del lugar, Carolina se dedica junto a su esposo a actividades agrícolas y de ganadería para sobrevivir. Gracias a estos ingresos han podido salir adelante y críar a sus hijos que ahora ya tienen sus propias familias. Actualmente en la zona se siembran diversos productos como maíz, papa, trigo, quinua, entre otros.

Adicionalmente también crían vacas de las cuales extraen la leche para luego venderla y así hacerse de ingresos diarios, ya que la agricultura es una actividad que no les brinda ingresos estables. Carolina desea mejorar la producción de su ganado lechero, por eso piensa adquirir alimento balanceado, como no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para realizar esta acción se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Carolina es una mujer trabajadora y que siempre ha velado por el progreso de su familia. Ella es muy estimada por las personas que la conocen, las que la consideran una mujer responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Carolina is a 66-year old mother with a family, who lives together with her husband in the small central village Lives, in the district of Unión Agua Blanca, a district located in the mountainous region of the San Miguel province, in the region Cajamarca. It is located four and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.

Like the majority of residents of this place, Carolina and her husband do agricultural activities and livestock farming to survive. Thanks to this income, they have been able to get ahead and raise their children who now have their own families. Currently in the region they harvest diverse products such as corn, potatoes, wheat, and quinoa, among others.

Additionally, they also raise cows from which they extract the milk to then sell and make their daily income, since agriculture is an activity that doesn't offer them stable income. Carolina wishes to improve the production of her milk-producing livestock and for this she is thinking about acquiring feed. As she doesn't have sufficient resources to do so, she sees it necessary for the first time to request from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 2,000 new soles.

Carolina is a hard-working woman and has always watched over the progress of her family. She is very dear to the people who know her, and they consider her a responsible women with confidence.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase feed for improving the production of her milk-producing livestock

location.town: CPM Lives - Unión Agua Blanca - San Miguel - Cajam
