loans.name: Tlayecac Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Tlayecac por que en la comunidad donde viven a si llama. Todas las integrantes se dedican al comercio la Sra. Yolanda y Sebastiana venden dulces, Maleny, Luisa, Alicia venden comida, Yadira tiene una estética pequeña, Marcela vende servilletas tejidas, Dominga vende frutas y legumbres, Ambrosia tiene una tienda de abarrotes y Beda cría ganado.
La Sra. Alicia es integrante del grupo es casada tiene una hija que estudia la primaria ella vende comida en un local que esta en su casa.
Con éste crédito ella quiere comprar mesas, sillas, y un poco de dulce para vender en su local de comida y así poder sacar un poco mas de ganancias.
Nos comenta que se siente muy a gusto con este grupo ya que había trabajado en otros pero se sentían muy pesados por tantos problemas que habían y en este es todo lo contrario y nos comenta que espera poder seguir contando con el apoyo de fundación realidad y KIVA para salir adelante con toda su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called Tlayecac, as this is the name of the community where it is located. All the members are merchants. Yolanda and Sebastiana sell candy. Maleny, Luisa, and Alicia sell food. Yadira has a small beauty shop. Marcela sells cloth napkins. Dominga sells fruits and vegetables, Ambrosia has a general store, and Beda raises livestock. Alicia, a member of the group, is married and has a young daughter in primary school. She sells prepared food from her house. With this loan, she would like to buy tables and chairs, as well as a little candy, to sell in her locale so she can increase her profits. She tells us that she feels very comfortable as a part of this group; she had worked in others, but did not enjoy it because there were too many problems. Here, however, it is the opposite, and she hopes to be able to continue counting on the support from the Foundation Realidad and KIVA to continue helping her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chairs and tables.

loans.name: G.s. Jerusalen Ii El El Viejo.- Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Jerusalén II De El Viejo está conformado por Luz Amanda G. y Jasmira Del Carmen juntas ha sabido luchar para mejorar sus ingresos. Jasmira se dedica a la venta de cosa de horno y ropa varida, por lo que tiene más de 23 años, de realizar esta actividad, sus inicios surgen porque desde muy joven necesitaba tener una fuente de ingresos para sus 2 hijos que actualmente están a su cargo, ella sale todos los días por el inmenso sol a ofrecer sus productos, en cambio su amiga tiene una pulpería, en donde ofrece una gran variedad de productos. Ellas solicitan este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para capital de trabajo en la compra de materia prima. Juntas sueñan con obtener mejores ingresos de sus negocios.
texts.en:
The community bank Jerusalén II De El Viejo is made up of Luz Amanda G. and Jasmira Del Carmen. Together they have been fighting to improve their income. Jasmira sells baked goods and varied clothing. She has been in this business for more than 23 years, which in the beginning emerged because since she was young she needed to have a source of income for her two children who are currently under her care. She goes out every day into the incredible sun to offer her products.

On the other hand, her friend has a local store, where she offers a large variety of products. They are requesting this loan for working capital, that will be used for the purchase of raw materials. Together they dream to obtain better income in their business.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mujeres Divinas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco Comunal  Mujeres Divinas se formó en la ciudad de Cuenca,  metrópoli fundada por los españoles en 1557 como  Santa Ana de los Ríos de Cuenca, en sus cercanías existen interesantes restos arqueológicos incaicos y la misma ciudad conserva notables edificaciones estilo  barroco de la época colonial, como el convento del Carmen, entre otros atractivos turísticos que posee la ciudad. En ésta ocasión podemos observar en la fotografia a nuestras socias con algunos de sus hijos que las acompañan a las reuniones del banco comunal.

 Gloria tiene 32 años, se casó hace varios años concibiendo cuatro hijos de los cuales el segundo de O. años murió atropellado, de sus tres hijos que le quedan el mayor tiene catorce años como no le gusta estudiar pasa en casa, el otro tiene 11 años y estudia en una escuela de la localidad y un pequeño de tres años que pasa con ella, aún no tiene casa propia por ello viven arrendando en el centro de la ciudad.

Nuestra socia mantiene una muy buena amistad con todas las socias del bankito, y se integró a él gracias a su hermana que ya pertenecía al banco, ahora  se encuentra en su segundo ciclo, ella se dedica a la entrega de colas, papas fritas, chitos, yucas y todo lo que es la línea Frito Lay productos  Pepsi  junto a su esposo quien manejo un camión de su propiedad  llevan  diez años realizando esta  actividad. Con el nuevo préstamo que realiza va a  pagar los gastos de mantenimiento del vehiculo como cambio de aceite, llantas y otros, su sueño es el de llegar a tener su casa propia.

Flor Chávez tiene 19 años y es una de las socias más jóvenes de  éste banco,  vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca en  unión libre  con su pareja que trabaja en una concesionaria de autos,  ella se encuentra en su sexto mes de gestación, no tienen casa propia y viven rentando 

Flor se dedica al comercio de ropa y lo hace puerta a puerta   no tiene un horario fijo y trabaja todos los días sin descansar uno solo, nos comenta que  empezó con su negocio gracias al primer crédito que realizó en la fundación también nos informa que gracias a su suegra y cuñado ella es ahora socia de éste hermoso grupo de mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras, ahora que está en el segundo ciclo realizó otro crédito y con él va adquirir   pantalones, blusas, camisas, sacos, interiores, calcetines, etc. para toda la familia,  su meta es de crecer en su negocio y algún momento tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Divinas" was formed in the city of Cuenca, a city founded by the Spanish in 1557 as Santa Ana de los Rios de Cuenca. In the vicinity there are interesting archaeological ruins and the city itself retains remarkable baroque buildings from the colonial era, such as the convent of Carmen, among other tourist attractions the city owns. On this occasion we can see in the photograph the members with some of their children who accompany them to the meetings of the communal bank. Gloria, 32, was married a number of years ago, and conceived 4 children, the second of whom died in an accident at the age of 11. Of the other children the oldest is 15 years old, and as he does not like to study he remains in the home. Another is 11 and studies in a local school, and the youngest, who is 3, stays with her. They do not yet have their own home, so they live in a rented home in the center of the city. This member has a good friendship with all the other members of the small bank, and she joined the group thanks to her sister who already belonged to the bank. Now the group is in its 2nd loan cycle. She delivers colas, potato chips, Cheetos, yucca chips, and everything from the Frito Lay and Pepsi brands along with her husband, who drives his own truck. They have been in this line of work for 10 years. With the new loan they will pay expenses related to the maintenance of the vehicle, such as expenses for oil changes, tires, and other maintenance. Her dream is to eventually come to own her own house. Flor Chávez, 19, is one of the youngest members of the bank. She lives in the center of the city of Cuenca and she lives in a common-law marriage with her partner who works in a car dealership. She is in her 6th month of pregnancy, and they do not have their own home so they rent. Flor sells clothing door to door. She does not have a fixed schedule and she works each day without resting even one day. She tells us that she started with the business thanks to the first loan that she took from the Fundación ESPOIR. She also tells us that thanks to her mother-in-law and brother-in-law she is now a member of this beautiful group of enterprising and go-getting women. Now that the group is in its second cycle she will take a loan to buy pants, blouses, shirts, bags, underwear, socks, etc. for the whole family. Her goal is to grow her business and at some point have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for expenses related to vehicle maintenance such as oil change, tires; to acquire pants, shirts, blouses, bags, underwear, and socks

loans.name: Juneper

texts.en:
Juneper F. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 28 years old. Juneper is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Juneper owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling a variety of different products in the local community. Juneper has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Juneper joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juneper has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Juneper is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Juneper from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mario Jorge

texts.es:
Mario vive en la ciudad de Urubamba y tiene un pequeño negocio familiar de venta de comida. El socio tiene 43 años es una persona responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia. 

Mario pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa y es socio nuevo. Mario se encuentra deseoso y entusiasmado de participar en el banco comunal y quiere aprender administrar mejor su dinero y aprender de los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación. Actualmente, el socio requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, fideos, azúcar, verduras, carnes y muchos productos más para preparar una variedad de platos de comida ya que su clientela empezó aumentar pues el socio Mario tiene una buena sazón. El anhelo del socio es abrir su propio negocio de venta de comida.

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mario, 43, lives in Urubamba and has a small food sales business. He is a responsible person who is always looking for opportunities to get ahead in life and provide, through his own daily efforts, for his family’s wellbeing. Mario is a new member of Asociación Arariwa ‘s “TERCER MILENIO” (Third Millennium) communal bank. Mario is enthusiastic and hopeful about belonging to a communal bank and wants to learn how to better manage his income as well as to learn about the credit, savings and training services available. He needs funds to buy ingredients like: rice, pasta, sugar, vegetables, meats and many other products so that he can sell a variety of dishes since the number of customers he serves has been increasing, thanks to his tasty cooking style. He hopes to open his own food sales business. He is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, pasta, sugar, vegetables and meats.

loans.name: Carmen Elizabeth

texts.es:
Carmen es una madre de familia de 29 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos menores de edad en el distrito de Santa Rosa, una zona cuya economía depende principalmente de la pesca y que se encuentra ubicada a veinticinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la elaboración de paños (tejido decorativo hecho a base de hilos y tejido artesanalmente) desde hace ocho años. Con esta actividad se ha estado agenciando de recursos económicos  y ha podido incursionar también en el negocio de venta de cosméticos por catálogo. Con mucho esfuerzo ha podido conseguir una clientela fija que siempre le hace pedidos. Adicionalmente ha empezado a comprar productos para tener un sotck permanente que ofrecer a sus clientes.

Carmen siente que su negocio es importante para su familia ya que los ingresos que su esposo percibe como trabajador eventual no son suficientes para sostener la economía familiar. Por ello desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos cosméticos y con la compra de un mostrador, para lograr su objetivo se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Carmen es una mujer creativa, laboriosa y que da todo de si para salir adelante. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Carmen is a 29-year-old mother who lives with her husband and three, minor children in Santa Rosa, a community that depends primarily on fishing, located twenty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last 8 years she has woven paños (decorative weavings made from thread that is woven as a craft). This activity has been providing income for her and has allowed her to make inroads into catalogue cosmetics sales. With much effort, she has managed to secure a regular customer base that always places orders with her. In addition, she has started to buy products in order to have permanent stock available for her customers. Carmen believes that her business is important to her family because her husband’s earnings as a temporary worker are insufficient to support the family. She, therefore, would like to enlarge her business buying more cosmetics and a display counter. To reach this goal, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan. Carmen is a creative, hard-working woman who gives 100% of herself in order to get ahead. She has collaborated with our institution in the past and has demonstrated responsibility with respect to repayment of her installments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and a display counter.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen T. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 47 years old. Helen is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Helen owns & operates a business buying seafood products like fish, squid and shrimp and peddling it in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 17,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Helen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

Filomena is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Filomena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Alvina

texts.es:
Alvina, tiene 59 años y tiene cuatro hijos, ella es una madre responsable que buscó a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. 

Alvina alterna sus actividades del hogar con su trabajo D. atender la biblioteca municipal D. la ciudad D. Urubamba y también se dedica a la producción y venta artesanía.  La socia nos cuenta con mucha pena que el negocio bajo en un 80% y que le devolvieron mercadería. La causa D. la baja D. turismo es por las fuertes precipitaciones fluviales que cayeron en la ciudad haciendo que turistas cancelaran sus a viajes al Cusco.   

Alvina pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” D. la Asociación Arariwa. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales como por ejemplo lana y tela.  El anhelo D. la socia es exportar sus productos y sacar profesionales a sus hijos.    

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Alvina is 59 years old and has four children. She is a responsible mother who always looks for opportunities to get ahead and works daily to give her children a better future. Alvina alternates her housework with her work at the municipal library in Urubamba city and also produces and sells craftwork. The member sadly tells us that the business has decreased by 80% and that her merchandise has been returned. The cause in the drop in tourism is from the torrential rain that fell in the city making the tourists cancel their trips to Cusco. Alvina belongs to the “TERCER MILENIO” communal bank of the Arariwa Association. The member needs the loan to buy more materials such as wool and fabric. The member's wish is to export her products and that her children become professionals. The member is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means and promises to fulfill the payments according to the timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Alvina wants the loan to buy more materials such as wool and fabric.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia A. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Lucia is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Lucia owns & operates a specialized retail store making and selling charcoal in the local community. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lucia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lucia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Tezoapan Group

texts.es:
Esta foto fue tomada en el establo de la Sra. Jannet Alelí González P., una integrante del grupo Tezoapan, que está ubicado en la comunidad de Cañada Morelos en el Estado de Puebla en México.  Se ve en la foto a las integrantes del grupo así como parte del lugar donde ella tiene su ganado. Ella se dedica a la cría de ganado bovino y a la venta de leche que inició hace 5 años. Solicita el préstamo para  la compra de alimento y vacunas para su ganado. Ella considera que con las vacunas que les aplicara a su ganado estarán más fuertes y su leche será más nutritiva.  Al momento de solicitar el préstamo se siente agradecida ya que por su condición económica es muy difícil tener acceso a un crédito. Tiene 21 años, estudió hasta el tercer grado de preparatoria, es casada y tiene en total niño de dos años de edad.  Quiere este crédito para poder incrementar su cría de ganado y así también su producción de leche.   También espera que cuando incrementen sus ganancias pueda terminar de construir su casa.

La Sra. Margarita González P. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 34 años, estudió hasta el sexto año de primaria, es madre soltera y tiene en total una hija de 8 años.  Ella se dedica a la venta de pan que inició hace 6 años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de su materia prima para poder elaborar  pan. 

El grupo está conformado por  12. Los otros integrantes son:

Melchor R. B.					Tienda de Abarrotes
H. Álvarez María de los Ángeles			Vta. de trastes
P. Méndez Olivia					Cría de Borregos
F. R. María Guadalupe				Vta. de lácteos
P. Benítez Ma. Petra				Taller de Costura
Inclán B. Berenice				Vta. de Platicos
E. Hernández Eustorgia				Vta. de Ropa
R. C. Magdalena					Vta. de Leche
P. Benítez Luz					Vta. De Blancos
González C. Enedina					Vta. de Carne
texts.en:
This photo was taken at the establishment of Senora Jannet Alelí González P., a member of the Tezoapan group located in the community of Cañada Morelos, Puebla State, México. The members of the group can be seen in the photo as well as part of the place where she keeps her livestock. She raises beef cattle and sells milk, a business she started 5 years ago. She is requesting this loan to purchase feed and vaccines for her livestock. She expects that by giving these vaccines to her herd, they will be stronger and the milk will be more nutritious. She is grateful to be able to request this loan, since in her economic condition it is difficult to get access to credit. She is 21, has studied through the third year of secondary school, is married and has one son two years old. She needs this loan to be able to increase her herd as well as her milk production. She also hopes that when her profits increase, she will be able to complete the construction of her house. Senora Margarita González P. is the president of the group. She is 34, has studied to the 6th year of primary school, is a single mother with a daughter of 8. She sells bread, which she started 6 years ago. She is requesting this loan to buy raw materials for making bread. The group is conposed of 12. The other members are: Melchor R. B., Grocery shop H. Álvarez María de los Ángeles, Utensil sales P. Méndez Olivia, Raising sheep F. R. María Guadalupe, Dairy products P. Benítez Ma. Petra, Tailor Inclán B. Berenice, Plastic sales E. Hernández Eustorgia, Clothing sales R. C. Magdalena, Milk sales P. Benítez Luz, Linen sales González C. Enedina, Meat sales

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of stock and raw materials

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto C. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 25 years old. Alberto is single. To make a living, Alberto owns & operates a business harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Alberto has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Alberto joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alberto is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a small fishing boat. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alberto from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca tiene 49 años D. edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a su último hijo D. 10 años D. edad en el distrito D. Monsefú, una zona conocida a nivel regional por sus festividades religiosas y por los trabajos que realizan sus artesanos, queda ubicado a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace 10 años a la comercialización D. forraje para animales en el mercado D. la ciudad D. Monsefú. Ella y su esposo compran forraje a los agricultores D. la zona y ofrecen su producto todos los dias desD. las seis hasta las once D. la mañana. Este negocio es la única fuente D. ingreso con la que cuenta la familia por lo que siempre tratan D. dar todo D. si para mantenerlo.

Debido al tiempo que lleva en el negocio y a la calidad D. trato que ofrece a sus clientes, su negocio está teniendo muy buena acogida, Francisca desea ampliarlo comprando mas forraje para captar mas clientes, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Francisca es una mujer bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es darle a su hijo la oportunidad D. estudiar una carrera superior que le asegure un futuro prometedor. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Francisca is 49 years old, married and lives with her husband and their youngest son who is 10 years old in the Monsefú district. This area is known regionally for its religious festivals and for the work done by its artisans, and is located 20 minutes from Chiclayo city. For the last ten years she has sold animal fodder at the market in Monsefú city. She and her husband buy fodder from the farmers in the area and sell their product daily from six to eleven in the morning. This business is the only source of income that the family relies on therefore they always try to give it their best effort to keep it going. Given the time that they have been in business and the quality service they offer their customers, their business has a very good reputation. Francisca wants to expand it by buying more fodder to get more customers. For this reason she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of PEN 1000 that will help her reach her goal. Francisca is a very hard working woman and devoted to her family. Her greatest wish is to give her son the opportunity to study towards a good career that will guarantee him a promising future. She has already worked previously with our institution and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility when making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fodder to sell and expand business

loans.name: Celso

texts.en: Celso M. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. He is 30 years old. Celso is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Celso owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas in the local community. Celso has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Celso joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celso has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Celso is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Celso from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jesús René

texts.es:
La persona que aparece en la fotografía es la esposa.

Jesús René A. es un padre que desea ofrecerles lo mejor a sus hijos, es por ello que trabaja en una maquiladora de Lunes a Viernes y si hay tiempo extra también los fines de semana.  El tiene cuatro hijos y uno de ellos ya esta creciendo; es por ello que desea construirle una recamara en la pare de atrás de su vivienda para que tenga su propio espacio. La casa de René es pequeña esta es de interés social los cuales por dentro están muy reducidas. Es por ello que el pide el apoyo para poder realizar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Jesús René A. is a father who wants to give the best to his children. This is why he works in a plant from Monday to Friday, and weekends as well if there is time. He has four children, and one of them is already growing up; this is why he wants to build a bedroom in the back of his home so his child can have his own space. René's house is small, the interior space is very limited. This is why he is requesting the loan, so he can complete his project. The person in the photograph is his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a bedroom for his eldest son

loans.name: Refugia

texts.es: Refugia E. quedo viuda hace años por lo que quedo sola. A pesar de su dolor ella ha podido salir adelante, esforzándose cada día. La Señora E. desea enjarrar una vivienda que esta construyendo  para poder habitarla necesita unos arreglos como poner piso cerámico y enjarrar las paredes por lo pronto. Ella se dedica ala venta de terrenos que se le heredo por sus padres.
texts.en:
Refugia E. has been widow for several years and lives alone. Through all the pain she has been able to get ahead and continues to strive each day. Sra. E. wants to plaster her house, which is currently under construction, so that she can make it livable. She wants to undertake a few projects, such as installing a ceramic floor and plastering the walls, sometime soon. Refugia is considering selling the land that she inherited from her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the construction of her house (plaster the walls & install a ceramic floor)

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel Y. is from the village of Sugbongcogon in Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old and married with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Anabel runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Anabel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

Anabel has joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first HSPFI loan, for 5000 PHP, to invest in expanding the business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her sari-sari shop.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina C. S. desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, accesorios para el hogar y juguetes para niños. Esta actividad la realiza para poder ayudar se esposos con los gastos del hogar, aunque su esposo es pensionado de EUA, ellos trabajan para tener mejor calidad de vida. Este crédito que solicitan es para invertir en el negocio como compra de ropa y accesorios para ofrecer a sus clientes mejora calidad y variedad.
texts.en:
Martina C. S. has sold used clothing, household items, and children's toys for ten years. She does this job so she can help her husband with household expenses. Even though he receives a pension from the USA, they work in order to have a better quality of life. The loan will be invested in the business, and Martina plans to buy more clothing and household items so she has better quality and more variety to offer her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina E. es una mujer que ha salido adelante con su hijo a pesar de ser madre soltera, ella se desde hace siete años tiene un negocio de abarrotes en el que ha podido sacar a su hijo adelante. Con este crédito será el cuarto en el que ha demostrado ser una mujer cumplidora en sus pagos. Ella se preocupa por el bienestar de su hijo es por ello que quiere ir haciéndole mejoras a su vivienda para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida y un mejor patrimonio. Este nuevo préstamo es para hacerle acabados externos a la planta alta de su casa.
texts.en:
Paulina E. is a woman who has gotten ahead with her son despite being a single mother. For seven years, she has had a grocery business with which she has been able to get her son ahead. This loan will be the fourth with which she has demonstrated that she is woman who makes her payments. She is worries about her son's wellbeing and that is why she wants to make improvements on her housing to offer him a better quality of life and a better inheritance. This new loan is to do the exterior finishings on the upper floor of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishings on the upper floor of her house.

loans.name: Ma. Cindy

texts.en:
Ma. Cindy E. is from the village of Sugbongcogon in Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old and married with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Cindy owns a store selling seafood products including fish and shrimp. Ma. Cindy has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

Ma. Cindy has joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Cindy is requesting her first HSPFI loan, for 4000 PHP, to invest in her business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her seafood selling business.

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es: Abelardo R. P. es un hombre trabajador que se preocupa por el bienestar de la familia. El es padre de 3 mujeres por lo que el piensa en darles una mejora calidad de vida. La casa que el tiene es de interés social pero con el tiempo le fue haciendo mejoras y la vivienda ya es de dos plantas, pero le falta terminar con los acabados del baño es por eso que pide el apoyo para poder realizar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Abelardo R. P. is a hard-working man committed to ensuring the well-being of his family. He is father to 3 girls for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. He lives in social housing but over time he has made improvements and now it has two storeys but the bathroom is still unfinished. It is for this reason that he is asking for support to allow him to finish his project.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish off the bathroom of his house

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila S. is from the village of Sugbongcogon in Misamis Oriental. She is 55 years old and married with 4 adult children. To make a living, Leonila runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where she sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Leonila has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

Leonila joined HSPFI in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities, and she has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Leonila is now requesting her second loan, for 8000 PHP, to further invest in the business.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her sari-sari shop.

loans.name: José Wilder

texts.es:
José tiene 31 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos en el sector Ciudad de Dios del distrito de San José, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno desde hace cuatro años, el cría vacas para extraerles la leche y venderla a un acopiador que a su vez provee de este producto a la principal empresa de productos lácteos del país. Adicionalmente siembra pastos para alimentar a sus animales. Este negocio es la única fuente de ingreso con la que sostiene a su familia, por lo que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar a su negocio adelante.

José desea brindarle mantenimiento a su cultivo de forraje de tal manera que tenga una buena producción y sus animales tengan el alimernto que necesitan para producir leche de calidad. Por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes.

José es un padre de familia responsable y trabajador. Su mayor anhelo es poder instalar un establo. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
José, 31, is married and lives with his wife and four children in the Ciudad de Dios neighborhood of San José, Lambayeque province, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has raised cattle for the last four years; he raises dairy cows for milk production which he sells to the area milk consolidator who, in turn, delivers the milk to the country’s main dairy products producer. In addition, he farms fodder to serve as animal feed for his herds. This business is his family’s only source of income so he always gives the best of himself to insure that his business progresses. José wants to provide his crops with proper care so that his crop yields will be good and his animals will have the food they need to produce high quality milk. This is why he’s asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan to buy fertilizers. José is a responsible and hard-working father. His greatest wish is to set up a stable. He has collaborated previously with our institution and has repaid his loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his fodder crops.

location.town: Ciudad de Dios - San José - Lambayeque

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda S. is from the village of Kinoguitan in Misamis Oriental. She is 60 years old and widowed with 4 adul children. To make a living, Linda sells snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Linda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

Linda has joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linda is requesting her first loan, for 4000 PHP, to purchase raw ingredients needed to make more products for sale.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma P. is from the village of Balulang in Cagayan de Oro City. She is 42 years old and married with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Wilma runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling a variety of different products in the local community. Wilma is just starting this business and has joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma is requesting her first loan, for 5,000 PHP, to purchase products to sell such as dairy products, soap, toothpaste and shampoos. Wilma plans to use the revenue generated from the business to support the education of children. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To open a retail shop.

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rainbow

texts.en:
Rainbow V. is from the village of Kinoguitan in Misamis Oriental. She is 20 years old and married with 2 infant children. To make a living, Rainbow has been selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community for more than one year now and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.  Rainbow has joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities, and is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP, to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Maria Delmira

texts.es:
María Delmira es una madre de familia de 24 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el sector Ciudad de Dios del distrito de San José, provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cuatro años a la crianza y venta de animales menores (aves de corral y cuyes) en su vivienda. Ella los compra cuando tienen pocos dias de nacidos para criarlos, engordarlos y luego venderlos a los negociantes que visitan la zona regularmente. Con este negocio ella apoya al sostenimiento de su familia ya que los ingresos que percibe su esposo como obrero de la municipalidad del distrito no son suficientes para sostener la economía del hogar.

María Delmira desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales para criarlos y así captar más ingresos, por eso se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta trazada.

María Delmira es una mujer trabajadora y entregada a su familia, todos los esfuerzos y acciones que realiza tienen la finalidad de progresar y salir adelante. Sus vecinos la estiman mucho y la consideran una mujer de confianza.
texts.en:
María Delmira, 24, lives with her husband and two children in the Ciudad de Dios neighborhood of San José district, Lambayeque province, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last four years she has raised small farm animals (barnyard fowl and guinea pigs) in her yard. She buys them when they are just a few days old and raises them for later sale to merchants that visit the area regularly. This business helps her to support the family because the income her husband earns as a laborer for the city is not sufficient to support the household. María Delmira wants to increase her business buying more animals to raise so that she can earn higher income. For this reason, she is calling upon Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, to request a 500 new sol loan to help her reach this goal. María Delmira is a hard-working woman who is dedicated to her family; all her efforts and actions are aimed at her family’s success and progress. Her neighbors hold her in high regard and consider her to be trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small farm animals.

location.town: Ciudad de Dios - San José - Lambayeque

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus dos queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una buena educación.

Visitando a sus clientes en sus casas, es como Carmen realiza la venta de sus productos de belleza. Ella es una vendedora muy persistente y convincente, motivo por el cual termina con las ventas de sus cosméticos rápidamente. En la ciudad de Tarma es muy conocida y saben que los productos que vende son de muy buena calidad.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejarles a sus clientas sobre lo que mejor le quedará a su rostro, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cobrar por la venta de sus productos, ya que no siempre sus clientes tienen plata para pagarle, pero ella siempre se las arregla para que le paguen completamente todas sus ventas. Para más adelante, espera implementar una tienda de cosméticos, donde pueda vender más cómoda y sin la necesidad de ir casa por casa.

Este es el noveno préstamo de Carmen con MFP, quiere hacer crecer su negocio, es por eso que desea pagar a tiempo todas sus cuotas para poder acceder a otro préstamo, además sabe que cuenta con el apoyo de su banco comunal. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más cosméticos, ya que últimamente está teniendo una mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Carmen is 41 years old and she is a very cheerful and hard-working woman; she lives in a rented house with her two beloved children to whom she whishes to provide a good education. She sells her beauty products by visiting customers at their homes. She is a persistent and persuasive salesperson, allowing her to complete the sale of her cosmetics very quickly. She is well known in the city of Tarma and people know that she sells high quality products. What she likes the most about her job is to give advice to her customers on the best-fitting product for their face; she has been selling these products for 2 years and she considers the most difficult part is to collect payment for the products since her customers do not have money to pay sometimes. However, somehow she always manages to collect all the money she is owed. Looking forward, she hopes to setup a cosmetic store, where she would be able to sell more comfortably without the need to go from house to house. This is Carmen’s ninth loan with MFP; she wants to grow her business and for this reason she plans to make all her payments so she can request another loan; she also knows she has the support of her community bank. With the seven hundred Nuevos Soles requested, she will buy more cosmetics, since she has been having a higher demand lately.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en: Emelda B. is from the village of Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 39 years old. Emelda is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Emelda owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Emelda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Emelda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Emelda from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 44 años, es una mujer que a lo largo de su vida ha trabajado mucho por forjarse un buen futuro. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Florentino de 47 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una buena educación.

Su tienda de abarrotes es una de las más visitadas de la ciudad de Tarma, desde muy temprano por la mañana abre su bodega en espera de que sus clientes lleguen a comprar las cosas que necesitan. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y atenta, ya que siempre recibe a sus clientes con una sonrisa y está dispuesta ayudarlos en sus compras.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, lleva 2 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Para más adelante, espera poder ampliar su tienda y surtirla de más mercadería poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos.

Este es el noveno préstamo de Carmen con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Carmen, 44, has worked hard all her life to forge a good future. She lives in her own home with her husband, Florentino, 47, and their two loved children, for whom she wants to provide a good education. Her grocery store is one of the city of Tarma’s most popular; she is open for business from very early in the morning waiting for her customers to arrive to buy the things they need. She is a very cheerful and solicitous seller; she always welcomes her customers with a smile and is willing to assist them with their purchases. What she likes best about her work is chatting with her customers; she has been in this line of work for 2 years and considers the most difficult part having to stay inside her store all day without being able to go outside. Later on, she would like to expand her store and stock it with more merchandise so that she can offer her customers a wider variety of products. This is Carmen’s 9th loan with MFP and she’s determined to repay on time because she doesn’t want to cause any problems to her fellow communal bank members, who hold her in very high esteem. She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy more stock items for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Noli

texts.en:
Noli S. is from the town of Talakag Bukidnon. He is 26 years old. Noli is married and has 2 young children. To make a living, Noli owns & operates a business providing transportation services by way of his "trisikad" (a bicycle improvised and used for transporting passengers) to local community members. Noli has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Noli joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Noli has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. Noli is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to open up a small sari-sari(variety) store. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Noli from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of his family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz D. is from the village of  Kinoguitan,  Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Flordeliz is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Flordeliz owns & operates a business selling specialty food products in the local community. Flordeliz has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Flordeliz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Flordeliz is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Flordeliz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Cynder

texts.es:
Cynder tiene 33 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo César de 40 años, quien trabaja realizando transporte de pasajeros, y con sus 4 hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.

En la comunidad de “Yurinaki”  es donde vive y tiene su tienda de abarrotes. Ella se siente muy feliz con su negocio, ya que le es muy rentable y está muy bien ubicado, justo en la plaza de la comunidad. Desde las 5: 30 AM abre su tienda y se dispone a vender los productos que tiene en stock. Esta actividad la realiza hasta las 10 de la noche.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es vender y es muy buena haciéndolo, ya que siempre sus clientes salen muy contentos de su tienda, lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su bodega, sin poder salir a la calle a realizar sus actividades. Para más adelante, espera mejorar su tienda y hacerla crecer, para así poder atender mejor a sus clientes.

Este es el octavo préstamo de Cynder con MFP, espera ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que no desea perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida y respetada. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Cynder is 33 years old and is a very loving and hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband César, who is 40 years old and works in passenger transportation, and with her 4 children, for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life. She lives and has her grocery store in the community of "Yurinaki." She feels very satisfied with her business, since it is very profitable and well situated, right in the community's main square. Beginning at 5:30 am, she opens her store and begins to sell the products that she has in stock. She performs this activity until 10 pm at night. What she likes most about her work is selling and she's good at doing it, since her customers always leave her store satisfied. She has been doing this for 3 years and thinks that the hardest part is being in the shop all day, without being able to walk about the streets and run errands. In the future, she hopes to improve her store and make it grow, in order to provide better service to her customers. This is Cynder's eighth loan with MFP. She expects to be punctual with her payments, since she does not want to inconvenience the other members of her communal bank, where she is much loved and respected. With the two thousand nuevos soles requested, she will buy products in order to better stock her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio tiene 39 años, es un padre de familia muy trabajador y amoroso. Vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposa Leonor de 25 años y su querida hija del mismo nombre, a quienes desea brindar una mejor vida.

Trabajando arduamente ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante. Se dedica al cultivo del café, pero al no tener tierras propias tiene que alquilarlas. Junto a su esposa se levantan muy témpano para cuidar sus plantaciones de café, ya que saben que de la buena producción que obtengan, dependerán sus ingresos económicos.
A Lucio le gusta mucho su trabajo, lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus plantaciones, ya que los químicos muchas veces han afectado su salud. Con el tiempo, espera comprar sus propias tierras y así ahorrar el dinero del alquiler para invertirlo en abono y fertilizantes.

Este es el sétimo préstamo de Lucio con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará abono y fertilizantes para sus plantaciones, también contratará operarios para que trabajen el café.
texts.en:
Lucio is 39 years old and a very hardworking and loving father. He lives in a rented house with his wife Leonor, who is 25 years old, and their beloved daughter with the same name, for whom he wants to provide a better life. By working hard, he has been able to make progress for his family. He works at coffee cultivation, but because he does not have his own land, he has to rent it. Together with his wife, they rise very early in order to take care of the coffee plantations, since they know that their income will depend on the good harvest they obtain. Lucio likes his work a lot. He has spent 3 years working in this business and thinks the hardest part is fumigating his plantations, because the chemicals have often affected his health. In time, he hopes to buy his own land and thus save money from renting in order to invest it in fertilizers. This is Lucio's seventh loan with MFP. He has been very timely with his prior loans and expects to do the same with this one. He is a very responsible member of his communal bank and is always up-to-date with the agreements arrived at by the group. With the two thousand nuevos soles requested, he will buy fertilizers for his plantations. He will also hire workers to harvest the coffee.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel L. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. He is 29 years old. Ruel is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Ruel owns & operates a business selling snacks like fish balls and tempura in the local community. Ruel has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 60 años y es un hombre muy alegre y trabajador.Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Alicia de 46 años y sus 2 menores hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.

La actividad a la que se dedica es el cultivo de frutas (mandarinas y carambolas), las extensas tierras que posee lo han convertido en uno de los principales productores de la zona. Sus productos los lleva a vender hasta la ciudad de Lima, donde ya tiene compradores esperándolo, pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar, y lo hace con mucho empeño; lleva 45 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus plantaciones de las plagas que pueden afectarlas. En el futuro, desea comprar un carro, donde pueda transportar sus productos.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Pedro con MFP, está dispuesto a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y para eso ya está empezando a ahorrar. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre está muy al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en sus reuniones. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más abono para sus tierras, también invertirá en fertilizantes e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Pedro is 60 years old and is a very cheerful and hardworking man. He lives in his own home with his wife Alicia, who is 46 years old, and with their 2 young children, for whom he would like to provide a better quality of life. His business is in the cultivation of fruit (tangerines and starfruit). The extensive land he owns has made him one of the main producers of the area. He takes his products to be sold in the city of Lima, where he already has buyers expecting him, since his products are of very good quality. What he likes most about his work is harvesting and he does it with much determination. He has sent 45 years working in this business and thinks the hardest part is protecting his plantations from the blights that can affect them. In the future, he wants to buy a car so he can transport his products. This is Pedro's second loan with MFP. He is accustomed to making his payments on time and for this he has already begun to save. He is a very cheerful member of his communal bank and is always up-to-date with the agreements that the members come to at meetings. With the one thousand five hundred nuevos soles requested, he will buy more fertilizer for his land and also invest in insecticides.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia tiene 46 años y siempre ha trabajado muy duro por sobresalir en la vida. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Pedro de 41 años, quien trabaja como albañil, y con sus 3 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

Su comunidad se llama “Yurinaki”, allí se encuentra su negocio, ubicado en la plaza de la comunidad, donde vende gallinas, patos y gansos, los cuales están bien alimentados y cuidados, es por eso que tiene muchos clientes y sus ingresos económicos son buenos. 
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es alimentar a sus aves, ya que los cría con mucho cariño, lleva 5 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer en su puesto todo el día en espera de clientes. Para el futuro, planea alquilar una tienda donde pueda brindar a sus clientes una mejor comodidad.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Teodosia con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más alimento para sus aves, ya que tienen que estar grandes y sanas.
texts.en:
Teodosia is 46 years old and has always worked very hard in order to excel in life. She lives in her own home with her husband Pedro, who is 41 years old and works as a bricklayer, and with her 3 dear children, who are the reason for all of her efforts. Her community is called "Yurinaki," and that is where her business is located, in the main square of the community, where she she sells chickens, ducks and geese, which are very well fed and cared for. It is for this reason that she has many customers and her income is good. What she likes most about her work is feeding the birds, since she raises them with much care. She has spent 5 years in this business and thinks the most difficult part is having to having to remain at her post all day, waiting for customers. In the future, she plans to rent a shop where she can offer her customers greater convenience. This is Teodosia's sixth loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make payments on time and is committed to doing so. She is a very cheerful and responsible member of her communal bank. With the one thousand nuevos soles requested, she will buy more food for her birds, since they must grow big and healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food for her animals

loans.name: Tasiana's Group

texts.en:
Tasiana E. is from the village of Locuban, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 57 years old and is the group leader of this five-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Tasiana is married and has six adult children.She owns and operates a business providing delivery service to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

He has been a habal-habal (a motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers) driver for four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Joseph joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. Joseph plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Tess' Group

texts.en:
Tess D. is from the city of Divisoria Santiago. She is 34 years old. Tess is the group leader of a 13-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tess D.'s group.

Tess is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Tess owns & operates a business hauling junk & other waste material for local businesses and community members. Tess has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Tess joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tess has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase used bottles and newspapers to sell. Tess is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase used bottles and newspapers to sell. This loan will be the 13th loan taken out by Tess from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase used bottles and newspapers to sell

Zyryl owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Zyryl joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Zyryl is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. loans.name: Teresa Gómez

texts.es: Teresa Gómez L. C. de 54 años de edad, reside municipio de El Calvario, ubicado en Sensuntepeque. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como profesor, así mismo junto a su hijo de 18 años de edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar en la universidad. Teresa se dedica a la confección de vestidos de fiestas y ocasiones especiales como bodas, graduaciones y 15 años, la calidad de sus costuras es muy buena por lo que posee una amplia clientela. Así mismo posee un pequeño bazar en el cual comercializa accesorios para hace recuerdos, álbunes para fotografías, centros de mesas y todo lo relacionado con eventos especiales. Teresa solicita un préstamo a Integral con el deseo de pode mejorar su negocio para obtener mayores ganancias las cuales son de mucha ayuda para su hogar, ella desea poder comprar más tela, flores artificiales para hacer los arreglos entre otras cosas más las cuales son muy útiles para realizar su trabajo. Ella es una mujer muy responsable, por lo que cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos, ya que siempre realiza su trabajo de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Teresa Gómez L. C. is 54 years old. She lives in the town of El Calvario, located in Sensuntepeque. She lives with her husband, who works as a teacher, and her 18 year old son, who is studying at the university. Teresa makes dresses for parties and special occasions such as weddings, graduations, and for 15 year olds. Her sewing is of very good quality and she has a lot of customers. She also has a small store where she sells accesories to make favors, photo albums, centerpieces and everything related to special events. Teresa is asking Integral for a loan with the wish to improve her business and have more income. This would be a big help for her home. She wants to buy more fabric and artificial flowers to make arrangements among other things that are very useful for her job. She is a very responsible woman, and she has good references with her neighbors since she always does her work in the best way.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric and accesories to make party favors.

loans.name: Florencio's Group

texts.en:
Florencio H. is from the village of Sta. Maria, Alicia, Isabela. She is 53 years old. Florencio is the group leader of an 11-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Florencio is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Florencio owns & operates a business selling vegetables in the local community. Florencio has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.
In 2009, Florencio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florencio is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Florencio from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es: Blanca Alicia A. D. C. D. 55 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo. La señora Blanca posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad, negocio gracias al cual ella pueda contar con una entrada extra D. dinero que le permite poder contar con todo lo necesario para sostener su hogar. Ella solicita un préstamo a Integral a través del cual pueda surtir su tienda con productos nuevos los cuales han sido lanzados al mercado recientemente pero que cuentan con mucho demanda como bebidas y golosinas, así mismo comprar mayor cantidad D. pan, leche, granos básicos y jabón, entre otros más. El mayor deseo D. Blanca es el D. poder superarse y poder seguir adelante, mejorando su negocio y D. esta manera poder contar con una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Blanca Alicia A. D. C. is 55 years old and she lives together with her husband in the region of Usulutan. Blanca runs a store from where she sells basic needs items. Thanks to her business she can depend on another source of income so that she will be able to get all that she needs for her home. She requests a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) so that she may stock her store with new products, such as drinks and snacks, recently introduced into the market and are highly sought out. She would also like to restock her store with a greater selection of breads, milk, basic grains, soaps, and other items. Blanca's greatest dram is to improve herself and find success, to improve her business and gain greater financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic needs products.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en: Charito R. is from the village of Argayoso, Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 39 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Charito owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. Charito joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Charito is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital
