Josefina is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Josefina owns & operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Josefina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Josefina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es: Zoila Esperanza A. O. de 48 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Santa María, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Vive junto a su esposo, quien se dedica a trabajar. Zoila posee una panadería la cual esta ubicada en su propio hogar, en donde ella junto a dos personas más se encarga de elaborar el pan, el cual es horneado en un horno artesanal en el cual se cocina el pan con fuego producido por leña, lo cual es muy llamativo para diferentes personas, ya que este oficio de esta manera es muy escaso en la actualidad. Zoila sale a repartir el pan con los diferentes clientes los cuales la consideran una persona muy trabajadora y responsable quien siempre entrega sus pedidos a tiempo, por lo que muchas personas la prefieren. Zoila solicita un préstamo a Integral, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en el negocio comprando toda la materia prima necesaria para la elaboración del pan, tales como harina, levadura, azúcar y otros más, así mismo poder comprar mayor cantidad de leña para obtenerla a precios más bajos. La panadería para Zoila ha resultado ser un negocio muy factible, el cual no solo le permite salir adelante como persona sino también salir adelante con su hogar.
texts.en:
Zoila is 48 years old and lives in Santa María, located in the Usultán department. She lives with her husband who works. Zoila has a bakery in her home, where she and two other people bake bread in a wood fired artesian oven. This attracts many people because this method of baking is very uncommon now. Zoila delivers the bread to different customers who consider her to be a hard working and responsible person. Many people prefer to buy from her because she always delivers on time. She is asking for this loan through Integral in order to invest in her business and buy ingredients and supplies such as flour, yeast, sugar, etc. She would also like to buy a large quantity of firewood in order to be able to buy at lower prices. They bakery has proven to be a successful business, not only allowing her to get ahead as a person, but also within her home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients and firewood

loans.name: Flor Lizeth

texts.es: Flor Lizeth V. G. de 38 años de edad, reside en Jucuarán, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután, al oriente del país. Vive junto a su esposo, en casa de unos familiares, y él se dedica a ayudarle a Flor con el negocio. Ella posee una venta de productos de primera necesidad como: papel higiénico, jabón, aceite y granos básicos entre otros más, ella los comercializa en su casa de habitación, y así mismo los vende de forma ambulante por diferentes colonias y cantones del oriente del país, en los lugares en los cuales no existen supermercados, razón por la que ellos obtienen muy buenas ganancias, ya que son pocas las personas que llegan a los cantones que Flor junto a su esposo visitan. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería, lo que le permita ofrecer más productos a las personas, en especial sus clientes, los cuales en muchas ocasiones le hacen pedidos previos. De esta manera Flor junto a su esposo se ganan la vida, trabajando de lunes a domingo con el deseo de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Flor is 38 years old and lives in Jucuarán, located in the Usulután department, in the east part of the country. She lives with her husband who helps Flor with her business. She sells basic household products, such as toilet paper, soap, cooking oil, basic grains, etc. She sells from her home and via mobile means along different streets and areas in the east part of the country where there are no supermarkets. This allows them to have a good income, as not many [sales]people go to the areas where she and her husband go. She is asking for this loan in order to buy items in bulk in order to be able to offer more products, especially to those customers who make special requests. Flor and her husband earn a living in this manner, working seven days a week, with the desire to move ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Walter Balmore

texts.es: Walter Balmore M. A. de 36 años de edad, reside en el municipio de El Transito, ubicado en el departamento de San Miguel. Vive junto a su familia, la cual esta conformada por su esposa quien trabaja como ama de hogar, y junto a sus dos hijos de 15 y 12 años de edad. Walter posee una panadería la cual esta ubicada en su propia casa de habitación, en donde se encarga de elaborar diferentes tipos de pan, como pan dulce y salado, los cuales los comercializa en su propia casa y así mismo lo reparte con los diferentes clientes que posee. De esta manera también posee vendedores los cuales salen a diferentes colonias en donde reparten el pan en bicicletas, lo cual les facilita su trabajo. Walter solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la panadería, y así poder comprar más harina, manteca, levadura y otros productos más los cuales son necesarios para la elaboración del pan. Para Walter es de mucha importancia mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos que posee para poder sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Walter is 36 years old and lives in El Transito, which is located in the San Miguel department. He lives with his family which includes his wife, who works as a housekeeper, and her two children, 15 and 12. Walter has a bakery, which he runs out of his home. He bakes and sells different types of bread, including sweetened and salty breads. He also sells along different streets, via bicycle, which makes his job easier. Walter is requesting this loan through Integral in order to invest into his bakery and buy more ingredients, such as flour, lard, yeast, etc. Improving his business is very important to Walter, since he needs this source of income to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients and supplies

location.town: El Transito, departamento de San Miguel

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda A. is from the village of Tambagan, Gingoog City. She is 40 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Luzviminda owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Luzviminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 5th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan C. is 66 years old and is a villager in Ta Reab Doun Sa village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Chhoeun Chham, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate vegetables to earn a living. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

In this farming, they do not have enough money to support their farming. Thus, Mrs. Chan C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for a farm laborer.

Mrs. Chan C. is the mother of a child who is also a farmer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for a farm laborer

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita G. has been an ASHI member since 1998. Her family is very thankful that she has an opportunity to improve their standard of living through the proceeds of the fishing and fish selling businesses she has established with the support of the loans she has requested.

Her husband’s support of her business is Estelita’s inspiration to keep going through the challenges of being poor but growing her business despite that. Over time, Estelita has been able to purchase a fishing boat for her husband to manage and use for fishing while she is the one who sells his fish directly to people in the market.

The fishing business has brought joy to Estelita’s family, especially to her personally. Because of its profits, she has been able to graduate her eldest 23-year-old child from college. However, her second child has not graduated from college but, nevertheless, Estelita has accepted the fact that she can’t have everything she has expected, especially with their poor economic status. Being a mother, she always wanted to support her son in whatever career he would be taking and that is being a fisherman just like his father.

With that, Estelita is requesting a loan from ASHI to be able to purchase another fishing boat for her son. This would not only provide him with employment but would also make their business grow and make more profit, which will enable her to support the education of her two youngest children to college level until they graduate.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing motorboat for her son

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Mr. Lang K. is 65 years old and is a villager in Preak Reussei village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Kin Nov, are farmers who own a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) field on which they cultivate rice to earn a living. His wife is shown on the left in the photo.

In this farming they face a problem because their farm has infertile soil and is far from the irrigation system. Thus, Mr. Lang K. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water pump. With the rest of the loan he wants to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support their farm.

Mr. Lang K. is the father of two children: one is seamstress in a garment factory and the other is a construction worker.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, fertilizer and pesticide for his farm

loans.name: Vevincia

texts.en: Vevincia R. is from the village of Duka, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 35 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Vevincia owns and operates a business planting and harvesting lanzones (a fruit) and mangoes for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. She is also engaged in buying fruit and sells it together with her own harvest to neighboring villages. In 2009, Vevincia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Vevincia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Roeunchan

texts.en:
Mrs. Roeunchan K. is a 27-year-old married woman who lives in Preak Ruessei village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Srim Sroeun, are farmers who own a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) field on which they cultivate rice.

Although this couple tries to work hard on their farm, they now face a problem because they do not have enough money to support their farm crops. Thus, Mrs. Roeunchan K. is requesting a loan to purchase a water pump to support the farm crop. She will use the rest of the loan to dig a well and to pay for farm labor.

This couple has two children who are too young to study or work. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, to dig a well, and to pay for farm labor

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Suranje Geethika

texts.en:
Suranje Geethika is a 34-year-old married woman who lives with her husband. She has two sons, 10 years and 7 years old. Her husband has a three-wheeler taxi that he drives for income. As a result, he is able to assist with her business. They are very close, and work well together.

Suranje used to have a coconut business, but then started a venture making and selling bricks which she sells to local customers. Two years ago she started this business. She cooperates well with others and has a lovely mood. She is very enthusiastic.

Suranje has requested a 50,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her brick business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the great support it provides to her.

loans.use: To use for her brick business

loans.name: Ith

texts.en: Mrs. Ith E. is 49 years old and she livE. in Ta Kol village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice and vegetablE. to earn a living. She doE. not have enough money to support the crops, so she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer, vegetable seed and gasoline. Mrs. Ith E. is a widow with a child who is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, vegetable seed and gasoline to support her crops

loans.name: Anonymous

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.en:
Wilfredo F. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. He is 46 years old, is separated from his spouse, and has three school-aged children.

Wilfredo owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Wilfredo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI.

Wilfredo is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to repair his motorcycle for him to continually operate his transport business. This loan will be his 3rd from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family’s income and support his children’s education. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en: Mrs. Sokheng K. is 46 years old. She is a villager in Daeum Pring village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Phally Meach, are vegetable sellers who earn a small income to support their family. They own two motorcycles and a Khmer trailer to support their business. Since their business is going well, they want to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Sokheng K. decided to ask for a loan to purchase more vegetables. The rest of the loan she will use to buy fish to sell. Mrs. Sokheng K. is a mother of four children. One of the children is a seamstress in a garment factory, two stay at home and support their parent's business, and the youngest is 10 years old. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

Honduras y D. todo el país D. El Salvador llegan a este pequeño pueblo a comprar prendas D. oro, el cual es el producto que más se venD. en este lugar ya que existen diferentes minas D. este metal en esta región, así mismo otro D. los comercios más fuertes es D.  ropa la cual se comercializa a muy buenos precios. Juana vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a la venta D. ropa. Ella posee su propio negocio el cual es una venta D. ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, la cual la comercializa a las afueras D. su casa, lugar muy concurrido por personas, por ser calle principal. Juana cuenta con muchos clientes, los cuales son compradores periódicos, lo que beneficia en gran manera a Juana. Ella solicita un préstamo a Integral con el fin D. poder comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa en diferentes estilos, colores y tallas, lo cual le permita obtener mayor cantidad D. clientes y D. esta manera poder aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Juana del Carmen A. D. G. is 39 years old and lives in Santa Rosa D. Lima, located in the department of La Unión. This town is very well known for its traD.: many people from Honduras and from all over El Salvador come to this small town to buy gold garments. This is the most highly sold product due to the many gold mines in this region. The other strong industry is clothing, which is sold at very good prices. Juana lives with her husband, who works in clothing sales. Juana has her own business selling clothes for men, women and children outsiD. her house. Her stall sees a lot of passerbys as she lives on the main street. Juana has many customers, some of whom are regulars, who are of great benefit to her. Juana is applying to Kiva's field partner Integral for a loan to purchase more clothes in different styles, colours and sizes, which will enable her to reach a greater number of customers and increase her sales accordingly.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes

location.town: Santa Rosa de Lima, departamento de La Unión

loans.name: Reynaldo's Group

texts.en:
Reynaldo R. is from the village of Gangawan, Amulung, Cagayan. He is 41 years old. Reynaldo is the leader of a 10-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Reynaldo is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Reynaldo owns and operates furniture-making business in which he makes and sells cabinets and wardrobe furniture to local businesses and community members. Reynaldo has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

Reynaldo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reynaldo is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to buy raw materials to make additional furniture. This will be Reynaldo's first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

loans.name: Medicia

texts.en:
Medicia B. is from the village of San Simon, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 51 years old, single, and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Medicia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Medicia has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2007, Medicia joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. She has chosen to request a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lalitha

texts.en:
Lalitha is a 47-year-old married woman living with her husband and daughter in the Galle district of Sri Lanka.

Lalitha has a cinnamon garden that she cultivates with her husband.  They started this business two years ago with her first loan from BRAC.  She is a very honest woman, and her husband and daughter help her to cultivate and sell her cinnamon.

Now she is asking for her second loan from BRAC in the amount of 45,000 LKR to help purchase some new land to further expand the cinnamon garden.

Ultimately, Lalitha hopes to renovate her house with her additional income.

loans.use: to help purchase new land to expand the cinnamon garden

loans.name: Iris Beatriz

texts.es: Iris Beatriz P. M. de 26 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su madre y su hermano, quien se dedica a estudiar. Iris es diseñadora de ropa, profesión en la cual se dedica desde hace 6 años, ella se encarga de elaborar y confeccionar ropa para mujeres, hombres y niños, elaborando un excelente trabajo, razón por la que cuenta con muchos clientes, los cuales confían en el trabajo que Iris elaborar, ya que posee varios años de experiencia, así mismo se destaca por ser una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora quien se esfuerza a diario para llevar el sustento hasta su hogar, su madre le ayuda a coser la ropa, la cual hace por pedidos previos. Iris solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de tela, hilo, agujas, botones y otros materiales de mucha importancia para la elaboración de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Iris Beatriz P. M., 26 years of age, resides in San Salvador where she lives with her mother and a brother that is still in school. Iris is a clothing designer, a profession she has dedicated herself to for the past 6 years. She makes clothing for women, men and children, and does excellent work, which is why she has many customers. They have confidence in Iris’ talents since she has a number of years of experience. She also stands out for being a responsible and hard-working woman, who puts forth a great effort each and every day to support her family. Her mother helps her sew, which she makes based on previous orders. Iris is seeking a loan to have the necessary funds to buy greater quantities of fabric, thread, needles, buttons, and other items that are key necessities for making garments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric, buttons, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila T. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old, married, and has three infant-aged children. To make a living, Sheila owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Sheila has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Sheila joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Magdalena's Group

texts.en:
Magdalena G. is from the village of Larion Alto, Tuguegarao City. She is 48 years old. Magdalena is the leader of a 11-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Magdalena is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Magdalena owns and operates a tailoring business where she provides general  alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Magdalena has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Magdalena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Magdalena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Magdalena is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be Magdalena's eighth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her house. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Mario Alberto G. G. de 34 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán, lugar en el cual vive junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar  junto a tres hijos de 3, 8 y 11 años de edad, de los cuales los dos mayores se dedican a estudiar. El señor Mario comercializa madera en su casa de habitación lugar en el cual vende por mayoreo su productos, repartiéndolo con los diferentes clientes, los cuales en su mayoría son clientes desde hace muchos años atrás, quienes por el excelente servicio prestado por Mario, le compran la madera. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar madera en mayor cantidad de manera que pueda obtenerla a precios más bajo, lo cual le permita obtener mayores ganancias. El mayor deseo de Mario es poder incrementar sus ventas, ya que es esta la única fuente de ingresos que posee para sacar adelante a su familia, quien depende por completo de él.
texts.en:
Mario Alberto G. G., 34 years of age, lives in Ahuachapán with his family that is composed of his wife, a homemaker, and three children ages 3, 8, and 11. The two oldest children are in school. Mario sells lumber from his home, where he distributes his product to customers at wholesale. He has had most of his customers for many years that, because of Mario’s excellent service, continue to purchase wood from him. He is requesting a loan to buy larger quantities of lumber to obtain the product at lower prices, and therefore augment his profits. Mario’s greatest desire is to increase his sales. This is because his business is the single source of income to support the family, as he is the sole provider in the household.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase lumber to sell.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario F. P. de 44 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su esposa, quien su mano derecha en el negocio, y junto a dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedica a estudiar. Mario posee un comedor, en el cual junto a su esposa se encargan de elaborar desayunos y almuerzos, los cuales comercializan con las personas que viven en los alrededores, como también con personas que transitan en el lugar, ya que el comedor esta ubicado en la carretera principal, lo cual lo hace muy visible para la mayoría de personas, sobre todo las que viajan por largas distancias, quienes se detienen a descansar y a comer. Mario solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para comprar granos básicos, bebidas, frutas, verduras y todo lo necesario para la elaboración de alimentos. Tanto para Mario como para su esposa es de mucha importancia mejorar sus ventas, ya que es esta manera en la cual se ganan la vida.
texts.en:
Mario F. P., 44 years of age, lives in La Libertad. He lives with his wife, who manages the business, and two young children who are in school. Mario has a food stall where, together with his wife, he makes breakfast and lunch to sell to local residents. He also sells to people passing by, as the business is located on a major roadway. This makes it highly visible, and a popular stop for travelers who have gone long distances and need to rest and eat. Mario is requesting a loan to have funds for the purchase of basic foodstuffs such as beverages, fruits, vegetables, and all the necessary ingredients to make his meals. It is very important, to both Mario and his wife, to increase their sales since the business is their livelihood.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for preparing food/meals.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita H. is from the village of Tinongos, Pugaan, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old, married, and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Amelita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Amelita has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Amelita joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

location.town: P-3, Pugaan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Crisilda

texts.en:
Crisilda C. is from the village of Bulwa, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Crisilda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting coconut fruits for sale. Crisilda has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
Crisilda joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Magdalena De Jesús

texts.es: Magdalena D. Jesús R. D.
texts.en:
Magdalena D. Jesús R. D. Ángel, 32 years of age, lives in Cuscatlán with her husband, a farmer, and two children ages 11 and 9 who are in school. Magdalena has a general store where she sells basic necessities. She has developed an excellent customer base, since hers is the only store in the area. Likewise, she sells staple grains that are harvested by her husband. Magdalena is requesting a loan to buy more products, in particular those that are in most demand by her customers. With Integral’s loan, she harbors the hope that she can increase her store’s sales and therefore generate more income to help her proviD. for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic necessities.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita A. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 52 years-old and married with five adult children. Teresita owns and operates a specialized retail business buying and selling green bananas in the local market. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Teresita joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. She decided to request the same amount of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rosa Alba

texts.es: Rosa alba R. Vda. D. Z. D. 48 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Candelaria, ubicado en el departamento D. Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su padre quien trabaja como agricultor, así mismo junto a su hermano y dos hijos uno D. los cuales estudia y el otro trabaja como comerciante. Rosa es una personas muy trabajadora quien se ha esforzado mucho por salir adelante, ya que tuvo que criar a dos hijos ella sola sin la ayuda D. nadie más. DesD. hace muchos años atrás que ella trabaja elaborando puros, los cuales comercializa con sus diferentes clientes quienes hacen pedidos previos los cuales Rosa por si sola se encarga D. elaborar y repartir. Ella es una mujer muy humilD. quien se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante y poder aportar a su hogar, ya sea alimento o lo necesario para poder mantener su hogar y D. esta manera salir adelante junto a sus hijos. Es por esto que solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder comprar tabaco por mayor y D. esta manera elaborar más cantidad D. puros.
texts.en:
Rosa Alba R. Vda. D. Z., 48 years of age, lives in the Candelaria municipality in Cuscatlán. She lives with her father, a farmer, her brother, and two children. One of her children is in school, and the other is working. Rosa is a very hard-working person, who has put forth great effort to get ahead as she had to single-handedly raise two children without receiving help from anyone. She has been making cigars, which she sells to her various customers, for many years. Customers place orders with her, and she alone makes and sells her product. She is a very humble woman, who works hard each and every day to get ahead and support the household, whether it’s to buy food or the necessary items for the home. In this manner, she would like to get ahead, along with her children. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy tobacco at wholesale and therefore be able to make a larger quantity of cigars.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tobacco.

location.town: Candelaria en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Missael

texts.en:
Missael B. is from the village of Kahulugan, Gingoog City. She is 33 years-old and married with three school-aged children.  Missael owns and operates a business  in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting coconut and mango fruits for sale. Missael has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Missael joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Missael has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. Missael is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Missael from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es: María de Jesús M. H. de 37 años de edad, reside en San Cristóbal, ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su familia, la cual esta conformada por su esposo el cual trabaja como albañil, y junto a sus dos hijos de 11 y 5 años de edad. María es una persona muy trabajadora la cual se dedica a múltiples actividades para poder obtener mayores ganancias, ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos, así también posee una venta de frutas, sus negocios están ubicados en su propia casa de habitación, lugar en el cual también se dedica a la elaboración de pupusas, las cuales comercializa todos los fines de semana. Con su enorme esfuerzo por obtener el bienestar de su familia, María demuestra ser una mujer muy luchadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante junto a su familia, es por esto que solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder contar con el dinero necesario para comprar productos alimenticios y de primera necesidad para surtir la tienda, negocio el cual le trae mayores ganancias, ya que posee muchos clientes.
texts.en:
María de Jesús M. H. is 37 years old and lives in San Cristobal, in the Cuscatlan department. She lives with her family which is made up of her husband who is a bricklayer and their two children who are 11 and 15 years of age. Maria is a very hard-working person who is involved in various activities in order to earn a higher income. She has a shop from which she sells perishable goods, including fruit. She runs her businesses from home, where she also makes pupusas [thick, hand-made corn biscuit-like flat bread] which she sells every weekend. By making an enormous effort to ensure the well-being of her family, Maria demonstrates that she is a fighter and is eager to get ahead with her family. It is for this reason that she is asking for a loan so that she can have the money to buy food items to stock her shop, a business that earns her a good income as she has many customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food items for her shop

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth J. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 32 years-old and married with three school-aged children. Maribeth owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (general) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Maribeth has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Maribeth joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. Maribeth is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Maribeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Astrid Grisel

texts.es: Astrid Grisel G. de 23 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Cojutepeque, un lugar muy famoso por sus deliciosos embutidos, lugar el cual esta ubicado en el departamento de Cojutepeque. Vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja en un restaurante. Astrid posee una venta de cosméticos, los cuales comercializa en su casa y de manera ambulante, realizando visitas a diferentes personas. Así mismo ella posee una venta de útiles escolares. Astrid solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de cosméticos y útiles escolares, así mismo desea poder comprar accesorios para computadoras, los cuales pueda comercializar desde su casa. Astrid es una joven con muchas ganas de seguir adelante, construyendo un nuevo hogar junto a su esposo.
texts.en:
Astrid Grisel G. is 23 years old, she lives in the Cojutepeque municipality, a place famous for its delicious sausages, located in the Cojutepeque department. She lives together with her husband who works in a restaurant. Astrid sells cosmetics, she sells them at her house and in the streets, visiting various customers. She also sells school supplies. Astrid is applying for a loan in order to buy larger quantities of cosmetics, school supplies, and computer accessories, all of which she will market and sell in her home. Astrid is a young woman eager to move forward, building a new home with her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and school supplies.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Mary Ann's Group

texts.en:
Mary Ann T. is from the village of Bitag Grande, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 36 years old. Mary Ann is the leader of a 5-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mary Ann is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Ann grows fruit trees, and then harvests and sells the fruit. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

Mary Ann joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP to expand her business. This will be Mary Ann's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo A. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 60 years-old and married. To make a living, Rodrigo owns and operates a business harvesting coconut fruits for sale. Rodrigo has been engaged in his business for over 18 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

Rodrigo joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rodrigo is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield.

loans.name: Rosita's Group

texts.en:
Rosita S. is from the city of Naggasican S.. She is 48 years old. Rosita is the group leader of a 22-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rosita S.'s group.

Rosita is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Indrawathi

texts.en:
Indrawathi is a 57-year-old married woman in Dangedara area, Galle district of Sri Lanka.  She lives with her husband and three children. She is a hard-working woman and very honest.

Indrawathi has a business in which she sells clothes at the local marketplace or a fair.  She has been doing this for 15 years, and now she is starting to build a tailoring shop and is seeking a loan.

Indrawathi has requested a 50,000 LKR loan from BRAC, which will be her fourth loan.  She has previously never missed a payment. 

She hopes to develop her business through building her own tailoring shop.  She has already  started to build up the shop and is seeking this loan to help make it possible.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: to help build a tailoring shop

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina E. is hoping that her rice farming business and its profits will bring change to her life and that of her entire family. Her husband is a hired laborer and is paid just a small amount of money. Their love for each other resulted in having three children. Their eldest now is 26 years old and has become Agustina’s partner in business. Because of having a sporadic and very poor economic status, Agustina’s second child has not been able to pursue his college education. However, because of having the opportunity to joining ASHI in 2009, she has able to receive a loan that she used to establish her own business.  Agustina has gained faith that she can support her youngest child’s education in college until graduation.

Because of having a very good performance in terms of repayment, attendance at the weekly meeting and in her business during her previous loan from ASHI, Agustina is confident in requesting a much larger loan this time to grow her business and its profit.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertlizer and rent equipment.

loans.name: Nazaret A Group

texts.en:
Nazaret A is a group of eight farmers in Oenif Village-Kupang District, East Nusa Tenggara Province. It is situated about 30 km (one hour's drive) from Kupang City. Even though this village is categorized as a remote place, the road into the village is good and has been sealed. There are 35 families who live in the village. The community in Oenif Village relies on farming as their primary income source. The most difficult challenge faced by the community is lack of water for watering their crops. They usually sell their agricultural crops in Inpres Market at Kupang City, as there is no traditional market available in the village. They take motorbike taxis to bring their agricultural crops to Inpres Market as there is no public transport from their village. It costs IDR. 20.000/ return trip.

Nazaret A Group is led by a 41 year old, Obednego L.. He is married and blessed with three nice children. They are: 
- Remli L., 17 years old, who is in the Second Grade of Senior High School
- Reliana L., 14 years old, who is in the Second Grade of Junior High School
- Rismi L., 7 years old, who is in the First Grade of Elementary School

Obednego relies on agricultural crops and the breeding of pigs and goats. Obednego is very concerned about his children’s education. For Obednego education is a priority for his children’s future. Currently, Remli is studying in a Catholic School in So’e - South Central Region of Timor in East Nusa Tenggara Province. It is situated about 150 km from Oenif Village, so they need a lot of money to pay his education costs. He has to send IDR 500,000 per month to pay for his son’s school, living expenses and daily needs. This is one of the reasons why Obednego has to work hard at selling his crops. Fortunately, his wife is able to help him with selling their agricultural crops at the market.

As the father of 3 children, Obednego dreams of providing a better life for his family and to support his children’s education through to University. The lack of capital is the main issue for him in improving his family’s living standard. Moreover, he also does not have any other skills to generate further income. One day he heard from the clergyman in the village that the Kiva field partner – TLM Foundation, assists poor farmers, particularly in West Timor, by providing loans through the Cattle Fattening Program. He is very interested in joining the program as he has experience in fattening livestock and he thinks this program will have a positive impact on his family’s future.   

Obednego discussed it with his neighbours and they are also interested in the program so they formed a group which is called Nazaret A. Obednego is requesting a loan of IDR 3,200,000 to buy a young cow to be fattened over a 12 month period. Other group members are also requesting loans to buy young cattle as they are sure this program is a good way for them to improve their families’ lives. 

Note: Sarlota and Sara were replaced by their family members when the group picture was taken.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened.

loans.name: Tong

texts.en: Mr. Tong T. is 60 years old. He is a villager in Trapeang Chrey village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Saron Kranh, are farmers who own a two-hectare field to cultivate rice and vegetables.  Mr. Tong T. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support his crops. He is a father of three children. One of his children is a seamstress in the garment factory and the others are students in the local school. His wife is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Py Rom

texts.en: Mrs. Py Rom C. is a 31-year-old married woman who lives in Pouthi Reamea village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Theng Nai, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow crops to earn a living. In order to support the farm, Mrs. Py Rom C. decided to ask for a loan to rent a piece of land to cultivate crops. Mrs. Py Rom C. is a mother of two children who are attending in the local school. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To rent a piece of land to cultivate crops.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel P. is from the village of Brgy. 5, Talakag Bukidnon. He is 58 years old. Manuel is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Manuel owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transport services to local community members. Manuel has been a motorella driver for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Manuel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Manuel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Manuel is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services he provides. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Manuel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna C. is from the village of Tinongos,Pugaan, Mis.Or. She is 40 years old. Lorna is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a service business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily operating a sing-along business in their local community. Lorna is just starting this business.

In 2010, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

location.town: Puga-an, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional commodities in bulk for her business.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en: With strong determination, Celerina M. believes that through the profits of her hog fattening business, she and the rest of her family will be led to a way out of poverty. That is why she works hard, with the support of her husband, to grow their business. For the financial support that her business needs in order to be enhanced, she is requesting a much larger loan from ASHI. In the hog fattening business, the more piglets being raised and sold either alive or slaughtered after four months, means the profit is as much as double the capital. This will enable Celerina to support the education of her child who is in college, by paying her tuition fees every trimester. Celerina’s basis for selling her hogs is the schedule of her child’s payment to school. With their daily family expenses and her payment to ASHI, she gets help from her eldest 26-year-old child who works as a cashier in one of the town’s stores and her husband, who gets sporadic income being a hired laborer.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for her fattening business.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en: Mrs. Saran Y. is 42 years old and lives in the village of Trapeang Chrey in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Tha Hy, are farmers who own a 1-hectare field to grow crops.  Aside from farming, Mrs. Saran Y., owns a general store to sell goods to get some income to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it, so Mrs. Saran Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business. With this loan she hopes to increase her income to improve her family's standard of living. This couple has five children, two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory, while the other three are students in the local school. Her husband is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: Grocery store inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lloyd-Ian

texts.en:
Lloyd-Ian S. is from the village of Brgy. 5, Talakag Bukidnon. He is 29 years old. Lloyd-Ian is single and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Lloyd-Ian owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transport services to local community members. Lloyd-Ian has been using his "trisikad" for his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lloyd-Ian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lloyd-Ian has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Lloyd-Ian is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lloyd-Ian from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Sroeun

texts.en: Mrs. Sroeun P. is 51 years old and she lives in Kandal village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Hong Sim Koem, are farmers who own a 2-hectare field to cultivate rice and vegetables to earn money for the family. In order to support the farming crops, Mrs. Sroeun P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water machine to water her crops. Mrs. Sroeun P. is the mother of a child who is a television and radio repairer in the local village. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a water machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional cloth for her business.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en: Mr. Sary S., a 45-year-old resident of Trapeang Chrey village in Kandal Province, owns a 1.50 hectare field upon which he cultivates rice. He currently lacks sufficient funds to support the farm and is therefore requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his field. His wife, Mrs. Pov Yinh, stays at home and takes care of their two children, one a seamstress in a garment factory, the other a student in the local school. Sary's wife is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en: Lucena T. is married to Jeffrey, they have 4 children and her eldest child is aged 23. She is 41 years old and an owner of a sari-sari store. She also owns a fishing boat and another one used for public transportation. She likes CEVI because of its low interest and its programs are good. She joined CEVI and is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000. Her loan will be used as additional capital for her sari-sari store in order to buy materials needed, and the remaining amount will be used to repair her boat.

loans.use: To buy store supplies and repair her boat.

loans.name: Mayolita

texts.en:
Mayolita C. is from the village of Union Kalinga, Luna, Isabela. She is 39 years old. Mayolita is married. To earn a living, Mayolita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling frozen chickens in the local community. Mayolita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Mayolita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mayolita is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Mayolita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional crates of soda for her business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad S. is a 29-year-old married man from Gaza. He lives with his wife and four children. In 2008, Ahmad opened a woman’s clothing store. He now is hoping that throughout this loan, he will be able to buy new summer clothes for women. By doing so, he will be able to bring in more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy new summer clothes for women

loans.name: Wara

texts.en:
Wara K. is 33 years old. She is happily married with two children, a boy and a girl who are both in primary school. She lives with her husband, who is a commercial bus driver, and children in Mountain cut, an area of Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. This is where she sells her lace materials. 

Wara has been a LAPOSL client for almost two years now and has taken four previous loans. With her previous loans, she bought more lace materials for sale and used her profit to support her family. Wara is seeking a loan of 3,000,000 Leones to enable her to grow in same business by buying more lace materials. She hopes to get more profit that will elevate her and her family from the grip of poverty forever.

loans.use: To buy lace materials for sale

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle Obipado has been enjoying spending the small profit her fishing and fish selling business make. Because of this she has been able to provide for her three children, ages four to nine, and has able to make quite an improvement in their lives. That success has inspired Annabelle to work harder and aim for further improvement for her business and family.

Annabelle knows that once all of her children are ready for a higher level of education, the amount of profit she earns now will not be able to support their needs. Therefore, she wants to take this opportunity to grow her business while her children are still young by requesting another loan from ASHI for additional business capital. She wants to buy and sell larger volumes of fish directly to people in the market and in their village. She also wants to have more fishing gear for her husband to catch more fish from the ocean.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing gear

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mrs. Kong M., 28 years old, has a rental kiosk inside the local market where she sells fish, vegetables, and some groceries. She is also assisted by her husband in selling groceries. Kong M. has been running her business since 2008 making around US$5 a day. The  couple has been married for many years but have no children. To increase the family's income and to make the business more successful, Kong M. has requested a loan to stock up on groceries, vegetables, and fish to sell. Note: Mrs. Kong M. was busy at her business activity when the photo taken so her husband is shown instead.

loans.use: To stock up on groceries, vegetables, and fish to sell.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.en: Ignacio M. is from the village of Brgy. 5, Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 45 years old. Ignacio is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ignacio owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transport services to local community members. Ignacio has been a driver in his "trisikad" (pedicab) for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Ignacio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ignacio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. Ignacio is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services he provides. This will be the second loan taken out by Ignacio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Luzviminda's Group

texts.en:
Luzviminda P. is from the village of D. V., Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 38 years old. Luzviminda is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Luzviminda is married and has seven school-aged children. To earn a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Luzviminda is just starting this business.

In 2010, Luzviminda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Luzviminda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Vanna Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Vanna C. is 44 years old and president of an eight-member loan group in Akreiksat village, Kandal province. Each member uses the loan for a different purpose. Mrs. Vanna C. is a mango seller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand and is asking for a loan to buy more mangoes. Her husband, Mr. Savorn Heng, is a security guard in a private company and earns a small salary. The couple has no children and live in a multi-family household.

loans.use: To buy more mangoes to sell

loans.name: Chhom

texts.en: Mrs. Chhom Y., 43, is a single mother living in Battambang Province. She earns a living raising pigs both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she cultivates a rice crop. Chhom Y. has four children — two of them single, one a vegetable seller and the other a construction worker. To make extra income and sustain her pig business, Chhom Y. will use her loan to buy more pig food and piglets to raise. She will also buy supplies for her rice farming.

loans.use: To purchase more pig food and piglets to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional clothing for her business.

loans.name: Senanayaka Mohottige

texts.en:
P. is a 47-year-old married woman living in the Bogahawaththa area in Galle with her husband and four children.

She has a coconut selling business supplying them to locals in her town.  In her business, she has passed five years successfully.  Her husband helps her to manage the business as well. 

P. has requested a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka.

She is hard-working and hopes to provide nutritious meals to her family and to give higher education to her children.

loans.use: to help expand her coconut business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of bundles of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr: Née en 1978 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, A. Françoise est mariée et mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Françoise vit avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Yénawa à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Il y a près de 12 ans que Françoise s'est installée dans ce quartier. Françoise vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges familiales, grâce au revenu issu de son activité. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Françoise vend en gros des produits additifs (cubes, assaisonnements, etc.) par le système de distribution. Françoise s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Françoise a obtenu déjà une fois de prêt à ALIDé et a bien effectué le remboursement. Françoise envisage développer davantage son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C'est la raison pour laquelle Françoise sollicite un deuxième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1978 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Françoise A. is married and the mother of three children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in the Yénawa borough of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, where they settled 12 years ago. Françooise helps her husband deal with family expenses thanks to the income generated by her activity. To meet her needs, she is a wholesaler of food complements (bouillon cubes, seasonings, etc.) through the distribution system. She resupplies in Dantokpa, Benin’s international market. Françoise has already been granted one loan from ALIDé, which was repaid in full. She wants to expand her business and improve her response to customer demand. This is why she is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cartons of food complements ("Maggi chicken" cubes, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional phone accessories for her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 28-year-old married woman with three children. Her eldest is only eleven years old. She dreams that her kids will be able to finish college and have a bright future. She runs a sari-sari store to earn a living. She wants to prosper in what she does. Jane is asking for a loan of Php15,000, which she will use to buy vinegar, oil and other supplies she sells at her store. She also hopes to buy piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong V. was born in 1955 and lives in Pun Phnum village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns one hectare of land to cultivate rice to support her family. She is a broom seller also. Although she tries to work hard, she cannot earn enough income. Thus, in order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Hong V. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is a widow with a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Nandani

texts.en:
Nandani is a 27-year-old married woman living with her husband and baby son in Dangedara, Galle district of Sri Lanka.

Nandani manages retail businesses which involve general goods sales as well as vegetables.  Her husband and brother help to support her ventures as she sells vegetables at the local fair, or marketplace.  She has been doing this business for 15 years now, and she is known to be a very hard worker.

This is Nandani’s second loan with BRAC, and she is seeking 30,000 LKR from BRAC.  She settled her first loan without any repayment delinquencies or problems. She is hoping to give good education to her children and hopes to open a second retail shop quickly.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: to help build a shop for vegetable selling

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy M. is a hardworking business woman, a resident of Wampeewo Luteete Kelezia zone. She is forty-eight years old and married with five children of whom one child is schooling. She has owned a retail business for over five years. Nancy will use this loan to purchase retail stuffs, such as sugar, soap, sweets, cooking oil and protectors, for sale. Nancy's hope is to educate her children to a university level.
