loans.use: To purchase retail stuffs for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of sandals and shoes

loans.name: Luy

texts.en: Mrs. Luy S. is 51 years old. She has owned a plot of farmland in Kompong Cham Province since 1980. There she grows all types of crops, which she plants twice a year. Beside her farm work, she has a few sewing machines that she and her husband use to sew the village’s clothes for extra income. Luy S. is a good mother of three children. Two of the children are single and one is married and lives away from home. Luy S. is married to Mr. Meur, 50, who assists her on the farm field. Luy S. has been planning to buy farmland in a good location near her village, but it is not possible because she does not have enough money. Therefore, Luy S. is applying for a loan to purchase a piece of land on which she will plant rice crops. Note: Luy S. was not available when the photo taken so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of farmland.

loans.name: Ma. Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 36 years old, married, and has four children. Her eldest child is now aged 20 and is off to college. She prays to God that she will be able to sustain all her children’s education.
Margie bakes delicacies and sells them in her community. She dreams of having her own bakery shop someday. She has requested 14,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI, and plans to use it to buy flour, sugar and other baking needs. This loan will truly help Margie reach her dreams in life.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar and other baking needs

loans.name: Mrs. Vanna Vong Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has eight people who live in Angk Prasat village in Takeo province. Mrs. Vanna V. is the village bank president, selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to support her family. Aside from this business, she is a fruit and fish seller in the local market, and she is also a wedding decorator. Since her fruit and fish business are going well, she wants to expand. Thus, Mrs. Vanna V. decided to seek a loan to buy more fruit and fish for re-selling.  She is a widow with a child who is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and fish for re-selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional bags of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Primo

texts.en:
Primo is 45 years old, married to Generosa, and a father to five children. He owns a motorcycle that he uses to transport people around his town. He makes sure that his motorcycle is well maintained because he wants to earn more to support his children’s education.
Primo also hopes to venture into other types of business. He has applied for a loan of 12,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. He will use it to buy tires for his motorcycle and also as start-up capital for a business selling electronic-loading for cellphones. He is hopeful that this loan will help him reach his goals.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle tires

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. is a resident of the Gayaza Kyetume zone. She owns a retail shop, which has been operating for over a period of six years. She is using the loan to purchase retail items such as soap, salt, sugar, cooking oil, rice and many others for sale. 

She is a hardworking businesswoman blessed with four children, one of whom is going to school. Her future hope is to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as soap, salt, sugar, cooking oil, rice, and many others for sale

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
W. Edward is married and has five children. He is a permanent resident of Naluvule Zone.
Edward has a poultry business and also sells water. He is using his loan to purchase drugs, feed and more chicks for his poultry business. He is a hardworking businessman whose dream is to obtain a taxi (car) to earn a side income.

loans.use: To purchase drugs, feed and more chicks

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en: N. Rajab is a father of four children, and he also looks after his father, Ssemanda Badru. For the past seven years, N. has owned a retail shop business in Mabombwe trading center, Wakiso. He is using his loan to purchase retail items such as soap, sugar, rice, flour, sweets, bread, biscuits, salt, juice, saucepans, etc. for resale, with the purpose of expanding his retail shop business. He is a hardworking businessman whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase retail items (e.g. soap, sugar, rice, flour, sweets, bread, biscuits, salt, juice, saucepans, cooking oil, etc.)

loans.name: God Power Group

texts.en:
Kuku W. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called God Power.  She is 32 years old, married, and has three children who range from five months to eight years old.  She was only able to attend school through third grade due to the loss of her parents. For six years, Kuku has been selling frozen food such as spare ribs and chicken at the Old Road Joe Bar Market. She sells her frozen food in a friendly manner that keeps customers returning. 

Kuku started selling with 3,000 Liberian dollars as working capital and now has about 8,000 Liberian dollars as working capital. She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 38,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more frozen chicken and spare ribs. Her goal is to grow her business to a larger size.


In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kuku is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more frozen chicken and spare ribs.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad G. is a 28-year-old single man from Ramallah. He is currently living with his parents and five siblings, two of whom are in school while another has entered college. Their income is currently coming from their father, who is a construction worker. 

Mohammad has been working in an electronics store since 2008; he does everything from selling phones and electrical appliances to fixing computer parts. He is hoping that throughout this loan, he will be able to buy all the appliances that he lacks in order to be able to improve the status of his shop.

loans.use: Spare parts for mobiles and laptops

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Mr. Jackson B. is 35 years old, married, and blessed with two children who are both in primary school. He is a carpenter who owns a workshop. He is using his loan to purchase machines, timber, frames, mattresses, cushions, cloth etc. for making sofa sets, chairs, tables and stools. He is a hardworking businessman whose future hope is to set up a good plan for his children.

loans.use: To purchase machines, timber, frames, mattresses, cushions, cloth, etc.

loans.name: God Blessing Group

texts.en:
Solomon D. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called God Blessing. He is 52 years old, married, and has four children who range from 10 to 19 years old. He also cares for two siblings. He was only able to attend school through 11th grade due to the Liberian civil war. For four years, Solomon has been sewing in a little shop at the E.L.W.A. Rock Hill community in Paynesville, Liberia. His service is not expensive to customers, which keeps them returning. 

Solomon started by sewing for people and was paid but now he sews and sells for himself. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more cloth to sew and sell. His goal is to buy more cloth to sew and serve his customers. 

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Solomon is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more cloth to sew and sell.

loans.name: Irangani

texts.en:
Irangani is a 46-year-old married woman living in Kekanadura, Matara. She has two daughters and two sons.

She is hard-working woman who has had a weaving business for six years. Her daughters are also involved in this business. 

She is requesting a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC as she hopes to  open a new weaving shop in the near future.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Roya Morsal Group

texts.en:
Morsal is the daughter of S. B.. She is 26 years old and the leader of the Roya Morsal group. She is married with five children: three sons and two daughters. Her youngest son is a college student in his first year and the others are students in school. Now she wants to take a loan for her husband who has a fresh fruit shop in the city of Kabul, He needs a small loan for his business to become strong and to help with his family in a better way. Therefore, she requested a loan for her husband who wants to expand and progress his business. He wants to complete his stock for his shop and start working hard.

She is very happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan and wants to thank the Kiva lenders around the world.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her husband's fruit shop

loans.name: Sar Zamin Group

texts.en: Sabria is the daughter of S. H.. She is 21 years old, married and the leader of the Sar Zamin group. She lives with her own family in Kabul, Afghanistan. She has a tailoring business. Her work is going well. She has to pay the rent for the house, the expenses of her one child and the house expenses. They do not have their own house. Their house is rental house. She has a small piece of land where she wants to build a small house that has two or three rooms, so she requested a loan in order to buy the required construction materials for her house. She is glad for this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy construction marerials

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is the daughter of R. A.. She is 43 years old, married and has seven children. She lives with her own family. She is a very honest, hard working and talented woman. She works in Kabul and has been working in the same area for more than four years. During this time, she has not been able to expand her business of weaving carpets. After trying her best, she needs some money to expand and buy some more tools for her business.  She hopes that after completing her stock, she can be more successful in her business and life. She is happy with this loan process in Afghanistan and hopes that this can be a successful process in this country in the future.

loans.use: To buy tools for her business

loans.name: Ndéye

texts.en: Ndéye N. is a 44-year-old married mother of seven children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" THIECKENE for three years and has always paid back her loans on time. As a main activity, Ndéye N. sells fish at the weekly market. She will use this loan to purchase fish.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Chandra

texts.en:
Chandra is a 30-year-old woman living in the Matara district in southern Sri Lanka.  She is married and living with her husband and one daughter.  Her husband drives a three-wheeler taxi, while her daughter is in school.  

Chandra has a tailoring business that she has been running for three years.  She has gone through special training for sewing and tailoring, which makes the quality of her work very high.  She also works very hard, keeping demand for her goods high.

Chandra has requested a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC in order to buy cloth for her tailoring business.  She hopes to improve her business with this loan and ultimately expand into further markets, attracting new customers.  

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: to buy cloth

loans.name: Yaba

texts.en: Yaba B. is 48 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" THIECKENE for two years and has always paid back her loans on time. Madame B. raises chickens. With this loan, she wants to buy new chicks to raise.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks

loans.name: Priyanthi

texts.en:
Priyanthi is a 36-year-old married woman living in Kekanadura area, Matara with two children and her husband. She works hard together with her husband to uplift their lives.  Priyanthi's husband has a carpentry business for which they are seeking a loan to expand their venture.  

She has asked for a loan of 25,000 LKR from BRAC in order to purchase some machinery to aid in the carpentry.  They have been in this business for ten years and they want to buy new machines for the carpentry through this loan.  She hopes to open a new carpentry shop in the near future.

Thank you for considering supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy some machinery

loans.name: Mélanie

texts.en: Mélanie B. is 47 years old, married and the mother of eight children. She has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" THIECKENE for nine years and has never had problems paying back her loans. Madame B. sells local fruit at the market. With this loan, she wants to buy tangerines, melons and oranges.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit to sell

loans.name: Anetou

texts.fr: A 40 ans, cette femme dispose encore de beaucoup d’énergie, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente en détail de Jus de fruits, sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes dont 70% représente des écoliers et des lycéens. L’avantage pour elle est qu’elle exerce son commerce à proximité d’une école. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis l’année 2000, pour faire les jus, elle va s’approvisionner en fruits au grand marché de Lomé. Le congélateur dont elle se sert pour exercer son commerce est vieux et en panne, elle souhaite acheter un autre congélateur raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter un congélateur et s’approvisionner en fruits.
texts.en:
At 40 years of age, this woman still deploys much energy in her revenue-generating activity, which is the retail sales of fruit juice. Her customers are varied but 70 % consist of schoolchildren and students. She has an advantage in that she conducts her business close by a school. She has been doing this since 2000, and gets her supplies from the main market in Lomé. The freezer she uses for her business is old and needs repairs, which is why she is requesting a first loan from WAGES, to buy a freezer and resupply with fruit.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a freezer and fruit

loans.name: Salimot

texts.en: Salimot sells drinks, groceries and foodstuffs in her shop. She has been in business for over seven years. She is very happy with her business growth. She lives in Lagos with her family. She is married with three children and she is 32 years of age. She is able to make a reasonable profit from her business, which she uses to support her husband who is a mechanical engineer. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks, foodstuffs and groceries to sell and make more profit for her business and her family upkeep. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, foodstuffs and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Joke

texts.en:
Joke is a mother of four children. She is 45 years old. She sells cooked food in front of her house and she has been in this business for the past six years. She lives in Lagos and her husband is a businessman. She is very determined and hopes to lift her family above poverty. She wants to own a shop where she can make more sales and increase her business and her profit. 

She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to buy more food items and pay for the shop rent. This, she said, will attract more customers to the shop and increase her profit. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more food items and pay for her shop rent.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad M. is 26 years old, single, and currently living with his mother in Ramallah. Ahmad has been working as a butcher in his own meat store since the year 2000. With this loan, he would like to buy freezers for his meat store in order to keep the meat fresh. His future goal is to open a store in downtown Ramallah in order to attract more customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy freezers for his meat store

loans.name: Baby  Yawa

texts.fr:
En 2008, cette femme s’est lancée dans le commerce de détail de savons qu’elle fabrique elle-même et qu’elle a appelé «SI JE SAVAIS », elle réalise de grosses recettes car ses savons  sont de bonnes qualités et sa clientèle en est satisfaite . elle a reçu une commende malheureusement elle ne dispose pas suffisamment d’entrants pour fabriquer les savons, elle s’adresse alors à WAGES pour obtenir son premier crédit afin d’acheter 3 bidons d’huile, une quantité suffisante de soude, du colorant,  du sel, et du charbons.
Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, avec le revenu de son commerce, elle contribue aux dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
In 2008, this woman launched a retail business of self-made soap that she has named “Si Je Savais “(If I knew). Her income is good because her soaps are of good quality and the customers are satisfied. She received a large order, but unfortunately the ingredients are insufficient to make the soaps. Therefore she contacted WAGES to obtain a first credit loan to buy 3 containers of oil, an adequate quantity of lye, dyes, salt and coal. She is married and the mother of two children. With the income generated by her business, she contributes towards family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy oil, lye, dyes and salt

loans.name: Dowoe

texts.fr: cette dame est mariée et mère d'un petit garçon , elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’agbalépédogan, elle exerce comme activité le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle a une ancienneté de plus de 10ans dans ce commerce ce qui lui a permis d’en maîtriser tout le contour. Elle traverse une période financière difficile alors qu’elle doit se réapprovisionner. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite de WAGES un prêt pour acheter des produits d’alimentation générale et satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
This lady is married and the mother of a little boy. She lives with her family in the Agbalépédogan borough of Lomé, and runs a general food products business. She has over ten years’ experience which allowed her to grasp all the ins and outs of the business. She is currently experiencing some financial difficulties at the time she needs to resupply. This is why she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy general food products and satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy general food products

loans.name: Fummi

texts.en:
Fummi is a very good businesswoman. She travels to the Republic of Benin to buy her palm and groundnut oil in gallons at a reduced rate and she said this will increase her profit. She started her business 16 years ago. She is 49 years old and married with seven children. Her husband is an electrician. She lives in Lagos and she supports her husband with her profits. 

Fummi is very happy with the growing nature of her business since she took her last Kiva loan. This has given her business a new look. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to buy more palm and groundnut oil in gallons to sell and avoid the risk of always traveling. She appreciates all lenders for their wonderful initiative.

loans.use: To purchase more palm and groundnut oil in gallons to sell

loans.name: Monnaye

texts.fr:
En 2008, cette femme a commencé le commerce de pagnes et de bijoux, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé, elle veut gonfler son stock pour dynamiser son commerce, elle sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit afin d’acheter une vingtaine de pagnes de différentes qualités et divers bijoux.
Elle est mariée mais n’a pas d’enfants, elle investit une partie de ses bénéfices dans les charges du foyer et l’autre partie dans son commerce
texts.en:
In 2008 this woman began a business selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and jewelry. She gets her supplies from the main market in Lomé. As she wants to beef up her stock supply to boost her business, she is requesting a loan from Wages, so she can buy around 20 pagnes of varying quality and a selection of jewelry. She is married without children, and wants to devote part of her earnings to household expenses and the rest to her business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pagnes and jewelry

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is a single lady about 24 years old. She trades to earn a living in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells clothes. Initially she hawked her clothes to make sure there were sales. But recently she rented a shop that is yet to be completed. Blessing said that she rented the shop and bought some of her goods with her previous loan from LAPO Microfinance. She is asking for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more clothes and repair the shop. This will attract more customers and she can increase her business and profitability. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and repair her shop.

loans.name: Karama

texts.en:
Karama J. is 27 years old and married to a driver. She has two children who both go to school. Karama is currently in the business of selling tea on the street in the evening. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of sugar, leaf tea and milk. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build up a restaurant.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, leaf tea and milk

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham B. is 35 years old, single, and has one son who is 15 years old. In addition to his son, he also supports his father and sister.
For five years, Abraham has been selling phone charge cards on Center Street, which is located in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He says that the location of his business is convenient, and that his customers keep returning because he communicates well with them.
Abraham plans to use his 71,000 LRD loan to buy more phone charge cards. His dream is to open a shop one day and, most importantly for his family, “to live happily.”

About LEAP
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women. Join the Team LEAP – Liberia lending team on Kiva today at http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To purchase additional phone charge cards

loans.name: Fasilat

texts.en:
Fasilat is 35 years old, married, and has two children who are both doing fine. Her husband is an electrician and they live together in Lagos, Nigeria.
Fasilat owns a shop where she sells groceries and foodstuffs. The shop is at the front of her house and this enables her to open the shop from very early in the morning to late in the evening, every day of the week. The shop serves as her means of livelihood, and she has been in this business for the past four years.
Fasilat is determined and optimistic about the growth of her business and the prosperity of her family. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for this wonderful initiative.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan J. is 30 years old and married to a peasant. She has four children who all go to school. Juan is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnut paste at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of onions to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay her children's school fees.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bags of onions to sell

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr:
Madame Bineta G. est  veuve et mère en charge de 3 enfants. Elle fait le commerce de bracelets, Thiouraye (encens) en face de l’hôpital régional de Thiès depuis 20 ans. 
En fait elle sollicite un prêt urgent  de 30 000 FCFA pour poursuivrele réglement des frais médicaux de son enfant âgé de 13 ans. En effet ce dernier est victime d’un accident et s’est trouvé avec sa jambe fracturée
texts.en:
Mrs. Bineta G. is widowed and has 3 children in her care. She has had a business selling bracelets and Thiouraye (incense) across from the regional hospital of Thiès for the past 20 years. She is requesting an emergency loan of 30,000 FCFA in order to be able to pay for of her 13 year old child's medical expenses. Essentially, her child was the victim on an accident and his leg has been broken.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her child's medical expenses

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Cette dame est très dynamique, en 2004 elle a commencé le commerce en détail des ignames, l’igname est une tubercule qui est très consommée dans la cuisine togolaise pour préparer une nourriture très appréciée par les togolais appelée « FUFU ». Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la ville de Bassar. Voulant se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit afin d’acheter une dizaine de tas d’ignames et assurer le transport de la marchandise.
Elle est veuve et a à sa charge ses 2 enfants, c’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’elle subvient à ses charges et à celles de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This woman is very dynamic; in 2004 she started a retail business selling yams. The yam is a root vegetable that is used extensively in Togo's cuisine in order to prepare a dish much love by the Togolese called "fufu". She supplies herself from the interior of the country, in the city of Bassar. As she would like to re-stock, she is requesting a loan from the organization WAGES, which she will use to purchase about ten piles of yams and in order to transport the merchandise. She is widowed and has 2 children in her care. With the revenue from her from her business she takes care of her needs and those of her children.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase yams

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Madame Sarr née Marie F. est mère d’un enfant âgé de 16 ans. Elle est enseignante dans l’élémentaire depuis 3 ans après avoir cessée d'exercer son métier d'animatrice et d'encadreuse de groupement de femmes pendant 8 ans dans une ONG.  Elle est atteinte de polyarthrite rhumatoïde  et souhaitait acquérir urgemment un prêt 100 000 FCFA pour régler des frais médicaux. Elle compte sur ce prêt pour régler un besoin personnel.
texts.en:
Mrs Marie F. Sarr is the mother of a 16 year old. She has been teaching elementary school for the past three years, after having left her profession as an community coordinator and trainer for a groups of women for an NGO for the past 8 years. She has rheumatoid arthritis and so she is requesting an urgent loan of 100,000 FCFA in order to pay for her medical expenses. She is counting on this loan in order to handle this personal need.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For medical expenses

loans.name: Keji

texts.en:
Keji E. is 29 years old and married to a driver. She has two children who both go to school. Keji is currently in the business of selling dried fish and tomatoes at the market, and is requesting a loan to stock onions and cooking oil to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build up a shop.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock onions and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Kaycee

texts.en:
Kaycee is 40 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is a fashion designer and they live in Lagos.
Kaycee sells baby items, such as baby seats, strollers and more, in her shop. She has been in business for the past three years and now wants to open another shop where she can sell the same goods in order to increase productivity and profitability. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more baby items to sell. Kaycee thanks all Kiva lenders for this great opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase more baby items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional animals for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 35 years old and widowed. She has four children who all go to school. She is currently in the business of selling locally brewed alcohol and beer at home, and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build up a bar.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cattle for her business

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en: Mr. N. Jamil is 29 years old and a successful businessman. He has a retail shop located in Kalerwe that he has been operating for over three years. He is using his loan to purchase more retail items such as cooking oil, sugar, foodstuffs, soap, oil and other necessities in order to increase customer satisfaction. He is a successful man whose dream is to own a large supermarket and poultry farm.

loans.use: To purchase more retail items such as cooking oil, sugar, foodstuffs, soap, oil and other necessities

loans.name: Abra Emma

texts.fr:
Cette femme a appris le métier de la couture en 1990, plus tard  elle n’avait plus assez de demandes, ses recettes  ont donc baissé. Pour remédier à cela elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de pagnes. Ce nouveau commerce lui a bien réussit et lui a permis de réaliser de meilleures recettes. Elle veut agrandir le commerce de vente de pagnes , ayant déjà  obtenu un prêt de WAGES qu’elle a bien remboursé, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit qui lu permis d’acheter 30 pagnes de hautes et moyennes qualités .
Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants
texts.en:
This woman learned to be a seamstress in 1990. Later decreasing orders caused her earnings to drop. She reacted to the situation by starting a business selling pagnes (colorful West African cloth). This new venture met with success and gave her better revenue. She now wants to expand her pagne-selling business. She has fully repaid a first loan from WAGES, and is now requesting a second loan to buy 30 pagnes of medium to high quality. She is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing fabric (pagnes)

loans.name: Bagaga Baagalana Group Of Mukono

texts.en:
S. Mai is a humorous 43-year-old married woman. She is in charge of a two-year-old butchery business in Namuyenje, Mukono district. From her business she has, in a way, managed to cater for most of her family’s needs, especially her four kids’ education.

Customers who insist on paying in kind for her meat have, to a large extent, put her fledgling business out of gear. As a consequence, her profits have not gained much ground as evidenced by the minimal 70,000 shillings, she makes weekly.

The optimistic Mai says she wants to make sure she gets increased deliveries of good quality meat supplies to her butcher shop. This also means her profits will also increase. She foresees a scenario where this is going to be possible, once he can obtain this loan.

loans.use: To pay for increased meat supplies to her butcher shop

loans.name: Hamiss

texts.en: Mr. W. Hamiss is a 30-year-old businessman located in Kibuli. He has been operating a video library for over three years and the business is very successful. He is using his loan to purchase different types of video CDs, audio CDs and new novels for his customers. His future plan is to open his own film-making studio.

loans.use: To purchase more video CDs, audio CDs and new novels

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional cloth for her business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 27-year-old Fatuma Issa P. from Coastal Region. She is married with two children between the ages of one and four.
Fatuma has been running a video library and video show since 2007. In this type of business, a television is put into a specific house and is used to show movies, football or comedy. A charge is made to people who want to watch.
Fatuma works at her business for seven hours per day, 16+ days per week, and is assisted by her husband. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 TZS in order to buy more video tapes and CDs for her business. In the future, she plans to expand her video library. Fatuma thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more video tapes and CDs for her business

loans.name: Gulu Development Of Mukono Group

texts.en:
Enormous expenditures of 26-year-old N. Sylvia’s energies have all been centered on expanding her small retail business which she opened three years ago in Ggulu, Mukono district. Though the competition to establish a niche in the market has been tough, she has managed to get into her business groove over the last two years.

The reliable stock in trade Sylvia has used in her business to lure customers, by her own admission, is her easygoing and friendly nature. These attributes have worked in Sylvia’s favor and, in the wake of this, she has managed to consistently balance her modest profits.

In a week, this mother of two reportedly makes close to 50,000 shillings a week. This is little money by any standards to solidify a growing business. As such, she is in need of a loan to aid her in buying more merchandise for her retail shop.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of merchandise such as cosmetics, clothes, shoes and mobile phones and their accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wheat flower and maize flower for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more vouchers for selling.

loans.name: Ytalo

texts.es:
Ytalo tiene 26 años, es soltero y vive en casa familiar que comparte con sus hermanos 
mayores; se dedica a la comercialización de pollo para las bodegas y puestos de venta 
de pollo ya sea en los mercados u otros establecimientos. Requiere el crédito para 
incrementar su capital de trabajo ya que desea empezar a trabajar con pollerias, 
quienes requieren de una fuerte cantidad de pollos diarios. Es una persona amable y 
cordial que cuenta con experiencia en el negocio.
texts.en:
Ytalo is 26 years old. He is single and lives in his family's home that he shares with his older siblings. He sells chicken to stores and points of sale for chicken whether it be in the market or in other establishments. He needs the loan to increase his working capital since he wants to start to work with poultry stores, which require a high quantity of chicken every day. He is a kind and cordial person who has experience in the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Tarapaca Group

texts.es:
El centro focal Senkata es  pequeño y se encuentra en una zona alejada del centro de la ciudad de El Alto. En centro focal se encuentra la Asociación Comunal Tarapacá la misma que está conformada por 8 integrantes.  Este grupo es nuevo y están motivadas a trabajar con fuerza en sus negocios, al respecto, ellas tienen variadas actividades económicas como la venta de comida, costura de prendas de vestir, trabajo de construcción, tejido de manta, servicio de transporte y atención de tienda de barrio
Elva M.  de 19 años, es esposa y madre de 1 niño, tiene el negocio de tejido de manta hace 3 años, aprendió esta actividad de su cuñada, ella esta solicitando Bs.- 1000 para comprar lana y seguir produciendo. Vende sus productos en la Ceja de la ciudad de El Alto  ambulando (ofrece sus productos persona a persona).
texts.en:
The Senkata regional office is small and in an area far from the downtown of the city of El Alto. The communal association Tarapacá is located in the regional office. It is made up of 8 members. This group is new and they are motivated to work hard in their businesses. They have various economic activities such as selling food, sewing clothes, working in construction, weaving blankets, transport service and attending to a neighborhood store. Elva M. is 19 years old. She is a wife and mother of a 1 year old boy. She has had a blanket weaving business for 3 years. She learned this activity from her sister in law. She is asking for Bs.- 1000 to buy wool and keep producing. She sells her products in the Ceja in the city of El Alto as a street vendor (she offers her products person to person).

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw material (wool)

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana tiene 35 años D. edad tiene tres hijos uno D. 16 años, D. 12 años y 1 año el más pequeño, ella vive en la Maica central es un cantón D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba al sud D. nuestra ciudad Ana es una mujer trabajadora se dedica a la producción D. leche.

Ana es una mujer que sufrió desD. niña con el desamor D. su madre ya que solo eran dos hermanas las cuales hacia diferencia entre las dos ella era la menor D. las dos  ella termino sola el bachillerato en un colegio D. barrio y la hermana en cambio siempre estudio en colegios caros en el centro D. la ciudad ella dice que esas cosas hacen daño sentimental. Ana no siente rencor por sus padres pero si está segura que ella jamás aria eso con sus hijos, ella termino una carrera técnica pero no la ejerce porque siempre está con sus hijos y ella trabaja en su casa con la producción D. leche y D. la misma manera realiza quesillos que luego los hace entrega a una señora y los pueda vender ella no espera el sueldo del marido ella sale sola adelante siempre trabajando y ayudando en la educación a sus hijos y colaborando con el cuidado a su padre al ser mayor él tiene problemas D. salud y es la que se hace cargo D. llevarlo al doctor cuidarlo.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar  una cabeza D. ganado y D. esa manera aumentara su producción D. leche y realizara mas quesillos y tendrá mayores ingresos y segura apoyando a sus hijos para que puedan terminar el colegio y poder estudiar una carrera y ella se siente feliz D. estar con ellos en todos sus momentos libres esta es la historia D. Ana.
texts.en:
Señora Ana is 35 years of age and has three children, ages 16 years, 12 years and the smallest is 1 year. She lives in the Maica central, which is a neighborhood of the city of Cochabamba to the south. Ana is a hard-working woman who is dedicated to the production of milk. Ana is a woman that suffered as a girl with the disaffection of her mother, since there were only two sisters which were treated differently. She was the younger and only finished a degree in the neighborhood school, while the other sister always studied in expensive schools in the center of the city. She says that those things do sentimental damage. Ana does not feel a grudge against her parents but is sure that she would never do that with her children. She earned a technical degree but does not practice it because she is always with her children. She works from her house producing milk and also making cheeses that she then delivers and sells to a lady. She does not rely on the salary of a husband. She goes on alone, always working and helping in the education of her children and collaborating in the care of her father. Since he is old, he has health problems and she is the one who takes charge of taking him to the doctor. She needs the loan to buy a head of cattle and in that way enlarge her production of milk and make more cheese. In this way she will have greater income and sure support for her children so that they can finish school and study for a career. She feels happy to be with them in all her free time. This is the story of Ana.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a head of dairy cattle.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo comarca la fragua, la señora María Isabel Z. M., se dedica a la producción agropecuaria dentro de la cual desarrolla el establecimientos de cultivos  de subsistencia como Maíz, ajonjolí, y sorgo los que le aseguran a demás de sus alimentos una pequeña fuente de ingresos que le ayudan con la mantención de su familia la que esta conformada en su totalidad de cuatro niñas y tres barones de diferentes edades los que le ayudan en las diferentes actividades, doña María Z. también se dedica a la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar los que le aseguran parte de la alimentación básica de su dieta, se le han financiado tres créditos para la compra de ganado bobino ya que cuando ella empeso no tenia ganado y poco a poco ha mejorado su condición de vida y aumentado su patrimonio, el financiamiento solicitado será invertido en compra de tres vacas paridas las que a su vez le aseguraran una mejor producción láctea y una mejor fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
In the “La Fruga” region of the city of Somotillo, María farms foods such as corn, sesame seed, and sogum. Not only do her crops provide her with food, but also a small income that she uses to help support her family. She has four daughters and three sons of different ages who help her. She also raises livestock, such as cattle, hogs, and poultry which also provides part of their diet. She has had three previous loans which she used to buy cattle. When she began she had no livestock of her own and she has slowly improved her quality of life. She will use the money from this loan to buy three dairy cows that will provide better milk production and a better source of income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dairy cows

loans.name: Union Estrellas Group

texts.es:
El centro focal Exaltación es relativamente pequeño y se encuentra en una zona alejada del centro de la ciudad de El Alto. En este centro focal se encuentra la Asociación Comunal Unión Estrellas la misma que está conformada por 8 integrantes.  Este grupo se ha conformado recientemente y están motivadas a hacer crecer sus negocios, al respecto, ellas tienen variadas actividades económicas como la venta de medias, poleras, papa y variada ropa deportiva.
Nilda C. de 34 años, vende poleras y ropa interior en la feria 16 de Julio y  desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de mayor mercadería y ofertar productos variados a sus clientes
texts.en:
The Exaltación area is realtively small and is located in a zone far from the El Alto city center. The “Asociación Comunal Unión Estrellas” (Stars Communal Union) is located in this area and is made up of eight members. This group was recently formed and its members are motivated to grow their respective businesses. They are involved in a variety of activities, such selling hosiery, polo shirts, and a variety of sports clothing. Nilda is 34 years old and sells polo shirts and undergarments at the July 16 fair. She would like to use the money from this loan to buy more items to be able to offer greater variety to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional wheat flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo es un hombre con 38 años de edad con su esposa Nilda Fuentes tiene dos niños pequeños viven en Vilomilla que es un cantón dentro la provincia de Sipe Sipe de la Ciudad de Cochabamba a 25 km a una hora de ida.

El señor Alfredo trabaja desde muy temprano y ayuda a su esposa en el ordeñado de las vacas para poder entregar la leche en el modulo lechero de Vilomilla que el siempre ayuda a la esposa en el corte de pasto el recojo de alfa alfa para la alimentación de las vacas no le importa estar cansado o enfermo el colabora y valora mucho a su esposa y a sus hijos, porque él dice son cosas que jamás las hacia  mi padre con mi madre se escuchaban gritos golpes pero nunca había colaboración eso yo no quiero para mi familia yo aprendí y desde niño hacer mas colaborados y mi padre no era así nunca ayudo a mi madre él es una persona que le gusta la bebida y siempre esta borracho hasta ahora pero gracia que ya soy un hombre puede ayudar a su madre y Nilda siempre lo apoya y ella también trabaja realizando quesillos o sembrando maíz o cebollas y ayuda en la educación a sus hijos ya que ninguno termino el colegio solo estudiaron la primaria ellos sueñan con ver a sus niños en la universidad.

Alfredo solicita el crédito para poder comprar más vaquitas y de esa manera sus ingresos serán mucho mejor ya que son minimos y no les alcanza pero él trabaja también de albañil los fines de semana para q no les falte nada a sus hijos ni a su esposa como también a su madrea hasta que ella está con por ser una persona mayor y estar enferma tiene muchos cuidados y ellos siempre están junto a ella Nilda la quiere mucho a su suegra y la cuida y eso le hace feliz y a que la vida lo vea mejor Alfredo que es un hombre que trabaja y lucha por conseguir sus sueños y brindarles una vida mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Alfredo is 38 years old and has two young children with his wife, Nilda. They live in Vilomilla which is an area located within the Sipe Sipe province, about 25 km or 30 minutes from the city of Cochabamba. Alfredo begins working very early in the morning and his wife helps him milk the cows in order to be able to deliver the milk. He then helps his wife cut and collect the alfalfa to feed the cows. It doesn’t matter whether he is tired or sick, he works. He greatly values his wife and children because, he says, “These are the things that my father never did with my mother. He could hear screaming and hitting, but there was never any cooperation. I don’t want that for my family. I learned to cooperate when I was very young, but my father was never this way. He never helped my mother. He likes to drink and is always drunk, even today. Thankfully now I’m a man able to help my mother.” Nilda always lends him her support and she is constantly working on making cheese or planting corn or onions. She also helps to educate their children, who did not attend school past elementary school. They hope to one day be able to attend university. Alfredo is asking for this loan in order to be able to buy more calves with which to improve his income. It is insufficient at the moment, but he also works as a mason on the weekends so that his children and his wife want for nothing. He also helps his mother, who is elderly and has a few problems with her health. Nilda loves her mother in law very much and takes care of her and this makes him very happy and makes him more optimistic. Alfredo works hard and struggles to give his family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Milk cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan, 52, is married to Felix.  She operates a general shop, selling food items like cooking oil, flour, matchboxes etc.  This is her primary business for two years now.  She stays in the Kirigu trading center near Kikuyu town.  Joan is also into  dairy farming.  She keeps cows for milk production. 

This area is a very favorable environment for livestock and crop farming.  Her clients are mainly residents who buy items on a retail basis.

She has previously borrowed from ECLOF before joining KADET.  This is her first loan with KADET.  She hopes to expand her shop and add at least four more dairy cows for more milk production.

loans.use: Buy more stock for her general shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase additional commodities for her business.

loans.name: Namanve Group Of Mukono

texts.en:
If parallels are drawn in comparing this 35-year-old’s status to many of Kampala’s wealthy boutique owners, they would show a great contrast in terms of financial gains. While the boutiques in Kampala drive roaring trades, this hardworking woman faces a daily formidable uphill task of maintaining afloat her three-year-old boutique business in Kirangira in Mukono district, on a modest monthly budget of 80,000 shillings.

N. Sarah’s belief in her own worth has not dampened, however, despite this insufficiency in her business profits. She knows she has two school-going children to take care of. Her husband of seven years also relies on her. With a loan, she is optimistic her prospects will improve, as she says she will be able to restock her boutique with new and high-quality garments for all different categories of her customers.

loans.use: To rejuvenate her bontique with new stocks of ladies', gents' and children's garments

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La señora Rosa de 53 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, trabaja como responsable de programa de apadrinamiento desde hace varios años.  En donde se ayudan a niños de pocos recursos. Su esposo es camarógrafo y ambos trabajan para lograr las mejoras a su vivienda. Anteriormente trabajaba para el ejercito de Nicaragua, el cual renuncia y tiene mejores beneficios en el trabajo actual, no solo en el ámbito económico, si no en el ámbito de poder ayudar a muchos niños. Con este financiamiento desea poner perlinez al techo, ya que es de madera pero no esta en buen estado es por eso la necesidad de hacer el cambio, así como pintar para lograr una mejor seguridad como mejor comodidad junto con su familia. con el crédito anterior logro mejorar las paredes, y repellar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa is 53 years old and is a hard-working woman. She has been running a mentoring programme for several years whereby she helps children who have little. Her husband is a cameraman and they work together to do up their home. Previously she worked for the Nicaraguan Army, she gave this up and does better by working in her current job, not only financially, but also as she is able to help many children. She would like this loan so that she can have purlins to support the roof which is made of wood that is not in very good condition and so needs to be changed. Painting it will make it more secure and comfortable for her family. She used a previous loan to improve and plaster the walls of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beams, hinges and other materials to change from a wooden to a beam roof will be more secure and durable.

loans.name: Volver A Empezar Group

texts.es:
El centro focal Juan Pablo II es  uno de los más grandes  y se encuentra en una zona céntrica del centro de la ciudad de El Alto, por esta razón muchas socias llegan con facilidad ya que existe transporte. En este centro focal se encuentra la Asociación Comunal Volver a Empezar la misma que está conformada por 10 integrantes.  Este grupo se ha conformado recientemente y están motivadas a hacer crecer sus negocios, al respecto, ellas tienen variadas actividades económicas como la venta de cosméticos, CDS, ropa, producción de calzados, vajillas, electrodomésticos y comida.
Verónica A.  de 41, es socia antigua ya que ha podido participar de diferentes grupos durante 15 años. Verónica  es madre de dos niñas y tiene el negocio de venta de vajillas hace 17 años, trae su mercadería de Oruro ya que los compra con menor precio  vende todos los días en la Avenida Tihuanaku de la ciudad de El Alto. Verónica también manifiesta  que le gusta compartir con sus amigas y que en Pro Mujer cuidad su salud.
texts.en:
The Juan Pablo II branch office is one of the largest and is located in the Céntrica zone of the city of El Alto, so many members are able to arrive with ease, now that there is transportation available. The “Asociación Comunal Volver a Empezar” (Begin Again Communal Association) is located here and made up of ten members. This group was recently formed and its members are motivated to grow their businesses. These businesses include cosmetic sales, CDs, clothing, shoes, kitchen utensils, small appliances, and food. Verónica is 41 years old and is an experienced member. She has been working with different groups for the past 15 years. She is the single mother of two girls and has had her kitchen utensils business for the past 17 years. She brings her merchandise in from Oruro, where she can buy items for lower prices, and sells them on the Tihuanaku Avenue in El Alto. She also tells us that she likes to spend time with her friends and likes the fact that Pro Mujer helps care for her health.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Agnes Salome

texts.en:
Agnes is 36 years old, married and a mother of four children. She runs a beauty salon at Umoja market. Her customers are from Umoja and its environs.

Agnes was introduced to KADET by a friend who was already a member. She has a credit history with other organizations but had already cleared the loan before joining KADET.  This will be her first loan with KADET. 

With this loan, Agnes wants to bring electricity to her salon so she can offer good and quality services to her clients.

Her husband, Jason, works as a driver who supplements the family’s income. Agnes hopes to buy a piece of land and construct rental houses. This loan will bring the family extra income.

loans.use: Bring electricity to her business premises.

loans.name: Arlen Patricia

texts.es: Arlen es una joven de mucha iniciativa, lleva varios años  administrando su  negocio la venta de ropa de segunda  mano y cosméticos el cual inicio con el apoyo de su esposo proveniente de su trabajo como albañil, solo tiene un hijo el cual esta pequeño, su mayor objetivo es poder mejorar su pequeño cuarto ya que tiene poco espacio el cual espera poder hacer un aumento para tener mejor comodidad. Tiene en inventario ropa la cual espera vender pronto y poder ver las ganancias, con los financiamientos ah logrado aumentar las ventas ya que tiene muchos encargos de la Avon ya que trabaja mediante catálogos. Con este préstamo comprara ropa nueva, ropa interior para dama y caballero, así como una variedad de crema para el sol en este verano lo cual se vende por ser de buena calidad y accesible de precio. Sus planes a futuro es poder tener un modulo en donde pueda exhibir su ropa a los clientes y así lograr mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Arlen is a young lady with initiative - she has been running her business selling secondhand clothes and cosmetics for several years. She started out with the help of her husband who is a bricklayer. She has only one young son. Her main objective is to be able to do up their small room as they have such little space. She hopes to make it a bit bigger so that it is more comfortable. She has a stock of clothes that she hopes will sell quickly and will give her an income. With the money she wants to increase her sales as she has many orders from Avon as she works through the catalogues. With this loan she will buy new clothes, underwear for men and women as well as a variety of good quality suncreams for this summer which she will sell at an affordable price. In the future she would like to have a stall from which she can display her clothing to her clients and thus increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy underwear for men, women and children, as well as creams, colours and perfumes

loans.name: Picaflor Group

texts.es:
EL BANCO D. EMPRENDIMIENTO PICAFLOR CUENTA CON  10 SECUENCIAS D. ANTIGÜEDAD LA MISMA QUE ES REPRESENTADA POR SU DIRECTIVA.

LA SRA. OLIMPIA ES LA PRESIDENTA DEL BANCO, ELLA ESTA CASADA Y ELLA TIENE A SU CARGO 6 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. COMIDAS EN EL MERCADO LA PAMPA, SU ESPOSO LE AYUDA EN ESTA ACTIVIDAD Y JUNTOA A EL TRATAN D. SACAR A SUS HIJOS ADELANTE, TRABAJAN MUCHO Y TIENEN GANAS D. SUPERARSE Y ASI MEJORAR LA CALIDAD D. VIDA D. SU FAMILIA, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA INSUMOS PARA LA ELABORACION D. SUS COMIDAS Y PODER ASI INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL D. TRABAJO. 

LA SRA. RHINA ESTA COMO TESORERA ESTA CASADA Y TIENE DOS HIJOS ELLA ES REPOSTERA D. PROFESION Y SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION Y VENTA D. TORTAS ES MUY CONOCIDA EN LA ZONA POR REALIZAR EXQUISITAS TORTAS ES MUY ALEGRE Y TRABAJADORA SIEMPRE ACTIVA, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA INGREDIEMTES PARA LA ELABORACION D. SUS MASAS Y TORTAS Y ASI PODER INCREMENTAR SU CAPITAL D. TRABAJO.

TODAS LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON PERSONAS D. LA ZONA D. MINERO SAN JUAN, LAS MISMAS QUE SE CARACTERIZAN POR SU SENCILLES Y HUMILDAD CON RELACION AL NIVEL D. EDUCACION CON LA QUE CUENTAN, SIN EMBARGO SON PERSONAS EMPRENDEDORAS CON GANAS D. SALIR ADELANTE Y PARA ELLO SOLICITAN EL CRÉDITO PARA EL AUMENTO D. SUS MERCADERIAS Y D. ESTA MANERA GENERAR MAYOR UTILIDAD PARA EL SUSTENTO D. SUS FAMILIAS.

TODAS LAS SOCIAS ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDAS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Picaflor bank has had 10 previous loan rounds represented by the same director. Mrs. Olympia is president of the bank. She is married and has 6 children of school age. She sells meals in the Pampa market. Her husband helps her with this business and together they do their best to make a better future for their children. They work hard and earn money to improve their family's quality of life. With the money from the loan she will buy ingredients with which to make her meals and so increase her working capital. Mrs. Rhina is the treasurer, is married and has two children. She is a confectioner by traD. and makes and sells cakes. She is well known in the area for her exquisite cakes. She is very happy and hardworking, always keeping busy. With the money from the loan she will buy ingredients for her cakes and will increase her working capital. All of the members of the group are from the San Juan Mine region and are characterised by their sensitivity and humility. They have received little education yet they are entrepreneurial people who wish to get ahead in life and this is why they are requesting the loan to improve their businesses. In this way they will best be able to support their families. All of the members are very grateful to the lenders and Kiva for having faith in them and awarding them credit.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase their working capital

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 36 years old, married and a father of three children.  He has operated a general shop for the last four years.  He stays in Muthiga estate, which is near Kikuyu town.  His customers are mainly residents of Muthiga and the surrounding area who buy small quantities of items for domestic consumption.

He has had no previous credit history before joining KADET and this is his second loan with KADET.  His wife Mary is in business as well and their three children are all in school. Charles plans to use this loan to restock his retail shop with some necessary items.

Charles hopes to own a large wholesale shop to supply all shops in the Muthiga and Kinoo area.

loans.use: Buy stock for store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase equipment for carrying milk e.g., buckets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional bags of wheat in bulk

loans.name: William Fredy

texts.es: El Señor William  es un cliente nuevo que llego a la empresa por consejo de su hermana Claudia que trabajo con la institucion años atrás. William se dedica a la carpinteria desde los 21 años y  ya un año  que decidio independizarse y abrir su propio taller en su domicilio, por estos meses el señor realiza trabajos pequeños como reparaciones, ensamblaje, lijado y barnizado de muebles, estos pedidos le llegan continuamente ya que durante sus años de trabajo en otra carpinteria pudo establecer contactos con clientes que lo siguieron por su buen trabajo, existe una empresa en especial con la que trabaja denomianda HUAWEI que se dedica a la ayuda de niños con problemas, esta empresa es una de sus clientes mas fieles y ahora como William tiene mas experiencia en su trabajo le solicitaron que realice muebles para la institucion,  este trabajo implica una inversion en madera ya que se le pagara por avance de trabajo ademas de eso el cliente tambien esta armando una nueva cierra circular y comprara un motor mediano y 2 sierras para el mismo, con este credito el señor William ira creciedo tanto en clientes como en experiencia, es por eso que se solicito que el credito sea un credito KIVA, es muy trabajdor y responsable a pesar de su corta edad, el desea tener una carpinteria muy reconocida y asi tener clientes que valoren su calidad en el trabajo, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito
texts.en:
Mr. William is a new client who came to the bank on the advice of his sister Claudia who has worked with the institution in previous years. William has been a carpenter since he was 21 years old and a year ago decided to go it alone and open his own workshop in his house. During the last few months he has done small pieces of work such as repairs, assembling, sanding and varnishing furniture, These orders come in continuously and during his years working with the other carpenter he was able to establish contacts with clients who have followed him thanks to the quality of his work. He works with a special organisation called HUAWEI which helps children with difficulties. This company is one of his most loyal customers and now that William has more work experience they have asked him to make furniture for the institution. This work requires an investment in timber which must be paid for in advance. He will also need a new circular saw and will buy a medium motor and two saws for it. With this loan, William will win more clients through his increased experience. It is for this reason that he is asking for a loan from Kiva. He is very hard-working and responsible despite his young age. He wants to be a well-known carpenter and to have clients who value the quality of his workmanship. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting him by giving him a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood (cedar, mara, pine) and machine accessories

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is 31 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She is a dairy farmer and has been in the farming business for the last two years. She stays in Nderi Estate which is near Kikuyu Town.

This area is a very favorable environment for both livestock and crop farming. Her clients are mainly residents of the area who buy milk for their domestic consumption.

She had no previous credit history before joining KADET, and this is her second loan from KADET. She hopes to buy more cows to produce more milk, which will generate more income for her family.

loans.use: Peris plans to buy another dairy cow for more milk production.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is 18-year-old Hilda Ashery G. from Morogoro. She is single, with no children. Hilda has been running a tailoring business since 2008. She purchases vitambaa (material), vitenge (a traditional Tanzanian cloth with wax print), and kanga (printed cotton fabric, often with a border along all four sides) and makes them into clothing, mainly for women.

She works at this business for 9-12 hours per day, 7 days per week. Hilda is requesting a loan of  300,000 TSH in order to purchase additional cloth for her tailoring business  in order  to expand her business. Hilda thanks you for your support!

About SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is the 39-year-old single mother of four children. She stays in Kayole Estate. She sells used clothes in Dohnholm, which is in the outskirts of Nairobi and is a very busy place in terms of business, with a relatively high population. Her customers are mainly from Dohnholm and its environs.

Agnes was introduced to KADET by a friend who was already a member. She has previously borrowed from a bank, but this loan has already been cleared. This is her first loan from KADET.

With this loan, Agnes wants to buy more clothes for sale and start developing her plot of land so that she can construct rental houses for more income.

loans.use: She wants to buy more clothes, especially ladies' clothes, for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase and sale of pagnes and headscarves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy equipment such as buckets and baskets for delivering milk.

loans.name: Kilangira Development Group Of  Mukono

texts.en:
S. Florence is 42 years old and is married with eight children ranging in age from 25 to 2. The children are all pursuing an education.

To support her children, Florence works in a stone quarry in Kirangira in Mukono district. She has been doing this for the last three years. In a week, she reveals, she is able to make 60,000 Ugandan shillings.

In these three years of operation, Florence has faced a number of challenges, overriding among these being the changes in seasonal customer preferences. During construction booms, her business, which has a reputation for producing good stone quarry products, basks in the glow of increased profits; at other times the reverse is true.

Florence’s future plan is not only to boost her fledgling business but also to open up a retail business. This she thinks will come to pass once she is able to obtain a loan.

loans.use: To buy new stone-breaking equipment to help ease her work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more chicks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a single mother of two children. Her children go to school. She owns a two-room house where she stays with eight people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Regina takes care of additional family members. Monthly expenses include medication, rent, school fees and feeding the family. Regina owns a stall selling all types fruits and vegetables like passion fruit, watermelon and pineapple and sells to all categories of people at retail only. She works seven days a week. Regina receives at least 20 customers a day. She has been in this business for 10 years and her business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She has been with MCDT for many years servicing her 18th loan.  She wants to use this loan to buy more pineapples, sacks of passion fruit and watermelons. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and go directly to farmers. Her business challenges include transporting the watermelons and seasonality premises. She joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women.

loans.use: To buy more passion fruit, pineapples and watermelons

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business.

loans.use: Buy a new engine

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La Señora Elizabeth se dedica a la compra de productos como semillas, granos, comida balaceada, harina de yuca y papa al por mayor, su trabajo se inicia dividiendo  junto con una balanza y empaquetando pequeños paquetes de comida para aves de 250 y 500 gramos mezclando las semilla y  granos o tambien comida balanceada, y despues se los comercializa en su puesto de venta,  adicionalmente entrega paquetes de harina de yuca y papa del mismo peso, estos productos son entregados por pedido cada 15 dias en los supermercados de la ciudad, los mismos que le solicitaron que elabore paquetes de refrescos organicos (PITO) de quinua, amaranto, cebada y otros  para los meses que vienen y es por eso que la señora solicita este credito ya que necesita un capital a parte para comprar estos pitos, los pitos son harinas de maiz cebada, haba que se usan muchos de estos productos  como dieta diaria en muchos hogares de muestro Pais. La Sra. Elizabeth esta muy agradecida con emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Elizabeth buys wholesale products such as seeds, grains, bird feed, yuca and potato flour. Her work begins by dividing the products into portions using scales and making small packets of bird food: 250 and 500 grammes of mixed seeds, grains or bird feed. Then she sells them from her stall. She also weighs out the same size packs of yuca and potatoes. These products are delivered to order every fortnight to the town's supermarkets. These same supermarkets are also asking her to make up packets of organic quinoa, amaranth, barley and other things for the coming months. This is why the lady is asking for this loan as she needs money to buy these things. She needs corn and barley flour and broad beans. Thes products form the basis of the daily diet in many homes throughout the country. Mrs. Elizabeth is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for trusting her by giving her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair dryer and cosmetics for her salon.

loans.name: Karla Geraldina

texts.es:
La señora Karla Geraldina A. J., tiene en 36 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos, los cueles se encuentran bajo su dominio, viven en el Barrio Laureles Sur, es casada y su esposo le apoya económicamente.

Se dedica a la venta de repuestos de motocicletas, y en estos últimos meses se ha enfrentado con la dificultad de salir a ofrecer de forma ambulante los repuestos con su hijo recién nacido, ahora que el niño ya se podría quedar con su hermano el cual tiene 21 años de edad, ella solicito un préstamo para la compra de mayor inventario de repuestos, el resultado de este apoyo econpomico le presento mejores expectativas de las que estaba esperando, debido a que vendio en su totalidad, todos los repuestos que habia adquirido, gracias al prestamo, es de esta manera que la señora Almendàrez, ha podido mejorar sus capacidades  financieras y le permitara condiciones optimas de vida para toda su familia.
texts.en:
LKarla Geraldina A. J. is 36 and has two dependent children. They live in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. She is married, and her husband helps her economically. She sells replacement parts for motorcycles. In the last few months she has had difficulty leaving to sell the replacement parts as a street vendor with her newborn son. Now her son can stay with his 21 year old brother. She requested a loan to buy a greater inventory of replacement parts. The result of this economic help was better than she had hoped for. She sold everything, all of the replacement parts that she had, thanks to the loan. This is the way that Mrs. A. has been able to improve her financial capability, and it has allowed for better living conditions for her whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a greater inventory of motorcycle replacement parts

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a woman who says she is “at the prime of life!”  She has two daughters who are both grown up now. One has already completed her university studies and the other is completing university soon.  She is very proud of them both for their schooling and commented that education “is the best gift you can give your child.” 

Betty describes herself as a very hard-working woman. She says that you have to be hard working if you are in the business of poultry farming because it is such an involved business.  Betty raises layers (chickens that are raised for consumption) behind her home. Currently she thinks she has between 200-400 chickens.  She buys them when they are one day old and then she raises them till they are fat enough to sell.

There are some real challenges in this business because there is a lot of competition for a small market.  In the areas where Betty sells there are lots of hotels and restaurants that want to buy her chickens, but many people know this in her neighborhood – so people are competing to be able to sell. 

It is too bad when there is too much competition because it forces poultry farmers to keep their chicken until they are too large.  In order to keep the chickens growing and healthy, it is a must that you keep feeding them well, but the more you spend on feed per chicken the lower your profit margin. 

Betty is taking a loan today for 40,000 KSH.  She hopes to be able to buy a few hundred more chicks with this amount, as well as the feed to make them grow! In the future, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land, both where she can build a good home and also so that she can build some other homes where people can rent from her.

loans.use: 200 chicks and some bags of feed

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a 27 year old married mother of one young boy.  Her son is 8 months old at this time, and he is her only child so far.  She dreams of having a bigger family one day, but with her business small like it is – she only has the capacity for one.  Dorcas describers herself as a very hard working woman.

Dorcas works as a tailor.  She has been in this business for 3 years. She began immediately after completing a school where she learned the trade of tailoring.   She says that she attracts customers through her friendly attitude and customer service.

Today Dorcas has requested a loan of 15,000 KSH. This loan will be used to purchase more materials for her tailor business.  With future loans she hopes to buy additional sewing machines and even employ people to help do her work.

loans.use: Extra materials and cloth

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes for her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional wheat flour for her business.
