loans.use: To purchase additional wheat flour for her business.

loans.name: Elva Sonia

texts.es:
La Sra. Elva vive en casa familiar y se encuentra casada con don Horacio que trabaja como ejecutivo de ventas en Multivisión con el que tiene dos hijos que se ecuentran en edad escolar, la Sra. Elva tiene como actividad la venta de pollos a la Broaster en un restaurante que se encuentra en su domicilio, actividad que lo realiza todos los dias a partir de las 17:00 horas hasta largas horas de la noche y tambien tiene 2 vehiculos de los que recibe la renta diaria de sus vehiculos que trabajan en Radio Taxi, esta empresa de radiotaxi es propiedad de su Tio.

El crédito solicitado es para comprar mercaderia para su negocio de venta de pollos a la broaster, el mismo que se encuentra ubicado en la calle Buenos Aires en la zona Tiwiña, que es la casa de sus papas, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Elva lives in her family’s house. She is married to Horacio, a sales executive with Multivisión. They have two school-age children. Elva sells roasted chickens in a restaurant in her home. She does this everyday from 5:00 p.m. until late at night. She also has two vehicles, and she receives daily rent for them from Radio Taxi. The Radio Taxi business is her uncle’s. The loan she has requested is to buy merchandise for her business of selling roasted chickens. The business is located on Buenos Aires Street in the Tiwiña area in her parents’ house. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in giving her the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a single mother of five children.  All her children go to school. She owns a two-room house where she stays with eight people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Edith takes care of additional family members. Monthly expenses for Edith include medication, school fees and feeding the family. 

Edith owns a wooden store near her home where she sells charcoal. She sells to all categories of people both using retail and wholesale selling methods. She works seven days a week. During this time, she usually receives at least 20 customers a day. She has been in this business for 10 years and her business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

Edith has been with MCDT for many years servicing her 24th loan.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and go directly to producers. She also wants to educate her children up to the university level.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Mwanaidi

texts.en: Mwanaidi is a 30 year old married woman with two daughters, who are 9 years old and 9 months old. Her older daughter is attending fourth grade in school. She has been running her poultry business raising broilers (which are chicken for consumption) for five years already and owns 200 chicken currently. With the 70,000 KSH loan she hopes to repair her poultry farm which was damaged recently by termites, and buy more chicken. Her customers are mainly hotels and restaurants. She hopes to start another business someday, perhaps in cosmetics. Mwanaidi describes herself as a hardworking woman and hopes to provide her children with a good life.

loans.use: More chicken and to repair poultry farm

loans.name: Diamantes Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal DIAMANTES, en su Secuencia 5, está formado por 9 clientes, 7 mujeres y 2 varones, la mayoría de las socias pertenecen a la Zona de Kupini, que están ubicados en los alrededores de la parada  de microbuses de la línea 16.  Las socias se dedican a la venta de diversos productos como ser, de ropa libros cuadernos cosméticos, carpintería, etc. En la secuencia anterior todas cancelaron a excepción de dos socias que pagaron con atrasos, las cuales fueron retiradas del banco, las demás socias cancelaron sin retrasos y solo se quedaron 4 socias, las demás son integrantes nuevas.

La Sra. Bertha Es la representante, actualmente toma el cargo de la presidenta del banco se dedica a la compra y venta de autos, cuenta con esta actividad hace 7 años, también trabaja como chofer de taxi de manera independiente, el préstamo será destinado para el arreglo de su movilidad. Viuda  cuenta con  2 hijos a los que supo sacar adelante con su trabajo, En su banco comunal se ha destacado como una persona responsable y puntual en sus pagos.

La Sra. Laura  Socia que asume el cargo de tesorera del banco, se dedica a la venta de material escolar en una librería ubicada por la parada del micro 16, se dedica a esta actividad hace 1 año, el préstamo esta destinado a la compra de material escolar por mayor. Casada con el señor Valentin  que trabaja en la Terminal de buses, tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar. Es una de las representantes en su banco comunal, que ha sido elegida para el cargo por su  responsabilidad que ha demostrado con sus compañeras hace dos ciclos atrás y retorna nuevamente. 

La Sra. Rocío  es elegida como secretaria , se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos y otros artefactos en las ferias y otros días por la zona central de la ciudad de La Paz, casada con el señor Boris que es chofer. 
El préstamo esta destinado para la compra de mercadería.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras, estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The Diamantes (Diamonds) Communal Bank is in their fifth cycle. It is comprised of nine members, seven women and two men. Most of the members live in the Kupini Zone, which is located in the area surrounding the bus stop for line 16. The members sell various products like clothes, notebooks, cosmetics, and carpentry, etc. In the last cycle everyone paid except for two members whose payments were in arrears. They were removed from the bank, and the rest of the members paid without delay. Only four members remained, and the rest of the members are new. Bertha represents the bank, and she is currently the president. She has been buying and selling autos for seven years. She also acts as an independent taxi driver. The loan is to fix her vehicle. She is a widow with two children. She knew how to get her children ahead through her work. She has stood out in her communal bank as a responsible person who is punctual with her payments. Laura is the treasurer of the bank. She sells school materials in a bookstore, which is located at the stop for bus line 16. She has been doing this for one year. The loan is to buy school materials wholesale. She is married to Valentin, who works at the bus terminal. They have two school-age children. She was elected as a representative of her communal bank because she is responsible. She has demonstrated this to her colleagues for two cycles, and she will do so again. Rocío was elected as the secretary. She sells domestic appliances and other devices at fairs. On other days she sells in the central zone of the city of La Paz. She is married to Boris, a driver. The loan is to buy merchandise. All of the members are responsible and hard-working. They are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix vehicle, buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wheat flour and cups for her business

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is a 32 year old single woman. She is supporting her cousin's son, 13, and two daughters, 8 and 5 years old, who all attend school. She has a small retail shop, where she sells sugar, bread, milk, eggs, potatoes, as well as homemade fried pastries such as mkati wanazi, mitai and mahamri. She has had her shop for ten years. Her customers are neighbors, children, and tourists, who often pass her shop on their way to the major tourist attraction in her city on the coast of Kenya. 

This is her first loan with Yehu and with the 20,000 KSH, she hopes to purchase sugar, flour, detergent and soap for her shop. If she manages a profit from her business, she will spend it on rent, the kids and their schooling. She hopes to someday earn something for herself and to start another business to support her when she grows old. Hajara describes herself as a simple and hardworking woman, who is trying her best to have a good life.

loans.use: Sugar, flour, detergent, soap and other items for retail shop.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour to make bite-cakes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth Q. is from the village of Wahigan, Pagalungan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 35 years old and married with four school-aged children. Elizabeth has a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products. Elizabeth has been in the business for over two years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase products to sell. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan she taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for the education of her children. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

Shella May has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Shella May joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shella May has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Shella May is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Shella May from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. Juvy has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

texts.es:
En el barrio Carlos Fonseca  Municipio de Somotillo 
El señor J. C.   realiza su trabajo como chofer de una ruta de taxis Somotillo Guasaule dándo les da servicio de viajes a todos los clientes de las comarcas y alos del casco urbano.
 El quiere el crédito para comprar de  30 bolsas de cemento  para la construcción de una pared en su casa de habitación y de esta manera tener una mejor seguridad para el su familia
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of Carlos Fonseca, municipality of Somotillo, Rodolfo works as a chauffeur on the taxi route Somotillo-Guasaule, providing transportation services for all customers of the region, as well as for those of the urban center. He needs the loan to buy 30 bags of cement (and to pay for labor) to construct a wall in his home. In this manner, he hopes to provide greater security for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING 30 BAGS OF CEMENT AND PAYING LABOR COSTS FOR BUILDING A WALL IN HIS HOME

Hilda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Hilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hilda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Hilda is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Hilda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. loans.name: Ramón Ignacio

texts.es:
En el barrio Germán pomares  Municipio de Somotillo 
El señor R. M.realiza su trabajo como recolector de los impuestos de los pagos de bienes y muebles dándoles atención a todos los clientes de las comarcas y alos del casco urbano.
 El quiere el crédito para comprar una puerta de hierro para su casa de habitación y de esta manera dar seguridad a su familia

In the Germán Pomares neighborhood in the Somotillo municipality. Mr R. M.works as a property tax collector covering all regional clients and those in the urban area. He wants the loan to buy an iron door for his home so that his family is more secure.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita A. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis oriental. She is 54 years old. Conchita is married and has three adult-aged children. Conchita owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling bananas as well as coconut shells used in making charcoal in the local community. Conchita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Conchita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 4000 PHP and was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Conchita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to expand the business. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita C. is from the village of Talakag Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Enriquita is married and has five school-aged children. Enriquita owns and operates a fruit and vegetable farm. Enriquita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Enriquita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Enriquita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Enriquita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to expand the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Enriquita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Gérarde

texts.fr: Z. Gérarde est née le 03 Octobre 1979 et est mariée à ADIDO Jean, un informaticien. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Gérarde vit depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Tchinvié, dans le deuxième arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Gérarde habite avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Gérarde  n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire, mais a appris la couture. Il y a quatre ans que Gérarde exerce comme activité la vente de divers produits cosmétiques, de façon ambulante. Gérarde achète ses produits au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo, mais également à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Gérarde a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, et les a tous bien remboursés. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et d'accrître son chiffre d'affaire, Gérarde sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Gérarde Z. was born 3 October 1979 and is married to Jean ADIDO, a computer specialist. The couple has two children, both attending school. Gérarde has been living for the past ten years in the Tchinvié area of the 2nd borough of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She lives with her children and her husband, with whom she shares responsibility for family expenses. Gérarde has only attended school at the primary level, but has learned to be a seamstress. For the past four years she has sold various beauty products as an itinerant vendor. She sells her products at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo, but also in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Gérarde has already been granted two loans from ALIDé, both of which have been repaid in full. Wishing to strengthen her activity and increase her turnover, she is now requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita M. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. She is 61 years old. Esterlita is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Esterlita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Esterlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Esterlita from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. loans.use: Buy planks

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is married with seven children. Two of her children finished school and the rest are still schooling. She owns a two-room house where she stays with six people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Fatuma takes care of additional family members. Monthly expenses include medication, school fees and feeding the family. Fatuma owns a grocery store in Naguru where she sells samosas, pancakes, donuts, fried groundnuts, sugar, soap and bread. She sells to all categories of people at both retail and wholesale. She works six days a week. Besides this grocery shop, she also owns a popcorn machine.  Fatuma receives at least 20 customers a day. She has been in this business for five years. She has been with MCDT for many years servicing her 17th loan. She wants to use this loan to buy bags of sugar, bread, ground nuts, milk and cooking oil. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and own a supermarket. She joined MCDT because it was near her home.

loans.use: To buy more bread, sugar, groundnuts and popcorn

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is married with two children. Both of her children go to school. She owns a two-room house where she stays with six people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Agnes takes care of additional family members.Agnes owns a food stall in  Kanyanya she sells bananas, cassava, tomatoes,  oranges and passion  friuts. She sells to all categories of people at retail and at wholesale. She works six days a week.Agnes receives at least 20 customers a day. She has been in this business for five years. She joined MCDT because it was near her home and was giving out loans in groups.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La  señora Rosa María M., tiene 42 años de edad, vive en Sabana Grande, es casada y su esposo le apoya económicamente, él labora como fresador en un taller de torno, ellos tienen 2 hijos, los cuales se encuentran bajo su dominio.

Ella es comerciante y dentro de sus anhelos, esta la compra de un terreno en donde instalar una tienda de ropa, por esta razón  de superviviencia es que solicita un préstamo para la compra de utencilios plasticos, y ropa veraniega apra ofrecerla en la temporada que se avecina, con este apoyo económico,  tiene la ilusión que a futuro podrá realizar la apertura de dicha tienda y que esto le conlleve a mejores condiciones económicas o el capital necesario para futuras inversiones.
texts.en:
Rosa María M., 42, lives in Sabana Grande. She is married and her husband supports her economically. He works as a miller in a workshop. They have 2 children who are in currently in their care. She is a merchant, and her wish is to buy some land where she could set up a clothing store. For this reason she requests a loan to purchase plastic utensils and summer clothing to offer in the coming season. With this economic support, she hopes that in the future she will be able to open her store, and that this will lead to better economic conditions or the capital needed for future investments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy plastic utensils and used clothing for summer

loans.name: Cecil Mariela

texts.es:
La señora Cecil Mariela A. P., tiene 28 años de edad, vive en el barrio lomas de Guadalupe, es casada y juntos se apoyan con los gastos del hogar, él señor trabaja como supervisor y ella como inspectora de calidad, ambos laboran en zonas francas, ellos tienen 3 hijos.

Dentro de las necesidades más primordiales que tienen como familia, esta la remodelación de su hogar para esto ellos solicitan un préstamo para el cambio de techo de la vivienda, debido a que se encuentra en pésimo estado y amenaza con la inseguridad familiar, con este apoyo económico esperan mejorar sus condiciones de vida que favorezcan  toda la familia, sobre todo a los hijos menores que son los que habitan todo el tiempo en el hogar.
texts.en:
Cecil Mariela A. P., 28, lives in the Lomas de Guadalupe neighborhood. She is married, and she and her husband jointly support the household. He works as a supervisor and she is a quality control inspector. They both work in the free trade zone. They have 3 children. Among the most basic needs that the family has is the renovation of their home. To do this they are requesting a loan to replace the roof of their house, since it is in terrible shape and threatens the security of the family. With this economic support they hope to improve the living conditions of the entire family, most of all for their young children who spend much of their time in the home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to replace the roof of their home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing grocery and haberdashery items

loans.name: Pastora

texts.es:
La señora Pastora V. Z., tiene 42 años de edad, vive en el barrio la Primavera, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos, ella tiene un pequeño comedor en donde ofrece frescos, almuerzos, cocteles, frijoles.

Ella hace unas semanas la operaron de una hernia que le ha obstaculizado el convivir de manera habitual en las labores de su negocio y del hogar, ahora que se ha restablecido paco a poco, solicita de un préstamo para la compra de materia prima, para la venta de cocteles, esto le permitirá elevar las ventas y por ende sus ingresos, de tal manera espera se le apoye como en años aanteriores a mejorar su estabilidad económica y favorecer el status social de la familia.
texts.en:
Pastora V. Z., 42, lives in the La Primavera neighborhood. She is single and has 2 children. She has a small eatery where she offers soft drinks, lunches, shrimp cocktails and beans. She had surgery a few weeks ago for a hernia that has hampered her ability to live in the usual way, working in her business and her home. Now that she is gradually recovering, she requests a loan to buy raw materials for the sale of shrimp cocktails. This will allow her to increase her sales and also her income. She expects that this support, as in previous years, will help her improve her economic stability and will promote the social status of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shrimp
