Josephine is requesting a second loan, for 8000 PHP, which will be used to to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to again purchase additional products to sell.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Las Picaflores Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “Las Picaflores” y está conformado por 15 socias, pertenecientes a la comuna de Padre las Casas en la ciudad de Temuco. Ellas se dedican principalmente a la confección de ropa y accesorios para el hogar, pastelería, paquetería; venta de leña, empanadas y sopaipillas.
La socia entrevistada fue Débora, quien es la presidenta de este banco comunal. En la foto se encuentra en 2º fila, a la derecha y viste chaleco gris y camiseta café. Su negocio consiste en la confección de buzos, los cuales vende para algunos colegios. También confecciona disfraces, vestidos, ropa a pedido en general y accesorios para el hogar entre otros. Quiere invertir este préstamo en comprar géneros, cintas, encajes, blondas e hilos. 
La gran motivación de Débora fue ayudar económicamente a su mamá que estaba muy enferma. Cuando falleció, Débora continuó con su negocio, lo cual le ha ayudado mucho, junto con los talleres y reuniones semanales que tiene con su grupo de Fondo Esperanza, en su desarrollo personal, logrando así superar esta importante pérdida. 
Una de sus metas más cercanas es comprar una máquina bordadora y su sueño es tener un taller de confección establecido en un lugar céntrico de la ciudad.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This village bank is called “Las Picaflores”. It is made up of 15 members from the Padre las Casas county in the city of Temuco. They mainly work making clothes and accessories for the home, baked goods, small business; selling firewood, small pies and fried dough. Débora was the member interviewed. She is the president of this village bank. In the picture she is in the second row to the right and she is wearing a gray jacket and a coffee colored shirt. Her business consists of making sweat suits, some of which she sells to schools. She also makes costumes, dresses and clothes to order in general and home accessories among other things. She wants to invest this loan in purchasing material, ribbon, lace and thread. Débora’s big motivation was to economically help her mother who was very sick. Débora continued with her business when she passed away. This helped her a lot in her personal development, together with the workshops and weekly meetings she has with her group at Fondo Esperanza. She was able to overcome this important loss this way. One of her more immediate goals is to purchase an embroidery machine and her dream is to have an established sewing shop in a central part of the city. Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (capital of Chile). It has a series of marshy spas and very colorful vegetation and wildlife. It is worth stating that 50% of the mapuches, indigenous people, that exist in our country are living in this region.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Material, ribbon, lace and thread.

loans.name: Terrazas Group

texts.es:
El Grupo terrazas esta compuesto por tres socios, Mayra (venta de comida), Cesar (Venta de comida), y Elsa (venta de fruta y comida) todos viven en Ciudad Peronia, Villa Nueva.
Mayra es la lider del grupo, ha trabajado desde hace 6 años en la venta de comida en el cual le va muy bien. Tiene 29 años, esta casa y tienen dos hijos uno de 14 y uno de 10. Su negocio ha ido incrementando gracias a la buena atencion al cliente que ella ofrece a sus clientes. Doña Mayra solicita el crédito para poder invertir en  su venta, y asi poder brindar un mejor servicio y al mismo tiempo brindarle un mejor futura a sus hijos. Este prestamo ella lo utilizara para comprar una plancha de tortillas
texts.en:
The Terrazas group is made up of three members: Mayra (who sells food), Cesar (who also sells food), and Elsa (who sells fruit and other food). All three live in the city of Pernoia, Villa Nueva.

Mayra is the leader of the group and she has been working for the last three years selling food and business is going well. She is 29 years old, married, and has two children, one who is 14 years old, the other who is 10. Her business has grown thanks to her attentiveness to her customers. Mayra is asking for a loan to invest in her business so that she will be able to offer a better service to her customers and offer a better future to her children. This loan will be used to buy a tortilla press.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in her business, food sales

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elizabeth Teresa

texts.es: La Señora Elizabeth Teresa H. P. se dedica a la venta de anticuchos desde hace dos años aproximadamente,eligio este tipo de trabajo ya que su madre contaba con este mismo negocio y fue quien le enseño y la oriento para realizar este negocio. El credito que se le esta otorgando es para invertir en su negocio comprar mas mesas y sillas y asi su negocio se ampliaria. No es casada pero tiene dos hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad, ellos estan en etapa escolar. La señora Elizabeth sueña con tener mas adelante un local propio en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Ms. H. P. Elizabeth lies near the vineyards surrounding ICA and sells anticuchos (skewers of meat). She is a single mother and lives in her own house. She is asking for a loan to invest in her business since she would like it to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: invest in her business

loans.name: Mujeres Solidarias (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Solidarias es uno de los tantos bancos comunales formados en la ciudad de Cuenca en la comunidad de Chican en el  cantón Paute en la región centro sur del país, este cantón es reconocido por la presencia de la Hidroeléctrica Paute la más grande del país y  por su producción artesanal.

María del Carmen  tiene  veinte y tres años de edad, se encuentra casada y fruto de su unión concibió dos  hijos quienes se encuentran de cinco  años y estudia en primer año de educación básica, el otro tiene apenas dos meses de nacido,  su esposo trabaja en la elaboración de estucos (cielos rasos), no tienen casa propia  por lo que viven en casa de su madre. Ella se dedica a la cría de animales como borregos, pollos, ganado que los vende en su comunidad, también compra hortalizas para revender en el mercado de Paute, tiene un puesto propio y vende solo los días domingos, esta actividad lo realiza desde sus trece años de edad.

Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo en la Fundación Espoir,  los préstamos  le han beneficiado para el crecimiento de su negocio, ingreso al bankito gracias a su mamá quien la invito, con el nuevo crédito va a comprar crías de pollos, alimento y vitaminas  y  algunas  verduras como zanahoria, remolacha, rábano, acelga, etc.

 Su meta es llegar a construir su casa propia.

La señora  Berta V.  tiene cincuenta y seis  años de edad,  separada de su  cónyuge hace cuatro  años porque la maltrataba mucho y le ocasionaba muchos sufrimientos, en su unión conyugal procreo cuatro  hijos que se encuentran de 33, 30, 26, 22, su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, el segundo se encuentra fuera del país, por lo que vive con su tercera hija que es madre soltera y con su último hijo de 22 años. Nos comenta que  se siente muy orgullosa de tener su casa propia esfuerzo de toda su vida.

 Es socia del Banco Comunal  Mujeres Solidarias hace un año y el credito obtenido lo invirtió en su negocio de pollos  ya que ella se dedica a la cría y venta de borregos, pollos y cuyes que luego son vendidos en su comunidad cuando tiene algún apuro económico, con el nuevo crédito va a adquirir más  crías de pollos, alimento y vitaminas  para así seguir con su negocio, su meta es de llegar a terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Mujeres Solidarias (Solidarity Women or Supportive Women) is one of many community banks formed in the city of Cuenca, in the neighborhood of Chican, in the canton of Paute, in the south central region of the country. This canton is known because of the Paute Hydroelectric Power Plant which is the biggest in the country, and also because of their handicrafts production. Maria del Carmen is 23 years old and married; from the fruit of her union she conceived two children; one child is 5 years old and is in first grade; the other child is just two months old; her husband does stucco work (ceilings). They do not own a house and they live with her mother. She raises animals such us sheep, chickens and cattle which she sells in her neighborhood; she also buys vegetables to resell in the market of Paute; she has her own stall and only sells on Sundays; she has been doing this since she was 13 years old. This is her third loan from Fundación Espoir; the loans have benefited her to grow her business and to join the “bankito” (little bank), thanks to an invitation from her Mother. With the new loan, she will buy chicks to grow, feed, vitamins and some vegetables such as carrots, beets, radishes, chard, etc. Her goal is to build her own house. Mrs. Berta V. is 56 years old and she is has been separated from her spouse for four years because he mistreated her and caused her much suffering. In her marriage, she conceived four children of ages 33, 30, 26, and 22. Her first son is married and lives independently; the second one is out of the country so she lives with the third child, her daughter (who is single), and the youngest child who is 22. She shared with us that she is very proud to her own house from her life-long hard work. Mrs. Berta has been a member of the community bank Mujeres Solidarias for one year; the loan she received was invested in her chicken business; she grows and sells sheep, chickens and guinea pigs; she sells the animals in her community when she needs money. With the new loan, she will buy more chicks to grow, feed, and vitamins to continue her business; her goal is to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chicks to grow, feed, vitamins, and vegetables for her stall at the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: capital for businesses

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una madre de familia de 36 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el caserío Chepito, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace doce años a la crianza y venta de cerdos y aves, ella cría los animales en la parte posterior de su vivienda y los vende a los negociantes que usualmente visitan la zona en donde vive. Esta actividad es de suma importancia para la economía de su familia ya que su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y esta ocupación no le provee de ingresos permanentes.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a su familia también hizo que empezara a ahorrar dinero para adquirir una mototaxi que actualmente alquila para brindar el servicio de transporte en la zona. Con este ingreso ella y su esposo pueden mantener a su familia.

La continua demanda por cerdos en la zona han hecho que ella esté pensando en ampliar su negocio, por ese motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de cerdos medianos, alimento balaceado y en la mejora de los corrales en donde los cría, ya que no cuenta con el suficiente espacio para realizar esta acción.

Juana es una madre de familia bastante responsable y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera superior que les permita acceder a un futuro prometedor. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Juana is a 36 year old mother who lives with her husband and her two children in the hamlet of Chepito, a rural area in the district of Mórrope in the province of Lambayeque, located forty-five minutes outside of the city of Chiclayo.

She has dedicated herself for the last twelve years to raising and selling pigs and fowl. She breeds the animals in the back of her house and sells them to the dealers who visit the area where she lives. This activity is very important to their family income since her husband is a farmer and this occupation does not provide a consistent income.

The need to support their family has also caused them to start saving money to buy a motorcycle taxi which they currently lease to offer transportation services in the area. With this income she and her husband can support their family.

The continued demand for pigs in the region has gotten her thinking about expanding her business and to do this she has seen the necessity of asking for a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 nuevos soles to buy pigs, balanced feed, and improve the pens they live in since currently their is not enough space.

Juana is a very hardworking and responsible mother to her family. Her biggest wish is to be able to offer her children the opportunity to study and have a promising future. She has worked before with our institution and has shown punctuality and responsibility with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy young pigs, balanced feed, and improve the pens for her business raising pigs

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
ELIZABETH CRISTINA, (LA UBICAMOS SEGUNDA DEL LADO DERECHO D. LA FOTOGRAFÍA) TIENE 20 AÑOS, ES SOLTERA,ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO "NUEVO AMANECER" FORMADO POR 7 PERSONAS MAS. RECIENTEMENTE FUÉ ELEGIDA SECRETARIA D. SU GRUPO.
ELLA SE DEDICA A LA PREPARACIÓN D. POSTRES QUE OFRECE A LA VENTA D. FORMA AMBULATORIA. ACABA D. TERMINAR D. ESTUDIAR LA CARRERA D. GASTRONOMÍA.
POR LAS NOCHES, FUERA D. SU DOMICILIO VEND. ANTICUCHOS, RACHI, PANCITA, ETC.
SU MAYOR DESEO ES INSTALAR SU NEGOCIO D. FUENTE D. SODA Y PODER TRABAJAR EN BASE A LO APRENDIDO EN SU PROFESIÓN, PERO LE FALTA REUNIR EL CAPITAL PARA PODER ALQUILAR UN LOCAL Y EQUIPARLO.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN INSUMOS PARA LA PREPARACIÓN D. SUS POSTRES Y UNA PARTE IRA ADQUIRIENDO ALGUNOS ARTEFACTOS.
texts.en:
Elizabeth Cristina, second from the right in the photo, is 20 years old. She is single and a member of the Nuevo Amanecer group, which is maD. up of seven more people. Recently she was elected secretary of the group. She works preparing desserts which she sells door-to-door. She recently earned a degree in gastronomy. In the evenings in front of her home she sells meat kebabs, rachi (a tripe dish), pancita (a tripe stew), along with other dishes. She aspires to open a soda fountain and to be able to work using what she has learned. However, she does not have the capital to rent a location and outfit it with the necessary materials. The loan will be used to buy supplies to prepare her desserts and to rent some tools.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to make desserts

loans.name: Orquidia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Orquidia, tiene la edad de 47 años, vive en el bario 380, su negocio es una pequeña pulpería que desde hace dos años logro poner para seguir apoyando a su esposo, lo cual inicio con dinero de su liquidación como trabajadora de Enitel. Con el propósito de seguir activa en el negocio, ayudar a sus hijos con lo necesario en los pago del colegio, y poder cuidar mejor de su hogar. Su esposo trabaja como cadete de taxi. Con este financiamiento quiere invertir en granos básicos, productos enlatados, gaseosas, jugos, golosinas, y otros productos para surtir su venta ya que tiene poco inventario y la demanda es mucha. Las dificultades es que las persona que le da crédito abecés no le pagan a tiempo oh solo le dan un adelanto, el cual tiene que cubrir sus gastos en tiempo y forma. Sus planes a fututo es poder lograr hacer crecer la venta como la  captación de clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Orquidia is 47 years old and lives in the 380 neighborhood. She runs a small market, which she started two years ago in help support her husband. She started the business with money she received upon losing her job with Enitel. She wants to keep her business alive to help her pay for her children's high school and improve her home. Her husband works as a taxi driver. With this loan she will buy basic grains, canned goods, soda, juices, snack foods, and other products to stock up her store because she has little inventory due to high demand. The person who previously loaned her money sometimes did deliver the payment on time or only gave a small amount which she needs to cover her costs. Her plans for the future are to grow her sales and gain new clients.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains, snack foods, dairy products, soda, and other products

loans.name: Carmen Amelia

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 46 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el caserío Cruz del Médano, perteneciente al distrito de Mórrope, en la provincia Lambayeque, ubicado a cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la crianza y venta de aves de corral, adicionalmente vende chicha de jora (bebida típica de la zona hecha a base de maíz) y comida en su vivienda. Estas actividades le proveen de ingresos económicos que utiliza en el mantenimiento de su familia, ya que sus padres son de edad avanzada y ella vela por ellos.

Carmen cría sus aves en la parte posterior de su domicilio y las vende a los negociantes que frecuentan eventualmente la zona en la que vive. Algunas veces los sacrifica para vender comida y chicha a los trabajadores que llegan a la zona a trabajar en los campos de cultivo.

Carmen desea ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta de animales para captar mas ingresos y seguir apoyando a sus padres, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de aves de corral y su respectivo alimento para lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y que siempre busca la manera de agenciarse de ingresos para salir adelante. En la zona en donde vive ella es muy estimada por sus vecinos y conocidos, que la consideran una mujer de confianza.
texts.en:
Carmen is 46 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in the small town of Cruz del Médano, of the Mórrope district, in the province of Lambayeque, located forty five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For three years she has been raising and selling poultry. She also sells chicha de jora (a traditional drink from the area made from corn) and food from her home. These activities provide her with income that she uses to support her family. Her parents are elderly and she takes care of them. Carmen raises her birds in the back of her house and she sells them to merchants who frequent the area where she lives. Sometimes she sacrifices them to sell food and chicha to the workers who come to the area to work in the fields. Carmen wants to grow her business of raising and selling animals to have more income and continue supporting her parents. That it why she has found it necessary to ask Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles that she plans on investing in purchasing poultry and their respective food to meet her goals. She is a hardworking woman who is always looking for the way to get more income to get ahead. In the area where she lives she is very esteemed by her neighbors and acquaintances. They consider her a trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase poultry and feed to grow her business and rasing and selling birds.

loans.name: Los Emprendedores I Group

texts.es:
EL SR. FLORENCIO F., TIENE 63 AÑOS, ESTÁ CASADO Y TIENE 3 HIJOS YA ADULTOS. ÉL SE CARACTERIZA POR SER MUY TRABAJADOR Y EMPRENDEDOR, Y ES ASÍ COMO ÉL Y SUS COMPAÑEROS DENOMINARON SU GRUPO "LOS EMPRENDEDORES I", FORMADO POR 10 INTEGRANTES, QUIENES ELIGIERON AL SR. FLORENCIO F. COMO PRESIDENTE D. LA JUNTA DIRECTIVA.
HACE ONCE AÑOS SE DEDICA A LA VENTA D. CALZADO EN UN MERCADO, DOND. PUDO ADQUIRIR UN PUESTO PARA TRABAJAR. 
AL PERDER SU TRABAJO, INCURSIONA EN EL NEGOCIO D. LA PREPARACIÓN D. ALIMENTOS Y APERTURA UN CHIFA AL PASO, EL CUAL ATIEND. POR LAS NOCHES.
GRACIAS A ESTOS NEGOCIOS HA PODIDO BRINDARLE EDUCACIÓN Y PROFESIÓN A SUS HIJOS.
SU PROXIMA META SERÁ TECHAR SU CASITA, PARA LO CUAL ESTA ESFORZANDOSE MUCHO MAS.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN LA COMPRA D. CALZADO PARA INCREMENTAR SU STOCK.
texts.en:
63-year old Sr. Florencio F. is married and has three adult children. He is known for being very hardworking and enterprising--that's why he and his colleagues call their group "The Resourceful Ones". There are ten of them in the group. Sr. Florencio F. was chosen to be president of the board of directors. For eleven years ago he has run a stall selling shoes in the market, but then he lost his job and started a business preparing food. He opened a Chinese restaurant in the street which he runs at night. Thanks to these businesses he has been able to proviD. his children with an education and jobs. His next goal is to put a new roof on his house so he is working hard to get this done. The loan will be used to buy shoes to increase his supply.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Julia Nora

texts.es: Doña Julia vive en el bario Hugo Chavez, tiene 44 años de edaad, su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace varios años logro poner con ahorros y dinero de envió que su esposo manda desde el salvador, por la difícil crisis del país, no encontró trabajo el cual emigro al Salvador y de esta manera poder apoyar a sus siete hijos de los cuales solo tres trabajan y los demás estudian y son muchos gastos. Su casa aun no la han logrado terminar por completo, es de concreto y zinc forrado y las divisiones aun son de plástico negro y de tierra, pero por razones de dinero no han logrado hacer las mejoras. Con este financiamiento lograra aumentar el inventario de su venta como: granos básicos, lácteos, golosinas, productos enlatados, cereales, gaseosas, para poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes y con las ganancias ahorrar para poder de esta manera hacer las mejoras de su casa, que es lo que mas desea para sus hijos un techo digno.
texts.en:
Doña Julia lives in the neighbourhood of Hugo Chavez. She is 44 years old and runs a convenience store which she was able to start several years ago with her own savings and money sent to her from El Salvador by her husband. Because of the difficult crisis in the country, he wasn't able to find work so emigrated to El Salvador and in this way was able to support their seven children. Only three of them are working; the others are in school and have many expenses. They still haven't managed to complete their house which is made of concrete and zinc sheeting. The inside walls are still made of black plastic and earth--they haven't managed to find the money to improve them. With this loan Julia will increase the stock in her store. She plans to buy basic grains, milk products, candy, canned goods, cereals, and soft drinks, all of which are regularly asked for by her customers. She will save the profits and use the money to make improvements to the house. Her greatest wish is to have a decent home for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy basic grains, milk products, candy etc

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Dios es Amor inicia su quinto ciclo con 10 socias.
Las socias son D. la comunidad D. Pilpichaca, la comunidad se dedica en mayor proporción a la ganadería.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. golosinas, D. comida, tienda D. abarrotes, ganadería.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Mery que es casada, tiene 7 hijos que están estudiando, Mery tiene un kiosco en donD. venD. comida y golosinas, actividad que realiza todos los días, con el préstamo que obtendrá comprara golosinas variadas, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ahorrar y su sueño es aumentar su negocio y que todos sus hijos sean profesionales.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 200 soles, 400 soles, 500 soles haciendo un total D. 7,100 soles.
texts.en:
The communal bank Dios es Amor is commencing its 5th loan cycle with 10 members. The members are from the community of Pilpichaca, and the majority of the community works in agriculture. The members perform different activities such as selling sweets, food, grocery stores and agriculture. Such as the case of Mery, who is married with 7 children who are studying. Mery has a kiosk where she sells food and sweets, something she does every day. With the loan she is seeking she will purchase various sweets. In her communal bank she learned to save money and her dream is to increase her business and for all her children to be professionals. The members need different loan amounts such as 200 soles, 400 soles, 500 soles, making a total of 7,100 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sweets

loans.name: Elda Yasmina

texts.es: Doña Elda es una mujer joven de 31 años de edad, desde hace varios años logro poner su propio negocio, una pulpería en donde vende una variedad de productos. Procreo cinco hijos todos estudiantes, junto a su esposo quien le ha dado para que iniciara esta venta producto de su trabajo en operador de equipos de construcción. Sus planes para el negocio es la inversión en aumentar los productos lo cual esta optando al crédito medio por el cual espera crecer.  Con este crédito comprara granos básicos, cereales, lácteos, golosinas, gaseosas, productos enlatados para aumentar las ventas y lograr la captación de clientes, lo que desea a futuro es comprar vitrinas y poner venta de cosméticos, aretes, lentes para atraer la atención y con esto lograr mejores ganancias ya que tiene que dar educación a sus cinco hijos y todo esta caro es por eso, desea evolucionar para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Elda is a 31 year old young woman who some years ago started her own business: a small store where she sells a variety of products. She gave birth to five children with her husband who gave her something to start this business, with the product of his work as a construction equipment operator. All of her children are students. Her plans for the business are to invest in increasing the amount of products and this is why she is asking for a loan that she hopes will allow her to grow. With this loan she will buy basic grains, cereal, dairy products, candy, sodas, and canned goods to capture customers. Her wishes are that in the future she can buy glass displays to be able to sell cosmetics, earrings, and eyeglasses to get attention and through this increase her profits since she has to provide an education for her five children; everything is expensive and she wants to evolve for the well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy basic grains, cereal, dairy products, candy, sodas, and canned goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For new staff and a laptop

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula tiene 32 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a sus dos hijos en el caserío Santa Isabel, una zona rural  del distrito de Mórrope, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica al comercio de aves de corral y de cerdos desde hace doce años, ella cría aves de corral y las ofrece en venta a los comerciantes que usualmente visitan la zona. Adicionalmente compra cerdos para criarlos y vender su carne por kilos luego de sacrificarlos. El negocio es de mucha importancia para su familia ya que les brinda los recursos que necesitan para salir adelante, además gracias a el sus vecinos se agencian de carne para su consumo, la cual no les es muy accesible dado que la zona en donde vive se ubica lejos del mercado más cercano.

Paula desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de aves de corral y cerdos medianos con su respectivo alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio, como  no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer luchadora que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de su condición de madre soltera. Sus vecinos y conocidos la estiman mucho y la consideran una mujer responsable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Paula is 32 years old, separated from her spouse, and lives with her two children in the village of Santa Isabel, a rural district in the District of Mórrope, Lambayeque Province. This community is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Paula has been selling poultry and pigs for twelve years. She sells the poultry to traders who usually visit the area. In addition, she buys pigs to raise and then sells the meat by the kilo after butchering them. This business is of great importance to her family because it provides the necessary resources for them to move forward. Her neighbors request meat from her to consume because it is not readily available since the area where they live is located far away from the nearest market.

Paula wants to expand her business by buying poultry, medium-sized pigs, and balanced animal feed. Since she does not have enough capital to do this, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1200 PEN. Paula is a woman who has fought to get ahead despite her status as a single mother. Her neighbors and acquaintances respect her greatly and consider her to be a responsible and trustworthy woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase poultry, pigs, and animal feed to expand her business

loans.name: Karina Ruth

texts.es:
Karina tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el caserio Rama Tepo, una zona rural del distrito de Mochumí, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace ocho meses a la venta de abarrotes en general en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Este negocio es importante porque le brinda los ingresos necesarios para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento de su familia ya que, como su padre trabaja en la agricultura, necesitan de una actividad que les brinde recursos permanentes para poder salir adelante.

El negocio goza de mucha acogida gracias a la calidad de trato que ofrece y a que la bodega les provee de productos de consumo diario que no pueden obtener facilmente ya que la zona en donde viven se encuentra alejada del pueblo más cercano.

Karina desea ampliar su negocio para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de abarrotes para lograr su objetivo.

Karina es una joven responsable y que gusta mucho de la actividad que realiza. Sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una persona de confianza. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria.
texts.en:
Karina is 26 years old, single, and lives with her parents and siblings in the village of Rama Tepo, a rural area in the District of Mochumí, Lambayeque Province. This community is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past eight months, Karina has been selling groceries from a store she established in her home. This business is important because it provides the necessary income to cover her personal expenses and support her family. Her father works in agriculture, but they need an activity that provides a stable income so that they can get ahead.

Karina’s business has been well-received thanks to the quality of service that she provides. Her store provides daily consumer products that are not readily available in the area because they live far away from the nearest town.

Karina wants to expand her business so that she can meet the demand of her customers. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that she can invest in the purchase of groceries and achieve her objective. Karina is a responsible young woman who enjoys her work. Her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be a trustworthy person. Karina's greatest wish is to continue growing as an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Tereza De Jesús

texts.es:
En el barrio las Colinas  Municipio de Somotillo 
La señora A. C.    realiza su trabajo como vendedora de ropa ambulante dando cobertura alos clientes de las comarcas y alos del casco urbano.
 Ella quiere el crédito para comprar de  10 bolsas de cemento  para la construcción de una cocina en su casa de habitación y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y de sus familiares
texts.en:
In the Colinas neighborhood of the Municipality of Somotillo A. C. works as a traveling clothing vendor, serving clients in the towns and in the city. She wants the loan to buy 10 bags of cement to build a kitchen in her house so she can improve living conditions for her and her family members.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 bags of cement to build a kitchen in her house.

loans.name: Idania Ya Jaira .

texts.es:
En el barrio Francisco Reyes   Municipio de Somotillo 
La señora G. P. realiza su trabajo como agente de ventas en la empresa de Almacenes tropigas atendiendo alos clientes que diariamente los visitan de las diferentes comarcas como alos del casco urbano del municipio de Somotillo
 Ella  quiere el crédito para comprar de  20 bolsas de cemento de 5 quintales de hierro   para la construcción de una pared en su casa de habitación y de esta manera tener una mejor seguridad para ella y  su familia.
texts.en:
In the Francisco Reyes neighborhood, part of the Somotillo Municipality, Mrs. G. P. works as a sales agent in the Tropigas (cooking gas) Warehouse. She takes care of customers who visit daily from different areas such as the city center of the Somotillo Minicipality. She would like the loan in order to buy 20 bags of cement and 5 hundred-weight of iron. These will be used to build a wall around her house and in this way obtain greater security for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 bags of cement, 5 hundred-weight of iron and the workers wages in order to build a wall in her house.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma tiene 47 años de edad, es viuda y vive junto a un hijo en el caserío San Pedro de Sasape, ubicado en el distrito de Illimo, en la provincia de Lambayeque, a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales desque que era muy joven. Ella cría aves de corral en un ambiente ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio y los vende a los negociantes que visitan la zona con frecuencia. Adicionalmente esta instalando en su hogar un pequeño establecimiento en donde vende chicha de jora (bebida típica de la zona hecha a base de maíz), cerveza y vino. Estos ingresos son la principal fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta y gracias a ellos está saliendo adelante.

Irma desea ampliar su negocio para poder agenciarse de mas ingresos con los cuales pueda obtener una mejor calidad de vida, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitan comprar mas animales y mas bebidas para lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer que ha podido salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades que se le han presentado, anteriormente ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado tranquilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Irma is 47 years old, widowed, and lives with a son in the village of San Pedro de Sasape, which is located in the District of Illimo, Lambayeque Province. This community is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Irma has been raising and selling animals since she was a young woman. She raises poultry in an area located behind her house and sells them to traders who frequently visit the area. In addition, she set up a small space where she sells “chicha de jora” (a traditional beverage of the area that is made of corn), beer, and wine. The earnings from these businesses are her main source of income with which she is able to get ahead.

Irma wants to expand her business so that she will be able to earn more income with which she can improve her quality of life. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN so that she can buy more animals and more beverages to achieve her goal.

Irma is a woman who is able to succeed despite the difficulties she has experienced. She has worked with our Institution before and has demonstrated that she can complete her payments on time without incident.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals & beverages to expand her businesses

location.town: Sector San Pedro de Sasape - Illimo - Lambayeque

loans.name: Silvia Del Carmen .

texts.es:
En el barrio Germán Pomares   Municipio de Somotillo 
La señora B. G.  realiza su trabajo como  promotora del plan de ayuda alos niños pobres de occidente de Nicaragua
 Ella quiere el crédito para la compra de 15 bolsas de cemento Y  7 quintales de hierro  para la construcción  de un cuarto en su casa de habitación y de esta manera mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
In the Germán Pomares neighborhood, part of the Somotillo Municipality, Mrs. B. G. works as a an coordinator of the plan to help poor children from the west of Nicaragua. She would like the loan in order to buy 15 bags of cement and 7 hundred-weight of iron. These will be used to build a bedroom in her home and in this way improve the living conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 bags of cement and 7 hundred-weight of iron for the construction of a new room in her home.

loans.name: José María

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo comarca las mariitas sector el espino el señor José María O. B. a dedicado la mayor parte de su vida al desarrollo de actividades agropecuarias como la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y aviar, también establece cultivos de subsistencia como Maíz, Ajonjolí, y sorgo, los cuales a demás de proveerle parte de sus alimentos le aseguran una buena cantidad de ingresos con los que puede desarrollar un poco mas su finca, dichas actividades son realizada con sus cuatro hijas y su hijo los que contribuyen su fuerza de trabajo y dirigen las actividades productivas, sin embargo el señor José María O. B. necesita el crédito para realizar la compra de dos bueyes que le aseguran una gran ayuda en sus que haceres diarios, se le han financiado tres créditos con los que ha mejorado su hato ganadero e incrementado sus ingresos.
texts.en:
In the Somotillo Municipality part of the Las Maritas district in the El Espino sector, Mr. José María O. B. has dedicated the majority of his life to the development of farming and livestock activities. He raises cattle, pigs and poultry. He has also established subsistence crops such as corn, sesame and sorghum which, besides providing part of his nutritional needs, also constitute a good source of income. With his income, he is able to further develop his farm. He does all this farming with the help of his four daughters and his son who contribute the labor and manage the production activities. Nevertheless, Mr. José María O. B. requires the loan in order to purchase two oxen that will be a huge help with the daily chores. His previous three loans have been used to improve his herd of cattle and in this way increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy oxen.

loans.name: Melida

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo comarca Palo grande sector Santa Paula, la señora Melida M. M. ha dedicado parte de su tiempo para el desarrollo de actividades agropecuarias como es la crianza de ganado bovino, porcino y aviar, también se destacan los cultivos como el Maíz, ajonjolí y frijol blanco, dichas actividades van acompañadas con el desarrollo de un pequeño negocio de abarrotería por ser uno de las comarcas mas lejanas del municipio, lo cual le beneficia esta actividad comercial, con la cual se ayuda a financiar las actividades agropecuarias, las que le dirigen su hijo e hija respectivamente, con el crédito solicitado pretende mejorar su pulpería y comprar insumos para el ciclo agrícola de primera, la señora Melida M. M. ha tenido cinco créditos con los que ha logrado comprar 10 vacas paridas las que le aseguran gran parte de sus ingresos actualmente
texts.en:
In the Municipality of Somotillo, the town of Palo Grande, in the Santa Paula sector, Melida M. M. has worked part-time in farming activities, such as raising cattle, pigs, and domestic fowl. She also farms corn, sesame, and white beans. Her agricultural activities are accompanied by running a small grocery store. Since this is one of the most distant towns in the municipality, she has benefited by having this business. Earnings from the grocery store business finance her farming activities, which are managed by her son and daughter. With the requested loan, she intends to improve her grocery store and buy inputs for the first planting of the agricultural season. Melida M. M. has had five loans, with which she has managed to buy 10 cows that had recently given birth. These cows provide her with a significant portion of her current income.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy merchandise and inputs for the first planting of the agricultural season

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo comarca el Rodeíto el señor Teodoro H. V.se ha dedicado al desarrollo de productos agropecuarios, dentro de los que destacan los cultivos como el maíz, ajonjolí, sorgo, y en menor escala frijoles, también se dedica a la crianza de ganado bobino porcino y aviar así como también a especies menores como las cabras y ovejos, dichas actividades las realiza en conjunto con su familia la cual consta de su esposa y sus tres hijos los que contribuyen a realizar todas las actividades productivas de la finca, el señor Teodoro H. V.ha tenido tres créditos con los que ha logrado comprar cuatro vacas las que están en plena producción y con el financiamiento que esta solicitando pretende comprar una yunta de bueyes los que contribuyen en gran parte la fuerza motriz para estos productores y los que le aseguran un buen desarrollo para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo, in the district of Rodeíto, Mr. Teodoro H. V.makes a living developing products for farming for people who work with crops like: corn, sesame, sorghum, and on a lesser scale, beans. He also raises bovine cattle, pigs, and poultry as well as minor species like goats and sheep. He does this with the help of his family, his wife and three children, who all help with with work on the farm. Mr. Teodoro H. V.has had three loans that have helped him buy four cows that are currently used in production. He hopes to buy a pair of ox with the loan he is soliciting that will contribute a great deal as the driving force for these producers and those that assure him of good development of his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a pair of ox

loans.name: Mrs. La Lach Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 13 people who all live in Boeng Kandal village in Kandal province. Mrs. La L. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will all use their loans for different purposes. 
Mrs. La L. and her husband, Mr. Seng Yorn, are farmers who hire a plot of land to grow vegetables to sell in order to support their family. Although they work hard, they do not earn sufficient income. Therefore, in order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. La L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding to start a new business. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are enrolled in a local public school, while the other is too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding

loans.name: Mrs. Touch Brok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 13 people who all live in Boeng Kandal village in Kandal province. Mrs. Touch B. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will all use their loans for different purposes. 
Mrs. Touch B. is a mother of seven children – one is a teacher in a local school, one is a laborer, and the others are enrolled in the local public school. She and her husband, Thou Ngan, are farmers who own a 2.5-hectare piece of land to grow vegetables to sell to support their family. In their vegetable field, they have a problem because the soil is infertile. Therefore, Mrs. Touch B. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she would like to hire farm laborers to plow her field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers to plow the field

loans.name: Carlos Adonis

texts.es: En el municipio de somotillo comarca Rodeo grande el señor Carlos Adonis H. N. dedica parte de su tiempo al desarrollo de actividades agropecuarias como la crianza de ganado en los que se destaca el ganado bobino, porcino y aviar así como  algunos cultivos como el Maíz, sorgo entre otros los que desarrolla en compañía de su esposa, también tiene un empleo como  docente de un colegio de secundaria con el cual financia la mayoría de sus actividades productivas, con el crédito que solicita pretende compra dos vacas paridas con las que espera mejorar sus condiciones  y mejorar su hato ganadero y así desarrollar su economía familiar, al realizar inversiones productivas para aumentar su capital de trabajo, con el credito anterior realizo la compra de un semental
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo in the Rodeo Grande district, Señor Carlos Adonis H. N. dedicates part of his time to the development of agricultural activities such as raising cattle, pigs, and poultry. He also grows crops like corn and sorghum, among others. He carries out this work with his wife. He also has a job as a high school teacher. Earnings from this job finance most of his agricultural activities.

With the loan applied for he intends to but two calves. He hopes to raise them and improve the condition of his herd and, thus, increase his family’s income. With a previous loan, used to increase his working capital, he acquired a bull for breeding.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two calves.

loans.name: Mrs. Koem Kruoch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of eight people who live in Boeng Kandal village in Kandal province. Mrs. Koem K. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will all use their loans for different purposes. 
Mrs. Koem K. and her husband, Mr. Phen Yorn, are farmers who own an one-hectare piece of land to grow vegetables to sell to support their family. Through this activity, the couple supports four children who are all attending the local public school. In the vegetable field, they have a problem because the soil is infertile and far from the irrigation system. Therefore, in order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Koem K. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Mrs. Thy Sie Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 12 people from Boeng Kandal village in Kandal province. Mrs. Thy S. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will all use their loans for different purposes.
Mrs. Thy S. is a mother of four children, three of whom attend a local public schoO. and the other of whom is too young to work or study. She and her husband, Mr. Sok Chuon, are farmers who own a three-hectare piece of land to grow crops for sale to support their family. They work hard, but still do not earn sufficient income because their field is far from an irrigation system, has infertile soil, and contains a lot of insects. Therefore, in order to improve their vegetable production, Mrs. Thy S. has decided to apply for a loan to buy gasoline, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.use: To buy gasoline, fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Mrs. Maly Linh Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of eight people who all live in Khpob Kraom village in Kandal province. Mrs. Maly L. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will all use their loans for different purposes.
Mrs. Maly L. is a mother of three children, one of whom is a beautician in a local village while the others are enrolled in the local public school. Mrs. Maly L. is a fruit seller and her husband, Mr. Sythorn Chen, is a teacher in a local school. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit for resale.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Ya Sarin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of ten people who all live in Khpob Kraom village in Kandal province. Mrs. Ya S. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will all use their loans for different purposes.
Mrs. Ya S. is a mother of three children who all attend the local public school. She is a pig breeder and her husband is a noodle seller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Therefore, in order to improve her breeding pig, Mrs. Ya S. is asking for a loan to buy pig food.

loans.use: To buy pig food

loans.name: Vilma Raquel

texts.es: Vilma Raquel C. C. de 26 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque, ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su hermana quien trabaja como comerciantes, junto a sus dos hijas y una sobrina, todas menores de edad, las cuales se dedica a estudiar. Desde hace 6 años que Vilma se dedica a la elaboración de queso, el cual posteriormente lo comercializa en el mercado de Cojutepeque, lugar en el cual también vende diferentes tipos de carne de pollo congelada. Este ha sido un negocio muy bueno para ella, ya que ha sido a través de este como ha podido salir adelante junto a sus hijos, brindándoles todo lo necesario a sus hijos como alimentación y estudios. Vilma solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar todos los ingredientes necesarios para poder elaborar el queso, el cual lo elabora en su casa de forma artesanal, este tipo de queso es muy vendido ya que hay una gran variedad de ellos y sus precios son un poco más bajos que los quesos procesados. Vilma desea mucho salir adelante y poder mejorar sus ventas para beneficiar a su familia de una mejor manera.
texts.en:
Vilma is 26 years old and lives in Cojutepeque that is located in the department of Cuscatlán. She lives with her sister who works as a merchant along with her two daughters and a niece who are all minors and are studying. For the past six years Vilma has been making cheese. She sells her cheese in the Cojutepeque market, at a place where they sell different types of frozen chicken. This is a good business for her as she is able to provide for her children’s food and education. Vilma is asking for this loan so that she can buy the ingredients she needs to make her cheese. It is artesian cheese that she makes in her home. She is able to easily sell the cheese as she provides a large variety of it and her prices are a little cheaper than processed cheese. Vilma would like to progress and improve her sales, which will greatly benefit her family.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy ingredients to use to make cheese

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Mrs. Chanthry Soy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 12 people who are all villagers in Khpob Kraom village in Kandal province. Mrs. Chanthry S. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will all use their loans for different purposes.
Mrs. Chanthry S. is an animal food seller in the local village and her husband, Mr. Kim K., is a traditional medicine seller. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Therefore, in order to improve her family's living conditions, Mrs. Chanthry S. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more pig food for resale. She is a mother of five children, one of whom helps her to sell animal food, while the others attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more pig food for resale

loans.name: José Moisés

texts.es: José Moisés Q. C. de 49 años de edad, reside en Cojutepeque, ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su esposa quien se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, junto a un hijo y su padre de 69 años de edad, quien trabaja como vendedor de billetes de lotería. Al igual que su padre José se dedica a la venta de billetes de lotería, los cuales comercializa de forma ambulante por los parques de Cojutepeque, San Vicente y otros pueblos más. Desde hace 15 años que José se gana la vida de esta manera, lo cual le ha traído muchos beneficios, ya que a pesar que es un trabajo bastante riesgoso y pesado, le ha permitido brindarle todo lo necesario a su familia, la cual depende por completo de él.  José solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder comprar mayor cantidad de billetes de lotería, ya que gracias a todos los años que posee de trabajar de esta manera cuenta con muchos clientes, quienes tienen por costumbre comprar este tipo de lotería, lo cual es de mucho beneficio para José.
texts.en:
José Moisés Q. C., 49, lives in Cojutepeque, located in the department of Cuscatlán. He lives with his wife who dedicates herself to the household tasks, and his son and 69 year-old father, who sells lottery tickets. Just like his father, Jose sells lottery tickets, which he markets as a street vendor in the parks of Cuscatlán, San Vincente, and other towns. Jose has made his living this way for 15 years; it has brought him many benefits, in spite of the fact that it is a job that is risky and difficult. This job has allowed him to provide everything his family needs, and they depend entirely upon him. Jose requests a loan that he will to use to buy a greater quantity of lottery tickets, since thanks to all of his years of experience he has many customers who frequently buy lottery tickets, so this is very beneficial for José.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets to sell

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: María Estebana

texts.es: María Estebana C. P. de 56 años de edad, reside en Santa Rosa de Lima, ubicado en el departamento de La Unión. Vive junto a su esposo y su hija de 18 años de edad, quien se dedica a estudiar ultimo año de bachillerato. María posee una venta de ropa interior, escobas, lazos, bolsas con agua y bebidas en lata, venta la cual esta ubicada enfrente de su casa, la cual se encuentra sobre la calle principal del lugar en donde circulan muchas personas a pie, así como también personas en el transporte públicos, lo que permite que su venta sea muy visible para muchas personas. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa, ya que es este el fuerte de su negocio, aumentando las unidades de prendas de vestir comprando mayor cantidad de tallas, estilos y colores con e fin de poder abarcar mayor cantidad de clientes, lo cual será de mucho beneficio tanto para ella como para su familia.
texts.en:
María is 56 years old and lives in Santa Rosa de Lima, which is located in the department of La Unión. She lives with her husband and 18-year-old daughter who is finishing her last year of high school. Maria sells underwear, brooms, ribbon, water bottles and canned drinks. Her store is located in the front of her house, which is located on the main street. There is a lot of foot traffic as well as people using public transportation on the street. This provides a lot of visibility for her business. Marîa is looking for a loan so that she can buy more clothes, as clothes are the best selling item in her business. She would like to buy more sizes, colors and styles of clothes. In this way she will be able to attract more customers. This will benefit both María and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy clothes

location.town: Santa Rosa de Lima, departamento de La Unión

loans.name: Mrs. Muoyheang Seng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which consists of nine members, is located in Tuol Spueu village in Kandal province. Each of the members plans to use their loan proceeds for a different purpose.

Mrs. Muoyheang S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the other members. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectare (2.5-acres) of land on which she grows vegetable to sell to earn some money to support her family. Since her field is going well, she wants to use her proceeds to buy taro root and ginger root to grow.

Mrs. Muoyheang S. is a widow with five children, one of whom is an electrician, another one is employed in the telephone company, another is a farmer, and the others are enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy taro root and ginger root to grow

loans.name: Ana Guadalupe

texts.es: Ana Guadalupe M. D. A. D. 32 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja para una empresa privada, y junto a sus dos pequeños hijos D. 7 y 2 años D. edad, D. los cuales el mayor asiste a la escuela, y el menor esta a cuidado D. Ana. Ella posee una tienda D. abarrotes en la cual comercializa pollo, verduras, aderezos, golosinas y otros más, el negocio a penas esta creciendo ya que cuenta con año D. poseerlo, ha pesar D. esto tiene muchos clientes los cuales le comprar semanalmente, así también la tienda esta ubicada en calle principal lo cual la hace aún más visible para todas las personas. Ana solicita un préstamo a Integral, con el fin D. poder aumentar su inventario, adquiriendo todos los productos necesarios, para poder contar con más clientela. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo D. poder crecer en su negocio y D. esta manera aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ana Guadalupe M. D. A. is 32 years old and resides in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband, who works at a private business, and their 2 children, ages 7 and 2. The older child attends school while Ana takes care of the toddler. Ana has a grocery store, where she sells poultry, vegetables, seasonings, candy and more. The business hasn't grown much because it has only been operating for 1 year. Despite this, Ana has many customers who shop weekly. The store is located on a main street, which makes it more visible to shoppers. Ana is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral, with the intent of increasing her inventory to incluD. more basic goods in order to attract more customers. She does this in hopes that her business will grow and her sales will increase.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of basic goods for grocery store inventory.

loans.name: Santos De Jesús

texts.es: Santos de Jesús E. de 54 años de edad, reside en  Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a cinco hijos de los cuales los tres mayores le ayudan con el negocio, y junto a dos nietos. Santos posee una venta de piñatas, dulces, platos y cucharas y todos los accesorios necesarios para poder hacer una fiesta de cumpleaños y otros eventos especiales. Así mismo comercializa flotadores, lentes para sol, pegamentos, y productos plásticos; el negocio esta ubicado en el centro de Santa Tecla, en uno de los lugares que más comercio posee ya que todos los negocios en este lugar venden por mayoreo. Santos solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar papel, alambre  pegamentos para la elaboración de piñatas que posteriormente comercializa en su negocio, así mismo aumentar todos sus productos para poder atender mayor cantidad de clientes. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo de poder mejorar su calidad de vida junto a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Santos de Jesús E., 54, lives in Santa Tecla, located in the department of La Libertad. She lives with 5 children, 3 of whom are grown and help her with her business, and 2 grandchildren. Santos has a business selling piñatas, candy, plates, spoons and all of the accessories needed to be able to have a birthday party or other type of special event. She also sells pool floats, sunglasses, adhesives and plastic products. This business is located in the center of Santa Tecla, in one of the most commercial areas, as all of the businesses in this area are wholesale businesses. Santos requests a loan to buy paper, wire, and adhesives for making piñatas that she will later sell in her business. In addition, she wants to increase her products to provide a greater quantity of products for her customers. She does all of this with the desire of improving the quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make piñatas.

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Mrs. Seav Leng Ly Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people located in Tuol Spueu village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Seav L. L. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members She and husband are farmers who own 1-hectare (2.5-acres) of land on which they grow crops to sell to support their famiL..

In the vegetable field they have an obstacle because their field is far from the irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Seav L. L. decided to ask for a loan to buy a water pump.

This couple supports four children, one of whom is a farmer, while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a water pump to irrigate her crops

loans.name: Sonia Arely

texts.es: Sonia Arely G. de 23 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután. Vive junto a su padre quien trabaja como pescador, su madre la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y junto a tres hermanos todos menores de edad. Sonia se dedica a la venta de mariscos en el mercado municipal de Santa Tecla, en donde ya tiene varios años de dedicarse a esta actividad. De esta manera Sonia le brinda la ayuda necesaria a su padre para sostener su hogar, trabajando de lunes a domingo. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de mariscos, sobre todo para esta temporada de Semana Santa en la cual los mariscos se venden más ya que es una tradición. Sonia es una joven que a su temprana edad debe trabajar muy arduamente por el bienestar de su familia, por lo cual cuenta con muy buenas referencias con sus vecinos quienes la admiran por ser alguien muy responsable, la cual cuenta con muchos deseos de seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Sonia is 23 years old and lives in Jiquilisco, in department of Usulután. She lives with her father, who works as a fisherman, her mother, who is a housewife and three siblings, who are all minors. Sonia sells shellfish in the municipal market of Santa Tecla. She has been doing this for several years. By doing this job she is able to provide her parents with the help needed to support their home. She works from Monday to Sunday. She is asking for this loan so she can buy a greater quantity of shellfish, especially during holy week, when it is a tradition to eat shellfish. Sonia is a young person who, despite her youth, works very hard for the welfare of her family. The family has good references from their neighbors. They are admired because they are responsible and have a large desire to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy shellfish

loans.name: Thavy's Group

texts.en:
Six people, who live in Krang Roluos village in Kandal province, make up this group loan. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Thavy S. is the group leader who has been selected by the members. She owns a general store in the local village and she is also a pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it but does not have the money. Thus, she decided to seek a loan to buy more groceries to sell. The rest of the loan she will use to buy feed for her pigs.

Mrs. Thavy S.’s husband, Mr. Mouv H., is a farmer who owns 2-hectares (5-acres) of land on which he cultivates rice to support his family. The couple supports a child who is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Sandra Yanira

texts.es: Sandra Yanira A. C. de 39 años de edad, reside en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien se dedica a trabajar para una empresa privada, y su único hijo menor de edad, quien es estudiante. Sandra posee una pupusería y una tienda en su propia casa de habitación, en donde todas las noches se encarga de elaborar pupusas de queso, arroz, frijoles y chicharrón, así mismo durante todo el día se dedica a atender la tienda, negocios los cuales nacieron gracias a el gran deseo por parte de Sandra por contar con una vida mejor junto a su pequeño hijo y su esposo. Ella solicita un préstamo a Integral, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en ambos negocios, comprando mayor cantidad de materia prima para la elaboración de las pupusas, así mismo comprando productos perecederos y de primera necesidad. Sandra es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se esfuerza mucho por poder tener una mejor estabilidad económica y brindarle todo lo mejor a su familiar.
texts.en:
Sandra is 39 years old and lives in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband who works for a private company and her only son who is a minor child and a student. Sandra has a “pupuseria” and grocery store in her home. Every night she makes cheese “pupusas”, rice, beans and fried pig skin. All day she works at the store. This business was born from Sandra’s great desire to improve the lives of her husband and small child. She is asking for a loan from “Integral” in order to invest in her two businesses. She will buy the ingredients to make “papusas” and also perishable products and basic food products. Sandra is a hardworking woman who is able to bring a stable source of income to her family thereby providing them with a good life.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy the ingredients used to make "papusas" and perishable products

loans.name: Junilyn

texts.en:
Junilyn C. is a 37-year-old married woman from Alburquerque municipality, a part of the island province of Bohol in Western Visayas. She has two children that she sends to school and makes banana-cue, rice cakes and other delicacies to sell.

Junilyn is a member of CEVI and is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP. She will use it to buy sugar, bananas and other ingredients she needs for her food vending enterprise. Junilyn hopes to prosper in her business so she can give her children a bright future.

loans.use: To buy bananas, sugar and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily L. sells fish for a living. She is 37 years old and married with three children. Her husband goes out to sea to fish, and she sells his catch at the market.

Emily is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fishnets and other fishing tackle. She dreams of being successful in her business so she can give her children a bright future.

loans.use: To buy fishnets and other fishing tackle.

loans.name: Joaquín

texts.es: Joaquín G. de 47 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, ubicado al oriente del país. Vive junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por su esposa quien se dedica a vender ropa, y a sus dos hijas de 6 y 14 años de edad, las cuales se dedican a estudiar. Joaquín posee una venta de pescados, los cuales comercializa en su propia casa. Él cuenta con el beneficio de contar con muchos clientes, ya que ya tiene 20 años de dedicarse a este negocio, lo cual le permite ser muy conocidos por la mayoría de personas del lugar quienes prefieren comprar en su negocio ya que Joaquín vende los pescados frescos y a muy buenos precios. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de pescado sobre todo en esta temporada de Semana Santa en donde la venta de mariscos aumenta. Joaquín es un hombre muy responsable quien se esfuerza mucho por su familia, es por esta razón que el solicita un préstamo a Integral con e deseo de poder mejorar sus ventas y de esta manera contar con una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Joaquín G. is 47 years old and lives in the department of Usulután, located on the eastern side of the country. He lives with his family: his wife, who sells clothing, and his 2 daughers, ages 6 and 14, who attend school. Joaquín has a store at his house where he sells fish. He has many customers because he has been running this business for 20 years, and is well known by most of his customers. They prefer to buy from him because Joaquín stocks fresh fish at good prices. He is requesting a loan to buy greater quantities of fish for the week before Easter (Semana Santa), when seafood sales increase. Joaquín is a very responsible man who works hard for his family. He is requesting this loan from Apoyo Integral in hopes of improving his sales and thus greater financial stability.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish.

loans.name: Reth's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four people who live in Chheu Teal village in Kandal province. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Reth C. is the group leader who has been selected by the members. She and her husband are farmers who own a small piece of land on which they grow crops to earn some money to support their family.

Although they try to work hard, they earn less income than needed because they do not have enough money to do farming. Thus, in order to improve their crop, Mrs. Reth C. decided to apply for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her growing crop.

Mrs. Reth C. is the mother of six children, one of whom is a babysitter who earns a low salary, another three are enrolled in the local school, while the others are too young to go to school or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her growing crop
